Reviews.Title: “Best hotel until now”
Reviews.Author: BerilBK
Reviews.Content: Frist of all, the staff were really friendly! Every staff member knew that I would get a marriage proposal in Venice, so they treated us very excited, they were trying madly to make my husband happy (like giving gifts to us - chocolates and champagnes). The view from the hotel's restaurant is one of the best views I've ever seen. I watched the movie "The Tourist" the day before we arrived at the hotel, the expectation I felt when I watched the movie became real when I arrived there! Every Italy lover should stay at the Hotel Danieli at least once in a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - for being Venice”
Reviews.Author: G B
Reviews.Content: First of all - the concierge desk was outstanding and arriving to the entrance by water taxi is really cool! But trapped in the tourist trap of Venice it is not surprise that the staff in general do not manage to show much excitement over yet more tourists at their hotel. Fortunately we had booked through Starwoods and got upgraded and some extra smiles upon check-in, and the rooms we got were outstanding. Quality of the room service food was average for a 5-star, as was the breakfast, but the breakfast room + terrace at the top is world unique. So all in if in Venice you will be just fine to to stay here, you will be ripped off as in most tourist traps, and I guess the staff and mgmt do the best they can can to not appear as the fat cats they no doubt must be with the prices paid.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillieMillie
Reviews.Content: When we ended our 14 day mediterreanean cruise we stayed 2 extra days in Venice and stayed at The Hotel Danieli near San Marco Plaza.We used our Starwood Membership to make the reservations and had a 4 room suite with a spectacular view of the canal and had a wonderful breakfast at the rooftop La Terrezza Restaurant.Overall it was a breathtaking 3 days in romantic Venice

Reviews.Title: “Grand (in some ways)”
Reviews.Author: KBites
Reviews.Content: You cannot fail to be impressed by the grandeur of this hotel, despite its inconspicous entrance just along from the Doge's Palace. The hallway, the vast salons dripping in art and mirrors on each floor, the staircases and the stunning views from the terrace. Our room (marketed as a super deluxe something or other) was in the old building and was delightfully light and Venitian, if a tad compact. However the canal noise early the next morning led us to ask to be moved the next day which the Danieli did, and upgraded us, to a room which was actually a bit more homogenous executive style (but quiet) so that was great too. The reception staff and the concienrge staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Here's the downside for us..... dinner attracted a â‚¬16 cover charge each - now this may be fine sitting on the terrace on a summer evening, but on a rainy April night shut indoors, I did not feel this was worth it (Go to the Londra Palace for dinner instead). Plus I had left my glasses in the first room in our rush to pack. Despite two days of housekeeping and prep for further guests, the hotel could not find them. However, when I did get to the room, I quickly picked them up from under the bedside table from where they had fallen. Not a great example of their housekeeping standards. Take a duster......

Reviews.Title: “dissappointing service, sub par rooms”
Reviews.Author: yankeehotelfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights to celebrate my engagement while in Venice with the assumption that it is maintained to the highest standards of a starwood property. Far from it. For a "luxury collection" hotel, this hotel seems to manage to a different set of standards. Service was satisfactory in some areas but very poor in others. Among the worst i've experienced at a Starwood and I've been to dozens of SPG properties around the world. Good things: helpful concierges, great bell hops, good location. Poor things: inattentive front desk reception, poor room service, even the nicer rooms are terrible. I'm an SPG gold and was told I received a "double upgrade" The room was extremely tiny, faced into another building, and had an uncomfortable bed, tiny closet and desk. Even for venice this room seemed like the most basic of rooms. When asking the reception desk about it, they said they had no better rooms available. When logging onto the WiFI and begin taken directly to their site, I decided to check. Turns out there were much improved rooms that were larger with lagoon views available that day and the following day during my stay. The hotel wasnt booked up! When bringing this up with the reception, they were completely rude and said the hotel was 100% sold out. Even though it wasn't. They were suspiciously defensive in saying it too. I don't blame reception as much as management because they are probably trained to not upgrade SPG customers. They claimed they would talk to the manager and get back to me the next morning, at which point I could pay a surcharge for a lagoon view room. They never called me the next AM. They also failed to replace waters from the mini fridge and when I requested it, they said they would be right up and never came. Hands down, this property doesn't care about or honor SPG starwood status and for those of us who travel and spend our time picking out starwood properties, we should receive the benefit of the room upgrades. The service at reception was hands down the worst I've had at a hotel, even much lower grade hotels. A particular woman ignored us, and treated us very rudely during our stay. Worst service in Italy. The concierges were very helpful though and attentive which really made for a better experience. For a luxury property charging as much as they do you expect so much more. If you see Frederica at the front desk when you check in avoid her in particular. we walked up to her to ask a question a couple times and she didnt even make eye contact or say "be right with you" she just stared at her computer screen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: GrizSC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two teen children. The hotel is beautiful and perfectly situated for walking Venice's streets. Our rooms were very large and the service was impeccable. One of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Truly superb”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: An absolutely world-class, historic hotel in the perfect location. We stayed in two different lagoon-view suites - being asked whether we would mind moving from the historic room in which we spent the first night, as there were renovations taking place around that might disturb us. We ended up in the most remarkable, comfortable, tasteful suite imaginable. Sure, there are things they could fix: service in the lovely lounge was a little slow and surly, for example. But these are minor things: this is a very special place. We did have the advantage of not paying, mind, using Starpointe and suite vouchers, and choosing the free breakfast as a Platinum amenity. The published rates really are eye-watering!

Reviews.Title: “Splendour, history, location all fabulous but is it worth vast amounts of cash?”
Reviews.Author: wickedwaterwitch
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure, is my view. The restaurant really, definitely, 100% wasn't (more of that later). But I booked this because I like 5 star hotels, because the location, 3 minutes from St Marks Square, is fantastic and because, well, it's The Danieli. First impressions were fab - we got a private water taxi from the airport and I'd really recommend it, it's such an amazing way to arrive and worth every penny (about 100 euros) and they dropped us right at the door where a liveried doorman took our bags. The lobby is beautiful in an old fashioned splendour kind of way - there are loads of photos of it on here - and the check in process was efficient and friendly. We had 2 connecting rooms, without a view, sadly, as there were none available when we booked, but each had a small balcony, which was nice. I've no idea how they compare to the size of other Venice hotel rooms but there were 2 chairs, a small table and a writing desk in each room. Both rooms were the 4th category up so 2 luxury doubles. Bathrooms are fine but the literature was dog earred and tatty and the previous guest's itineriaries were stuffed in there - not what you expect really. There was an chocolate easter bunny in each room though and my children were pleased with that. Another minor gripe - there's a 15 euro charge for internet access in the rooms although this is free in the lobby for some bizarre reason and I do think this is unreasonable - we paid nearly a grand a night, c'mon, throw in some wi-fi! It might even be per device too so if you're taking 2 ipads or laptops that might translate to 30 euros per 24 hours, but I could be wrong, worth checking. Our wi-fi didn't work the first day but they sorted it pretty efficiently so that was fine. We ate in the restaurant on the first night and I wish we hadn't: this was hotel dining room food at Le Manoir prices: 4 main courses (1 ravioli, 2 x mixed fish,1 Wagu beef, which I appreciate was the most expensive dish on the whole menu, at 64 euros), 3 puddings, 1 ordinary bottle of wine and it came to about 450 euros and was really fairly unimpressive. To explain - the veg garnish on my plate was dried up and curling, the fish and pasta were nothing to write home about, ditto the puddings. So although there was nothing actually terribly wrong with it, gourmet food it was not. And we've eaten in Michelin starred restaurants - there's no comparison. I guess we were paying for the glorious view over the lagoon, the service and the fact that it's Danieli. The breakfasts on the other hand are served in the same dining room and are much, much better. The views are still there, the service is friendly and the buffet choice is vast. Bacon, sausages, waffles, fruit, smoked salmon, cereal, croissants - a huge choice and there's something for everyone. We found the waiting staff in the lobby (in white jackets! It was like being in Casablanca!) and the concierge very helpful so the service is decent enough here, as you'd expect. And it is a beautifully calm hotel and it was lovely being able to pop back to grab a scarf / rest for an hour / enjoy the hotel because of the marvellous central location. We had a fabulous time and enjoyed Venice enormously but I'm not convinced the prices are worth it. And I'd recommend avoiding the restaurant for anything other than breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The wow factor”
Reviews.Author: quiettraveller045
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night during the carnival - it's really very special. The location is perfect, the vaporetto stops outside, the building itself ornate and magical. Lovely room, didn't have breakfast, but attended the Venezia Romantica Ball, which is held here anually. Have been previously, also to the Minuet Dinner Dances - all fabulous. Bar is expensive but great for people watching. Those who've noted that the bar shuts 'early' at 1.30 don't know much about Venice - public transport is very thin on the ground after midnight (and believe it or not, bar staff have to sleep) and Venetians in general go to bed early - many bars close at 11. So my suggestion would be to the couple who were miffed about not getting a drink at 1.15 would be - go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Antique splendor”
Reviews.Author: mmichaelsinger
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is wonderful property. The old lobby, vernadas and common areas help deliver the opulant style of life in Venice of a certain period. Arriving and departing by water taxi was a luxurious Venetian experience. Our room was junior suite in the oldest building.The suite was small. The lack of light that gave the room a bit of a gloomy feeling.The bathroom was as big as the bed chamber and the most luxurious part of the accomodation. I had to keep reminding myslef that the price is for the5 star antiquity, not the 5 star comforts of a newer property. Service was slighly less than we expected. We appreciate a laid back luxury experince and normally pay to experince it.We found the staff a bit disengaged, which made us work a little harded to have our "ideal luxury" experince. As a platinum guest, i was dissappointed by their choice of suite; just above a side canal where the garbage was dumped and compacted every morning at 8:30. Completely distracting and unattractive. Room service was excellent. There for new years, we were delighted to have brunch at the roof top restaurant over lookng the lagoon. The new year's day buffet was overpriced for quality of food and preparation. We were surprised and thankful for the lack of brunch oragnization as that afforded us more time sipping Prosecco overlooking the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: rtw_traveller2012
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Danieli. Location is second-to-none, right on the Canale Grande. We traveled with public river taxi from the mainland, and found that we were dropped off right in front of the hotel. Rooms are nice - not too modern, and only offer you the basic in amenities. View from our room is nothing to write home about, as houses are built quite close together (we looked out to the right of the hotel). I am assuming there are also rooms facing the canal, but did not ask. Service really isn't their forte - but that (in our experience) is pretty much the case with most of the hotels and restaurants in Venice (there are some exceptions). If you would like to stay somewhere safe, central, comfortable, and are looking to explore the city for most of your time there (as you should!), then give this place a try. Oh, and breakfast on the roof top is *fantastic*!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a museum. Was built in XIV Century. Location is fantastic. Just a few blocks for main attractions. I really liked my room - great lagoon view, separated bedroom - pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “5 star ... Hmm.....”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G
Reviews.Content: Great location but this isn't a 5 star hotel. No facilities we could see and there was no real engagement from the staff. Air con didn't work, tv didn't work and no one seems to care as far as we could tell. Staff are surly and not friendly. That said Venice is spectacular and well worth a visit - just try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “skeleton staff on sundays”
Reviews.Author: 186338Marcb
Reviews.Content: It is a magnificient palace and the prices are in sync with its worldwide reputation: (in particular for any food & bevereage). The Terrasse restaurant has the most unique panoramic view of the lagoon. Shame that on Sundays they seem to run on skeleton staff and the level of service suffers accordingly

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations (exceeded!)”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeandJaki
Reviews.Content: We've wanted to stay here for some time so we were absolutely delighted that it truly delivered the experience we'd hoped for. We had a beautiful room overlooking the lagoon, and were able to sit on the balcony (Yes in March!) and watch the world go by along the waterfront. Our room had been recently renovated and very nicely so, all in keeping with its environment and history. The bed was 1st class ...and some. Breakfast on the terrace was a delight, with a glass of Prosecco to start the day with some fizz. Food and drink were astonishingly pricey, even for Venice, but the atmosphere is priceless. I think you can tell that we liked it...

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, hot and rude”
Reviews.Author: Hastingsresident
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel. I had been sent here on business with a group of journalists. The weather was unusually warm for March, but the hotel itself was acting as if it was December. The rooms were unbearably stuffy and about eight of us failed to get any decent amount of sleep on the first night because our rooms were too stuffy. We all opened our shutters and windows (which meant that light could enter, and noise). We were then all awakened several times in the night (when we did snatch short bursts of sleep) by the sound of rubbish/recycling being collected from the canal outside. When we complained the following morning, we were told that the air conditioning was not turned on in the hotel 'because of the regulations in Italy.' Allegedly until the end of March they have to heat the hotel! But before I could respond to this, the manager put the phone down on me. There was absolutely no sense that as customers we were valued by the hotel, which clearly coasts on its out-of-date reputation as an excellent Venetian destination. I have stayed in five-star hotels all over the world and the cavalier attitude of the Concierge and desk staff and the manager to the serious matter of the hotel being too hot to sleep in was extraordinary, not least because as journalists we have the opportunity to spread the word very rapidly about their complete lack of concern for customer comfort. No apology, no 'we wish we could help if we could' - just downright rudeness. The common parts of the hotel were roasting. The rooms themselves were unbearably hot, and the only way to cool the room in any way was to open both shutters and windows. Each time I saw the maid, I asked if the windows could be left open. Every time I returned to my room, the windows were shut again. In all my years of travel I have never encountered such a ridiculous and uncomfortable situation. After two nights of no sleep I simply could not wait to get back to my own bed, and will never, ever return to The Danieli even for a drink! So very, very disappointing. The whole experience has left quite an unpleasant taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Historic design”
Reviews.Author: ajsm
Reviews.Content: We took a vaporetto direct from Marco Polo airport, â‚¬110 plus tip. The hotel is three adjacent houses accessed, by foot, through a discreet, nearly camouflaged entrance in the middle building. There are many more rooms in these buildings than appear at first glance, with only a limited number that face the Grand Canal. We stayed in two rooms, 376 and 381, both on the highest (fourth) floor of the building closest to St. Mark's. (We did look at a room facing the Grand Canal in the building furthest from St. Mark's but the furnishings were not as new.) Room 381 has a relatively spacious balcony over the canal, which was sunny and glorious when we were there. But you pay for it, and everything else as well: breakfast is â‚¬52, cocktails â‚¬15 and an espresso is â‚¬10. However, directly beside the hotel on the St. Mark's side is an alley, Calle de la Rasse, with shops and restaurants for water, coffee, wine, ice cream, all inexpensive considering the area. Free internet wifi codes given out for the lobby also work in the rooms, but each code is good for only two devices so you may need to phone for more codes. Dinner at Osteria alle Testiere, not a long walk, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Aziza k
Reviews.Content: Whether it is the view, location or service, I highly reccommend this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. You get a fabulous view of the lagoon and the Concierge is so helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful AmEx Fine Hotel & Resort! Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: NateM5
Reviews.Content: Outstanding stay at the Hotel Danieli! Started off with a private watertaxi from the train station to the private entrance for hotel guest only at the Hotel Danieli. It was nice to walk directly into the hotel instead of having to drag out luggage through the tiny alleys, walkways, and stairs of Venice. The lobby is probably what the Hotel is best known for and is by all means as amazing as you probably have heard. It's breathtaking! Our room faced the water and although it was a little dated (definitely needs to be updated a little, but still very nice being classic). It was "fun" to have an actually key to access the room instead of the common keycard, helps to keep the hotel very original. The staff at the hotel was outstanding with a minor few who didn't seem to really care to help us and made it seem like we were more of a problem than a guest. The major complaint I would have with this hotel was that when my boyfriend switched the light on next to the bed it didn't work, he then reached down to make sure it was plugged into the wall and got SHOCKED. Neither the staff or management made any attempt to apologize or provide any way to "make it up to us" - a little disappointing, but nevertheless a wonderful location. It is a famous hotel that has many benefits. Noontime tea was delicious! :)) Safe travels and enjoy the Hotel Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location , Location!!”
Reviews.Author: sessiagh
Reviews.Content: Just home from 3 wonderful nights here- the hotel is beautiful , so full of character in the old wing . The view from the 5th floor terrace , where breakfast is served , is captivating , and the choice of fresh fruits, cheeses, breads , cooked eggs etc etc , was enjoyed . Sadly the bar charges were horrendous, so We were not tempted to hang about in the impressive surroundings ! The situation of the hotel , so close to St Marks square is terrific - and so handy to the vaparetto in and out to the airport . There are lots of lovely looking hotels in Venice - but it is so hard to find your way around the little back streets , I don't know how a new arrival would find them ! Definitely get a phone number and someone to meet you! The danieli is a perfect place for a romantic break ! Look out for special rates - We got a very good flight inclusive deal with Citalia - and make sure breakfast is included - at 52 euros it is worth it to get it included!

Reviews.Title: “Popped in for a drink ....”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: Four of us went in for a drink last week. Yes the surroundings were impressive but the drinks were very expensive. I was also upset that they would not give me the wi-fi code - only residents can use this. When I asked for it - the staff were very dismissive. I get the impression this is not the place to go for a drink only - perhaps you get better service if you are a resident. Their attitude put me off ever thinking of booking there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate the New Years!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli definitely lived up to all of our expectations. My husband and I were there for New Years 2011-2012. We made reservations for the dinner in the grand ballroom and enjoyed the celebration. It was an elegant evening. We enjoyed getting dressed in black tie attire and celebrating the evening. The food was tasty and the wine/champagne pairings were excellent. There was beautiful music during dinner and festive dancing music after dinner. The best part of the night was being able to watch the fireworks from the windows in the ballroom. The hotel was grand beyond words. If you are there for the New Years, its a must to also make reservations for the brunch in the restaurant the morning of January 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling Danieli!”
Reviews.Author: 50states7continents
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is ideally situated on the Grand Canal, near St. Mark's Square. Yes, it's expensive, but it's worth it! Where else can you step out the front door after handing the oversized tassled key to the desk agent, and enter a water taxi to whisk you around a city? Make time to explore this magnificent hotel. Hear its creeks. See its beauty. Feels its textures and heirlooms. Taste its delicious offerings. While in Venice, permit yourself to simply wander--no map, no guide, nothing----just wonder! It's magnificent! I STRONGLY recommend a water taxi ride to the island of Torcello--a far cry from the more touristy islands of Morano (the glass art) and Borano (the lace art). Torcello is literally sinking, and thus is barely inhabited--a few shops, restaurants, and a church. Visit the church and you can LITERALLY watch this historical monument crumble before your eyes.

Reviews.Title: “So worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Saskia255060
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel and absolutely loved it. The location is perfect about 100 metres to St Mark's Square and near all the great shops and restaurants. It is right on the water and easy to get to by boat. The hotel has real charm and is in typical Venetian style. The rooms are spacious by European standards, bathrooms are large and the beds are comfortable. The hotel has a really nice lounge and bar area to chill out and have drinks and a great rooftop restaurant. I would definitely stay at this hotel again because of its location, atmosphere and service. By the way, you must visit this seafood and pasta restaurant, only a couple of blocks from the hotel, it was absolutely divine: 'Corte Sconta' Calle Del Pestrin No. 3886 Ph: [...]

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hansons
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Danieli over the New Year holiday. Our 13 yr old son was booked to share our room but the hotel provided a mini suite with a separate single room for him and this worked very well for us. The hotel is beautiful, very special. The staff were all attentive and professional.

Reviews.Title: “New years in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Susan G
Reviews.Content: A perfect destination for that grim time - Christmas - New Years for us single ones. So when the opportunity to go to Venice and stay at what I feel is one of the most wonderful "old school" hotels was a dream come true. Room with a view of the Lagoon, hotel service 5 stars! City crowded, but crowded with Italians.

Reviews.Title: “A good royal classical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soori_11
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel building is very old, but it is very clean. Everything inside the hotel is very clean and arranged well. Every thing including the paintings furniture everything is very old fashioned. But in the hotel every thing take too much time. Don't expect much from the staff.The boat or water bus stops on the entrance of the hotel. You have to be very careful when you are boarding and embark the boat, the floor will be wet and slippery, if you are aged then very very careful. The number of staff you will find is less compared to other 5star hotels. The hotel rooms are very good but I think the lights are not upto the mark. Over all it is a very good experience. I like this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good value for money, yet our room was a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: Georgy D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days early January with my wife. Made a reservation for a junior suite, got upgraded to a full suite. I am still not sure what to make of it, our reservation said historical wing, I don't know whether that was supposed to be the 15th or the 19th century wing. In any case, ended up in the 19th century wing - the interior seemed a bit generic of nice classical hotels, with no particular charm, both the public areas and our room. In fact the bathrooms were a bit shabby, as was the furniture. The views were magnificent, the staff was efficient, although there was only one person at the checkout counter at the time we were leaving, and he apparently was overwhelmed, in short our checkout took 20 minutes. Oh, one thing to add - apparently a very fashionable hotel, you get treated nicely in other places, once you mention that you stay there. Finally, a suite like ours would have set us back two times more in Paris or London, so it was good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable experience of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryEllen000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Danieli Hotel, Venice, Italy for New Year's Eve. It was the Best experience!!! The hotel is so unforgettable, but you must like history. It is not new and flashy, like those of Dubai, but old and with class, real class!! Imagine staying the same hotel as the Dodge of Venice once walked! You must really look at this hotel, not judge it quickly. The suite we stayed in was in the Excelsior section, non smoking and relatively recently renovated. It was wonderful, fresh exotic flowers, marble bathroom, with everything anyone would want, a bottle of wine, chilled on arrival, everything perfect, comfortable beds, and in the most desired place in Venice, imagine. The staff where very accomodating, and pleasant. As it was New Year's Eve, many security people around making sure the hotel was for the hotel guests, which is nice. We walked outside the door to see the fireworks of New Year's Eve, beautiful, and then returned to the bar for a glass of champagne to toast the New Year, how perfect can an evening be? The only criticism would be the check in and check out time. It is too lengthy. I think it is connected to the Italian beauracracy, everything takes too much time. However, if you can be patient the results are wonderful. I think there is no place on earth with more class than the "sophisticated" end of Italy. Unfortunately the world has lost this art, even to appreciate what it is. Thank you Danieli, for such a wonderful New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in a luxury location with a luxury price tag!”
Reviews.Author: schultzemily03
Reviews.Content: If wanting to experience Venuce in its true light than this hotel is a must. We took a water taxi from the train station and arrived to the hotels private pontoon. We didn't have to worry about a thing from the moment we got there. Bags were taken care of, rooms were ready early and we had the nicest view. When you step outside the hotel everything is at your doorstep. Markets, shops, st. Marks square and restaurants. The food and room service is expensive at this hotel so we just went to local restaurants. I can't wait to return one day

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice, one of the best in the world (very expensive)”
Reviews.Author: alwaysintour
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I love to travel and I am a business traveler, so I have seen hundreds of hotels all over the world and I know exactly what I have to expect for a 5 stars luxury hotel: elegant furniture, excellent service, large room, large bathroom etc. Do this hotel have all of that? NO! But it worths all the 5 stars!! It is in the hearth of the most beautiful and incredible city in the world, attached the Doge.s palace (St Mark square), with the most astonishing hall of the world in a historical venetian palace! What do you need more? We can discuss about the square meters of the rooms, of the bathrooms, we can discuss about the number of the staff guys available, about the breakfast etc ect. But it remains one of the top ten hotels you should visit in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Royal hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FennyG77
Reviews.Content: Walking in Danieli, it does give you kind of royal feeling because of the unique and traditional decoration. We have requested the standard room with extra bed and it was all prepared for us when we arrived. It could be reached easily through water bus no 5.1 which stop just in front of the hotel, hence no need to arrange for hotel pick up or taxi at all. They also have their own gondola station though you could wonder around for those independent gondola around Venice too. The room is beautifully decorated and it has a cute small dressing room, huge bath room and comfy chair and beds. One suggestion would be the breakfast is too expensive, EUR 52 per person, and there is no package or upgrade related to include breakfast unlike other Starwood establishment that I have stayed in. I would recommend to anyone that would like to experience it and be in the centre of Venice and start your day early around San Marco and surrounding....

Reviews.Title: “outstanding visit”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireluddite
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the fond farewell this was a truly outstanding hotel experience,To stay four days and find no fault and near perfection around every corner was a testimony to the management and staff of the property and their utter professionalism and class. Venice is a theme park with garlic and gondolas and the Danieli is a fitting centrepiece and jewell.Go in the Autumn and avoid the crowds,enjoy the most idillic views from the rooftop restaurant and make sure to spend time in the lounge and watch the floorshow as performed by staff who are quite simply the best. Yes - expensive but worth every penny - save it for a very special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “opulent hotel in the midst of gorgeous venice”
Reviews.Author: GPFarm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Danieli is one of the most beautiful and opulent hotels we have ever stayed in. You feel like royalty; the atmosphere is exquisite. The location is also primo. Walking distance to everything. Be sure to get the Gondola ride with music....the most romantic way to start your evening. You pay the price at the Danieli. Beauty and perfection costs, but it was worth it for this gorgeous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BatureGermany
Reviews.Content: I plan excessively for travel. A bit too much sometimes. I am often disappointed or spend the first few hours second guessing my hotel choice when I arrive at a new hotel. However, the Danieli did not disappoint. I had been to Venice several times, and just wanted to be right off Saint Mark's Square. The Danieli is a fantastic location. If you are in the mood for more secluded or less pricey Venice, this is not the place. If you want a grand experience and want to drink in Venice as it once was and now is, the Danieli is great. Great service, great room, and quiet. I would highly suggest booking a room with breakfast included. Otherwise, the Danieli charges you an absurdly expensive breakfast charge. The breakfast is served on the top floor, with stunning views of Venice. If not included in your rate, best to avoid this costly and not one of the better breakfast choices in Venice. Book or try to get a room with a view over the water. We did, and I sat every morning for at least 1/2 hour sitting and watching the amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at its best!! Bellissima!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hrima
Reviews.Content: While in Venice for the first time, we wanted to experience the true feeling of convenience and luxury with my wife The hotel is fantastic as you enter the lobby greetings are extended by the concierge followed by the front desk The open air lobby in traditional and velvet touch gives this hotel a level of elegance. Everyone is by far courteous, professional, and downright happy. The Christmas tree in the lobby was beautiful, the carolers in the evening brought that true traditional Christmas feeling that we lack in our fast paced society, Dinner on the terrace was outstanding, with the grand canal as the backdrop The tour and gondola ride were obtained thru the concierge at the Danieli as a package deal for 39 euros pp!!!! Not bad for a tourist trap. The towel warmer in the room along with the flat screen tv and the personal message and chocolates from the maid certainly were the highlights. The hotel is on the expensive side, but certainly provides the level of service for that price range. Upgrade was possible as requested, and our wake up calls were ontime, for a 400 am wake up call to catch an early flight. The water taxi was waiting for us at the danieli personal water slip to whisk us away. A true once in a lifetime experience, find a sitter for the kids and bon voyage! The best hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Che bella!”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying for a week at the Danieli in October. We are Starwood Preferred Guest Platinum and had a very good experience when we made our reservation and were assured we would receive a room with a water view upon check in. This is not an inexpensive city, folks, so adjust your expectations accordingly. As we were arriving by train from Rome with several pieces of luggage, we decised to splurge on a private water taxi with an escort from the Danieli from the train platform to the water taxi area, about 80 euro. Worth every penny! It was pouring rain and "acqua alta" (high tide) when we arrived. As soon as we stepped off the Eurostar Italia onto the platform, we were greeted by the escort from the Danieli with a porter to take our bags to the taxi and umbrellas. She was delightful and gave us several recommendations for neighborhoods to "get lost in". Check-in did not start off well, with a disinterested and slightly grumpy desk clerk, but as soon as he saw our Platinum status, we were whisked off to a desk with a delightful young lady, Fernanda, who completed our check-in and escorted us to our beautiful suite in the 17th century building, which is still beautiful. Our suite was on the corner with 2 "Juliet" balconies facing the Grand Canal. Four rooms, high ceilings, antique furniture, marble bathroom, Murano glass light fixtures and a bottle of Prosecco on ice; what's not to love? The second level Riva Degli Schiavone-facing location was a bit noisy, but we loved every minute of it. The room key was an actual key with a brass topped silk tassel attached which we had to leave with the desk each time we left the hotel, which they would put in a little wooden cubby hole. Some would find this annoying; I found it charming. SPG Platinum members who are accustomed to the St. Regis brand may be disappointed. The hotel is very old, encompasses 3 palazzi, and is not what you would call "polished": the floors slope, the furniture is old and not terribly comfortable, it is incredibly easy to get lost in here, but come on, folks, you're in Venice! When else can you experience a hotel such as this? If you're looking for a pristine, sparkling, boring hotel, book somewhere else. The staff was pleasant, if a bit formal, but always "buon giorno" and 'buona sera". The Danieli is a unique property and the view of the lobby alone is amazing. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I had expected ..”
Reviews.Author: Curious_Traveller636
Reviews.Content: I was initially put off by some of the photos on their website - dark and seemingly very old fashioned - but it wasn't that at all. The best bits are the staff are very welcoming and the concierge(s) are very helpful, the bar is lovely (pre and after dinner drinks) and the breakfast (make sure you get an inclusive package as it is a killer otherwise at 40+ euros). The location is also excellent. We stayed in the Casanova building and it was lovely. The room was large enough and amenities - the bathroom etc - were fine. We had problems with the heating - too stuffy - so we had to sleep with the windows open and then you appreciate you are staying in a working city, because we could hear boats etc seemingly all night. At least 2 of the 3 nights were disturbed sleep. My only gripe and it probably affects all of the major hotels, esp in Europe, is why don't they provide wi-fi for free? You are already paying 350-400 euros a night and not to get this for free, is a bit cheap. They wanted another 15 euros a day. Overall, having gone with low expectations because it wasn't my first choice, the hotel did exceed my expectations and I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “over and over again”
Reviews.Author: Valentina30
Reviews.Content: I love the Danieli, i always did,IÂ´m a kind of person that doesnÂ´t look for luxury itself,once in a hotel, but I do mind for a clean and confortable room, a planty and copious coffee-buffet breakfast each and every morning, IÂ´m a very individualist person while on trips, being alone. I love the Danieli, its eldely atmosphere, slightly frightening , but yet where I fell taking cover of something unknown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Danieli”
Reviews.Author: Tybas
Reviews.Content: Have nothing but great things to say about the Danieli. It captures all the allure of Venice and the location can't be beat. Loved the old interior of the hotel with many of the original details of the Palzzo intact. We had an Executive Suite and the size, while not huge, was perfect for the three of us (we had our 5 year old in tow). The location of the hotel is perfect, just a half block from the Bridge of Sighs and a block from St. Mark's Square. The bed was comfortable and room very quiet (we faced St. Mark's Campanile). The room was clean and we loved the antique furnishings. We did not dine in the restaurant, but did take a peak of the view from the terrace which has to be one of the best in Venice. Public transportation is very handy with water taxis and buses right out front. All in all we had a great experience at the Danieli!

Reviews.Title: “Super location !!”
Reviews.Author: Rachit R
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night as had to travel to Rome the next day but made full use of the hotel's location which is bang on the St Marks square and we could venture out on foot to the bylanes for shopping. Relaxed over a cup of Cappucino at Riolta Bridge. Spent time at the square amongst 100s of people, shot pictures, rode a gondola. The hotel's lobby is a Wow, room comfortable, efficient service, good food, terrace bfast great. Missed however, a magazine or tea/coffee ensemble in room which was there in other hotels in Florence & Rome. An ideal place to stay in Venice. Wish i had more time on hand.

Reviews.Title: “Lights, Camera, NO Action!”
Reviews.Author: GLOB3TR0TT3R
Reviews.Content: Stayed in ther Danieli purely because the idea of using the same bathroom and bedroom as the lovely A. Jolie was too tempting. Made a number of calls to the reservation centre and got myself a 4night stay including 1 night in the suite used for the movie. Arriving in Venice i was met at the airport and escorted to my private speedboat (more James Bond than the tourist). Arriving at the hotel you are taken to a private side entrance instead of having to walk the 10metres from the Gondola moorings to the main hotel entrance. Walking into the hotel you are immediately struck with the scale of this old palazzo building and the huge sweeping staircase looks as grand as it does in the movie. Once they had found my reservation I was whisked upto someone elses room, then taken across to a seperate part of the hotel and up some stairs to my...no hang-on someone elses room...hmmmm...at this point the girl admits that she is new and does not know the entire layout of the hotel. So; we help each other back down to reception where a more experiences person can show me to my room. At no point did anyone apologise and infact they made me feel like it was my fault, a tone that did not change with any of the reception staff suring my stay. Once in the room I was again struck with the beauty, age, size and VIEW from the room, overlooking the lagoon with a clear view of the Giudecca I spent about 40minutes just standing on 1 of the 3 balconies I had access to. For it's location, views and history the Danieli is an attraction with-in Venice. But as a 5* hotel it sadly lacks the staff and professionalism you would expect. Also during my advenure at check-in I managed to see 2 other "standard" rooms and they were very very small and considering the time of day very dark too! Do not stay here unless you can afford the suites or grand rooms, Venice has enough charm and character of its own that no standard hotel room can compete with.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: PDWYERConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Danieli Oct 5th and 6th in 2011. Arriving by water taxi from the airport, we were checked into two rooms facing the lagoon. My daughter and son-in-law and my wife and I were stunned at the beauty of the hotel lobby and public areas. Our rooms were both roomy and well appointed. Our room included a balcony with a view of the lagoon and the canal to the entrance to the Danieli. I took an extravagant amout of photos ot the lobby and second floor of the old hotel with it's museum quailty paintings and architecture. The service was first rate and the hotel staff was both professional and friendly. We ate at the rooftop restaurant one night and had a spectacular meal. The view from the restaurant was beautiful at night and we felt the surroundings and meal were the things that made for lifetime memories. The prices were on the expensive side for both the hotel and the restaurant but we got what we paid for; a trip of to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, especially the location”
Reviews.Author: MiMoLondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend here with a girlfriend. It was a present to me so I can't comment on value for money but it was fabulous. Three things stood out: -(1) the receptionists were extremely helpful (booking restaurants, cancelling reservations, taxis, as you'd expect); (2) the location is a dream; and (3) the rooftop restaurant with unparalleled views. I went for a run every morning along the Riva to the gardini publicci and I think that would be difficult to do without getting lost from almost any other hotel. That was an absolute joy. One of the two days we were there the balcony on the roof was open and it was glorious to sit there for breakfast. Just don't ask the waiter to take your photo, he was very obliging but not exactly a brilliant photographer! ;) II reccomend, assuming you can afford it or know someone else who can!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views and location”
Reviews.Author: chudson1
Reviews.Content: The location of the Danieli must be the best in Venice - on the water front and right in the centre of everything you would want to see. The real amazing highlight for us was having breakfast in the roof-top restaurant. The views are beyond breath-taking. The breakfast was delicious and service excellent, a real experience not to be missed. Our room was lovely, though the service at the hotel was just OK. They had lost our booking when we arrived and we had to wait an hour while they checked everyone else in and had, evidently, forgotten about us. They did offer a complimentary drink while we waited, though they were not very friendly or quick to sort things out. A real disappointment. Other than that, the entrance hall is beautiful, the room and bathrooms are luxurious and the location is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WellsGalNorthNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute break to Venice never having been there before, and arrived at the Danieli Hotel a little earlier than we were able to check in, no problem we left our luggage and went out to explore. We returned a couple of hours later and were shown to a lovely room with an extra large bed and beautiful bedding. The room had a dressing room, shower/bathroom with a basin, and a toilet with bidet and basin, lovely toiletries too. Breakfast was absolutely fabulous with a gorgeous view from the dining room. The hotel was very luxurious and the staff very professional, although drinks and dinner at the hotel were very expensive we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Danieli - A lovely Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: MaheshKhubchandani
Reviews.Content: The concierge services here are brilliant. Very well informed and most helpful concierges.The location is fabulous, most accessible from all the exciting activity in Venice. It is just a stone throw from the Vaporetti stop and also has its own boat pier both outside and besides the hotel. The lobby and interiors are truly beatiful and the palaces are well maintained and beautifully restored. The piano player in the lounge every evening definitely lifts up the mood. Great to sit around while using the free wireless access in that area on your own device. The breakfast on the Terrazza is most wholesome and plentiful with a very wide selection. Overall fab experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place to treasure always”
Reviews.Author: bluebeetleEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Danieli to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary. We were collected by taxi and then private launch and arrived at the hotel in style avoiding massive queues at the airport and water taxi station. Everything was perfect, the room, the staff, the food, the amazing place, champagne etc on arrival. We were made to feel like film stars the whole time. We are already booking for a return visit after Christmas. On Sundays the roof top restaurant has a delicious and varied multi course brunch with sparking wine throughout. It is also available to non residents but you need to book. The views are breathtaking. We enjoyed the live jazz each evening and the great selection of cocktails. A very romantic place to stay. We were both very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “grand old dame”
Reviews.Author: roscoe39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night pre cruise, booked through otel.com for an unbelievable rate of about 50%0ff which made my stay here even better value for money. Although Venice is a zoo during the day, to experience it at night and early morning from the hotel made up for it. Made up of a number of old palazzos dating anywhere from the 15th to the 18 century it is a very quirky hotel and would not suit those looking for a hilton or weston hotel experience but more with a sense of history and style. Breakfast on the roof top terrace was worth the entry price alone. Beautiful hotel, perfect location, exceptional staff who went the extra mile, all added up to a fabulous stay that preceeded a dream cruise.

Reviews.Title: “This is a once in a lifetime hotel, with views to absorb and love for ever.”
Reviews.Author: Pingopolly
Reviews.Content: We have just had three wonderful days in the Danieli Hotel. It is exquisite, the staff are attentive but not obtrusive, the building is amazing. We took breakfast on the terrace; fabulous breakfast, everything one could wish for and the view stupendous. Drinks in the bar in the evening were delicious and accompanied by lovely bar snacks. We upgraded to a room at the front, great decision. Highly recommend this hotel. Slight downside; ground floor loos not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Lisak0703
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel in middle of everything. They were extremely helpful in arranging pickup/transporation from the airport for my parents and arranging our transfers to the port the next day. Always quick to respond via email, and assist in any way possible. Customer service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel to stay at in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Hoteler
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night but we wished we could have stayed all week. Hotel was beautiful and the staff was world class. We are proud members of the Starwood Preferred Guest program and we were so happy to find such a lovely hotel in the perfect location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic grand hotel, great location but not up to 5-star service”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Marble_Trek
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful historic grand hotel in a great location. This hotel is right next to Piazza San Marco on the Venice lagoon. So while it's a great location it is in a very busy tourist area.I recommend arriving in a Water Taxi. We paid 60 euro from the train station but it is a special experience. We used the Vaporetto (water bus) to return to the station which worked out since there was a storm and the larger water bus cuts through the chops easily. The Vaporetto was only 6.5 euro per person and since we had no oversize luggage there were no extra charges. Both the water taxi and water bus drop you off close to the hotel. As you may have read already the lobby of the hotel while kind off small is breathtaking. This is true for most of Venice. The entire city around every corner is like being in a beautiful painting. We had a Junior Suite but were upgraded to an Executive Suite due to my Platinum status. We went to see the room and it was great except that it din't have a water view or step out balcony. A smaller version of Angela Jolie's room in "The Tourist" with no view of the lagoon. We asked if we could trade our room for a room facing the lagoon with a balcony. Marco who checked us in said he would try his best to find us the lagoon facing balcony room. He even had a heated argument with this angry looking woman who sat at a desk across from reception. It appeared she had no intention of letting us have the room but Marco was persistent. After this exchange between them he was happy to tell us that while it was not a suite he had lagoon facing balcony room becoming available and that he would find us on the terrace when it was ready. We enjoyed our drinks on the terrace while watching the busy lagoon and street below. As he said Marco took us to our new room and wow! The view and balcony were magnificent. If you seen the pictures you know this hotel has a very limited number of lagoon facing balcony rooms but at 27,000 Starwood points per night we were paying a lot to stay there. Our luggage had not been transferred to our new room so we went down to the lobby because it is such a beautiful space instead of calling down. While we were there I again asked weather breakfast was included with our room and Marco was not sure. We wound up speaking with the angry looking woman at the little desk. She informed us that because we paid with points breakfast was NOT included with our rate. She also implied that this was a "Luxury Collection" hotel and that I did not understand what a "Luxury Collection" hotel. I'm sorry but I'm a platinum member and I very well understand what "Luxury Collection" hotels are and have stayed at many. She did not seem to care to accommodates us in anyway, including telling us about any discounts we might have because of my Starwood status. She then began to tell me it was my settings on my iPhone that was the reason I could not access the WiFi. What 4-5 star hotels tells the customer that they are at fault without trying to provide any help or assistance? This woman should be removed from her position and have no access to customers. Being pleasant to her only returned an "I can step all over youâ€¦" type of attitude. I am in IT and I knew that my issues had nothing to do with settings on my iPhone. If we return to Hotel Danieli it will not be because of her but we will look at other hotels because of her. In fact I will be contacting Starwood about her rude attitude. We plan on returning to Venice but probably not the Hotel Danieli because of her! Now more about the hotel. Other than Marco, service at this hotel is 4-star and not 5-star. This included issues with our key when it stopped working and we had to wait while three different people came to our door trying to get it to work. The apology was mixed with "somehow we must have not known how to work the keyâ€¦" even though it took three people over 20 minutes to get the key to work. Nothing else was said or done for use about this inconvenience. Summary: - Beautiful historic grand hotel - Excellent location next to Piazza San Marco on the Venice lagoon - Operates more as a 4 - 4 1/2 star hotel not a 5-star - Marco at the reception desk is wonderful and improved our stay - Nice, well appointed rooms with beautiful bathrooms - Very expensive - Disgusting bathrooms on the lobby floor - Doorman is usually absent - Good concierge service

Reviews.Title: “Simpli the BEST”
Reviews.Author: JorTC
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at Danilie was some 25 years ago, afterwards I visited Venice a couple of time and stayed at different hotels. Well I visited Venice with my wife for two nights on the first days of October, and since this one was a very special trip. I decided to go all the way and reserved a Suite with "THE VIEW" at this magnificent hotel. I can report that my decision was highly rewarded. Believe from the moment you first step in to the moment you have to leave. You will experience luxury and quality all the way, if you are looking for something special your search has come to an end.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugX50
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Next door to St Mark square.Grand Cannal frontage. Arrival was warmly recieved. Rooms are quite aged,but since its building history dated back over a hundred years,it can be chaarming. Signiture staircase leading up to the first floor is impressive to take picture! Excellent location of restaurant on the top open air terrace, I Feel is the best view to have breakfast and to dine esp. with live jazz trio in the evening. All that being said, you feel they really push for the value,since room price is wuite hign.But all 5 star luxury properties are. Service is considered nothing special for price paid. We feel its because to has over hundred rooms. And the location and layoput of the lobby is that it gets heavy guest traffic flow from small door entrance and to the elevator,so you do not feel personel attention or reconigtion. Over all its a yood stay but you need to get the larrge rooms not the entery level.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lazydaysNyc
Reviews.Content: charming lobby but very loud - and rooms in that building are not privvy to sound proofing so you can hear all activity from the lobby in the rooms - and they need updating! the carpet (at least in our room had a huge stain). the bathroom only had a hand shower so close to the wall that you almost had to lean against the wall to get wet. what was most unappealing was the service. they are very aloof - almost snobby. not pampering or friendly at all. next time we will not go back. really a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: If it's in your budget you should absolutely stay here. It's the most beautiful hotel I've ever been to in the ten or so countries I've traveled in outside the United States. It is elegant, tasteful and one-of-a-kind. The staff is very helpful (particularly Irina who is a sweetheart) and the rooms are well-maintained and spacious. It's located right by St. Mark's, so you're near all the main tourist sights and right on the Grand Canal. The breakfast in the morning is on the top of the building and offers the breathtaking view of Venice you travelled all the way there to see. I'd really recommend this hotel for any honeymooners, or for anyone who doesn't think they're getting back to Venice anytime soon. It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a rehab”
Reviews.Author: TravelTillIDie121
Reviews.Content: We were also summarily dismissed upon arriving prior to 3PM. Our room, which was supposed to be upgraded based on our paying top dollar American Express Platinum price, was small with mismatched furniture. It did overlook the lagoon which was wonderful. The staff is cold and you rarely see a smile, and it appears that this 5-star hotel now mainly caters to large Asian tourgroups. When I tried to check out, 2 gentlemen behind the desk were with other customers and a woman was adding up folios on a calculator. When I asked her for help, she replied that she was busy. As soon as one of the other 2 men was available to check me out, she took the next guest on line. If this is an American hotel, they should be more tolerant of their American guests. It had been my dream to stay here. Be careful what you wish for.

Reviews.Title: “One of the planet's greatest!”
Reviews.Author: GSTechnica
Reviews.Content: Fromthe time you step aboard their private launch on arrival until you leave, a stay at Hotel Danieli is guaranteed to be an exceptionally enjoyable experience. The hotel is comprised of 2 pillazzi and one mid-twentieth century buildings. The furnishings are different in each room. The roof-top ristorante is better than most. The panoramic view from the rooftop terrace is an experience not paralleled elsewhere. The hotel is just off St. Mark's square and next door to the Doge's Pillazzo. Enjoy your well-pampered stay!

Reviews.Title: “classic hotel in romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D
Reviews.Content: Maybe too formal but surely effcient service. I guess it is one of best address in town, nonetheless next time (if any) I would like to stay in another city area, maybe Excelsior could be a valid alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Saw it in "The Tourist" and booked it”
Reviews.Author: LouisenBob
Reviews.Content: Classically beautiful hotel right on the water at the mouth of the Grand Canal. Featured in the movie "The Tourist" with Angelina Jolie and Johnny Depp. Lobby is beyond gorgeous as are the views. Splurged on an upgrade for a water front room and it was worth every penny. As for a trip to Murano and get a free water limo ride for a great experience. Pass on the hotel restaraunt for dinner. Overpriced and eh food. Breakfast is fine. Eat at the Algiubagio instead! It is worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: Mandy W
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after spending 3 truly memorable nights at the Hotel Danielli. We had a lagoon view room, which we recommend as the views were stunning. We were put into room 10 which we have since found out is a very famous room (George Sands) stayed in there. The staff could not do anymore for you. What a wonderful way to spend our 9th anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale Wedding”
Reviews.Author: BrideUk
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate to get married in Venice two years ago and the Danieli made the whole experience perfect! We were given a beautiful room in the old part of the hotel with a seperate dressing area, plenty of room to hang up my bridal gown. We booked our wedding reception at very little notice in the restaurant and also used the terrace. The staff were amazing so professional and although the Danieli is expensive I believe you get what you pay for. The hotel provided extra special touches which we did not organise including beautiful displays of flowers. I cannot recommend the Danieli enough! The good news is we are going back in two weeks time to celebrate our anniversary - I cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Danieli Venice Italy”
Reviews.Author: sanmaria1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Danieli in Venice. We spent the weekend here after a hectic trade show in Bologna. We were greeted by a friendly, helpful staff. Our junior suite was magnificent, facing the canal and the islands of Venice. The hotel is lovely, certainly depicting old world charm and elegance. The food at the rooftop restaurant was delicious, and the views were breathtaking, just stunning! We would certainly return to the Danieli, and in fact, I can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “One word...”
Reviews.Author: Georgio L
Reviews.Content: PERFETTO! There's only one hotel in Venice and that's good old Danieli. I come here more than 35 years. My dad only knew one hotel in Venice... I remember being a kid that the beds were so high there was a little step to get in. Your luggage is unpacked and pressed before it goes in the wardrobe. It's really old charm with a service you don't see/expect in any other property. The rooms are filled with antiques. Personally, I'd rather have worn out old carpets than new copies. Same with the furniture: antique furniture does not look new, chips of paint went off during the years. Bathrooms are not modern, but everything you'd need is there. This is what makes Danieli unique in its kind: it's all real and genuine. Staff is charming and would do anything to please you. Some people complain about the prices. Well, it's Danieli for starters... Then never forget you're in Venice which is not the cheapest city in the world. If the high prices of the hotel/bar/facilities bother you there is one solution: don't choose a 5 star hotel. Life can be simple... One little spot on the perfection though is the Terrazza Danieli... For us there is only one hotel and one Danieli. My dad taught me well.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: lukejohnson
Reviews.Content: Most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. Room slopes, toilet and aircon failed 3 times but it just added to the charm. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, old hotel, stylish, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 2 nights. It is a beautiful hotel. This is not a modern hotel. Do not expect a normal SPG experience, if you want that pick a newer hotel. However this hotel fits the city perfectly. It has atmosphere and style. I loved it as did our clients. Breakfast on the terrace is a fantastic experience. It was beautiful. The room I had was small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Jayne B
Reviews.Content: Arrived by water taxi and we were checked in promptly with the Receptionist taking us up to our room. The room was on the 2nd floor with superb views over the Lagoon. We had champagne and chocolates with a card congratulating us on our 25 years. The hotel certainly has the WOW factor. Service was fantastic, rooms were out of this world, beds so comfortable and the whole place spotless. Had a meal on our anniversary on the terrace overlooking the Lagoon where the waiters were brilliant. Can not fault this Hotel and would defy anybody to do so. It was pure luxury for us and we were made to feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MayfairChick1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the best location in Venice. Very very expensive. I paid 580 euro per night for two nights. The room is newly renovated. Doesn't have much of a view. My biggest compliant is check in time is 3pm - it really is!! You have to wait till 3pm literally. How annoying. Even after telling them i woke up at 4am and would love to take a nap at 2pm, they made me wait for another hour. I have never really experienced that in a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oversea72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Danieli for 3 nights. We got a luxury room with a breathtaking view to the Lagoon. My dream came true! I have been planning to book at the Danieli for years, after Fred and I got married 15 years ago. We felt warmly welcome by the receptionist who checked us in. Offering us a pleasant smile, she escorted us to our room giving us very useful information about the Hotel and the town. Great professionalism. It was very exciting. The "palazzo" is unique. It mirrors the magnificience of an extraordinary town. The room we were assigned was impeccable. Attention for any detail. Hotel Danieli is not simply an Hotel. In our opinion is the Hotel I wish everyone should experience at least once in life. Any service you may require is delivered following the best culture of professionalism. Thanks to that the relationship between guest and staff is still focused on the importance of service. It is not only the location and its history that make the Hotel Danieli very known all over the world, but also its excellence by providing a personalized customer care. Fred and I would like to thank all the front desk staff. We will be back next year. Thank you again

Reviews.Title: “Great location; remodeled rooms/suites are nice but dark.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_SanFran
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Danieli in a junior suite with window over a canal. The room was remodeled and had an amazing bathroom, however, generally it was too dark for my taste - it might me the venetian style. Perfectly clean and good service. However, I do believe concierges make great hotels - in this case the concierge was not very knowledgable or helpful. (e.g. he sent us to a mesuem on a Tuesday which apparently is a day off at the meseums). I have not been to other hotels in venice but compared to 5 star hotels in other places in the world I give them 4. PROS: centrally located, you can be the first person in the Doge's palace as it is next door CONS: centrally located :)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kunhyuk K
Reviews.Content: Travel is all about "experience". You invest your time, your money, and your energy to get this "experience". If your "experience" doesn't quite return your invest, though being a subjective equation, then there's a problem. Here's my invest; expensive flight to Frankfurt, rent car for 10 days, long drive down to Venezia, another not-short/not-comfortable Bapolette ride to S. Marco station; lonest checkin-wait time hotel in europe. And here's what I got: staff not able to speak English (and probably proud of that), electronic key mal-functioning, causing me and my wife to wait on the hallway for few minutes, longest baggage delivery time from lobby to room. Extremely unpleasent serving at their roof-top restaurant (almost like the highlight). Staff very proud of not-having any privte-ride back to inland. Some of the room amenities were not replaced since the previous stay (menus, maps, manuals). Only real deal: you get to stay in a hotel that's 1 minute walk distance from S. Marco Plaza and Bapolette station. You get to bath in a marble stone shower. You get to say that you stayed in Hotel Danieli. A catch: we're a young Asian couple. I'm not sure if that matter a bit to our experience. But we do travel a lot and bear experiences with many similar-class hotels from all over the world; this one being the lowest range of rank. Yes, Venezia is one of the hottest spot in the whole europe and many hotels there will tend to be become bold and careless like this.... but still...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,But That's About all”
Reviews.Author: Serialglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Having been to Venice before, you know it's going to be busy, sometime unwelcoming and rather expensive. The Hotel Danieli embodies these traits in bucketloads I am afraid to say. On the positive side our room had a lagoon view in the modern part of the hotel and the vista is simply stunning. The room is well appointed, modern and was kept clean. However, the balconies on these rooms afford no privacy with screens between neighbours barely at waist height. Part of the attraction of staying here was to experience a dinner in the La Terazza restuarant overlooking the lagoon. Our tour operator booked a table for us for two nights a good six months in advance. However, there was a conference going on during our stay featuring the European Armies Group and they had commandeered the whole of the public restuarant La Terazza and therefore hotel residents had to make do with being shunted into a side room where you couldn't look out of the window when you were sitting down to eat. Furthermore, my wife and me were charged in excess of 255 euros for a 2 course meal & wine which is eye-wateringly expensive. Don't get me wrong I will pay good money if the food and ambience is worth it but this is a rip-off. The trouble is so many folk come to Venice and such hotels can charge what they like and not try very hard because there will always be another mug punter coming along. We cancelled our second reservation and decided to eat out at the Londra Palace a short way along the front. We arguably had a better meal, service and atmosphere and it was almost just over half the price of the Danieli. A word about breakfast, which is served from a buffet. This did take place in the roof top restaurant and the view was special. However, the full English cooked breakfast was just.... well disgusting as it was stone cold despite being in a warming area. All the staff (and there are alot of them) had to do was serve coffee, allocate tables and clear plates, but the expression "busy doing nothing" comes to mind and it all seemed a bit shambolic. The front of house staff suffered from this problem too as when you spoke to Reception or the Concierge team they were only half listening and there attention seems to be somewhere other than you. This was almost without exception. All this is a shame as the Danieli's main building is of great historical interest and is stunning , but sadly the rest of the experience doesn't measure up to it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel - Museum”
Reviews.Author: Elena298484
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere. Absolutely beautiful! The Restaurant on the top has a magnificent view of Venice lagoon and good food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: libtek
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice on a short last minute break and were pleased to find we could afford this hotel as we had recently seen the film The Tourist which starred the Danielli and had commented on how lovely it looked. When we arrived at the hotel the porter took our bags and escorted us over to reception, where we checked in. The man on the desk gave us a map and booklet about Venice before escorting us to our room whilst the porter brought up our baggage. Although our room was far less grand than the one assigned to Angelina Jolie in the film, it was very nice.The room was in the newer building and overlooked a small canal rather than the Grand canal. I did ask the hotel if we could pay for an upgrade to a canal view but the only rooms they had free, were suites which were way outside our budget. However the room we got was clean, quiet and very comfortable with a small entrance lobby, leading into the bedroom and through an arch where the wardrobes were, was another room containing a very well appointed bathroom with a wonderful shower . The bed was large and the pillows fluffy. When the maids came to turn down the bed (& leave chocolate on the pillow) they rang the door bell outside the room, which I thought was a nice touch. Breakfast was taken on the Terrace on the 4th floor of the hotel with a spectacular view of the Grand Canal. Unlike other reviewers we had no problems getting seated on the Terrace as there was a Maitre D to escort guests to their tables. The waiters were excellent and very attentive. We were on a full breakfast basis and found breakfast was excellent and very plentiful with really lovely pastries as well as cooked food & fresh fruit. You could also have omlettes made to order. We didn't need to ask the concierge for very much but they were always polite and helpful. The hotel is in a great location with a waterbus stop almost outside and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class, Authentically Venetian Experience”
Reviews.Author: LadyGaladriel17
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Hotel Danieli. Overall it is a spectacular hotel, having been a palace with original construction in 1400. Of all the hotels in Venice, it gives the distinctive Venetian old-world feel. During both stays we were given rooms with balconies. There are a limited number of rooms with views on the water. We had a partial view during our last stay and a view of the tops of local buildings in the previous stay, both of which were fine. The balconies are constructed in such a way to afford privacy and are quite nice.There is sufficient dresser and closet space, the rooms are decorated in a sumptuous fashion and the bathrooms are spacious with plenty of amenities. Some decorations are slightly faded or worn, but this adds to the antique feel which is far more comfortable and pleasant than hard, antiseptic, modern edges. The beds themselves and pillows are extraordinarily comfortable, and the hotel itself is pleasantly quiet, with minimal bustle down in the lobby, except for when the occasional celebrity is expected to come through. And why wouldn't they want to come through? it is simply a beautiful hotel unlike any other. The first thing to note about the service is that housekeeping in particular is excellent. Non-intrusive, pleasant people who do an excellent job and do not forget to refresh missing amenities, nor are they disruptive, calling the room as in some hotels. The breakfast which is included (on the covered roof or indoors) includes fresh fruit, wonderful baked goods, juices and champagne. The eggs could have used a bit more cooking, but made-to-order eggs are possible. The personnel in the restaurant were all first-rate, and we admired their poise considering the large number of guests to cater to. The reception area personnel were also seasoned professionals who helped us immensely in choosing sights, entertainment and restaurants to enjoy, as well as navigating our way towards it. When we arrived at our scheduled dinner or opera, which the Danieli handled with precision on our behalf, we were welcomed heartily as Danieli guests. One exclusive restaurant even accommodated us without a reservation because we were Danieli guests. The only downsides were: firstly, a small, unexpected fee that guests in any hotel must pay for Venice restoration; we wish we were told at the time of booking. It was new at the time,; it is likely when you book you will be informed. Besides that an employee came to work with the flu and passed it to me while assisting me with the hotel computer. I'm sure it was unintentional but as a former manager it was always my policy to ask people with the flu to stay home as part of service to customers. Because of the flu and under-cooked eggs I unfortunately spent a number of days being ill during our stay and afterwards. Yes, it is an extremely pricey hotel. But despite the cost and the occasional imperfection, I would highly recommend the Hotel Danieli. Experiencing Venice would be unimaginably different without calling the Danieli home while there. If you are going to Venice and really would like to experience the true beauty and wonder of it, you must stay at the Danieli. Of course it is in the perfect location next to St. Marco's square and a water taxi/bus can be easily acquired for a day trip to any locale, including the beaches of Lido. A real Venice experience means booking a room at the Hotel Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby, Great Location, but Somewhat Shabby Rooms”
Reviews.Author: catatmwc
Reviews.Content: The lobby was incredible, and I loved the little detail with the keys, but the actual room left something to be desired. The room seemed to be worn down, and the dark wallpaper made the room seem smaller than it was- I think some renovations are in order. The concierge was very helpul and the hotel is in a great location. Some people on our tour had better rooms than we did, so you may want to ask for a renovated room when you book.

Reviews.Title: “A real palace life.”
Reviews.Author: 44yrswithfamily
Reviews.Content: (+): Wonderful hotel - Inside wonderful decor - very good breakfast with unforgettable sea (grand canal) view- good service - spacy rooms & very comfortable. (-): We booked 2 adjacent rooms. Unlikely, we failed to get adjacent rooms, but it was not a real problem since the rooms are spacy. It was easy to manage our luggage in one room. We would prefer a free internet in rooms. It is free in lobby. (*): A real palace life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but”
Reviews.Author: lodiza
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this grand hotel is spectacular, but all rooms are not created equal. I've also discovered that a woman traveling alone is often discriminated against...i.e., given inferior quality rooms...rooms a bit shabby with no views.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: nama j
Reviews.Content: Danieli is a hotel with 6 stars history (14th Cent. palace) 4-5 stars service (Starwood hotels standards) and 10 stars price. Rooms need urgent renovation (like Sacher in Salzburg for example) ie retaining old style but new beds, closets, windows etc..
