Overall it's not worth the price as 80% of it goes to image and location.

Reviews.Title: “Such an Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junoman973NewJersey
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Venice, this is the only place to stay. The rooms are beautiful and the breakfast and dinner on the terrace is such a wonderful experience. The concierges at hotel are the best and what you come to expect from a 5 star hotel. Its such an elegant hotel , you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jude2410
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Danieli - next door to St. Marks and Doge's Palace - opposite multiple boat stops, so easy to get to anywhere - fantastic service: typical lag between call and delivery < 5 minutes; concierge remembered to book me a table at a great restaurant 2 days later as the restaurant was closed in between with no reminders Only issue: restaurant charges cover charges even to hotel guests!!

Reviews.Title: “We love it and for sure I recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: WilliamK63
Reviews.Content: The good thing is that the rooms are very nice, clean and spacy. Very elegant in colors and style. It was a true Venetian room that my wife and I did like so much. The one NOT GOOD experience I had was in the checking in as my room was not ready and when I returned to the hotel, it was given to someone else. This was a check-in mistake that should nto be done. I recommend that they change the carpets in the entrance as they are old and not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Michaela1989
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Danieli For a week with my boyfriend. The hotel was absolutely amazing and the staff were just beautiful. It was very clean and looked superb inside. The staff were always on hand to help and would go out of there way to make sure your stay was perfect. The hotel was used in the recent film "The Tourist" Feat Angelina Jolie. Although this hotel is very expensive, It is worth every penny and I would indefinitely visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Satravellar
Reviews.Content: As axpected, a great haven in the very hot month of August, didn't want to leave our room. Wonderful interior, clean and the beds heavenly! Visited Venice for the first time for my 40th in August - the history and location of this hotel is wonderful! Staff not overly friendly but efficient and resolved small problem with special package booked in record time. Would return every time!

Reviews.Title: “Time for a downgrade”
Reviews.Author: A Y
Reviews.Content: The Danieli has a great reputation. My husband and I spent several days there in August 2011 and were very disappointed. We have traveled all over the world and stayed at wonderful, as well as mediocre hotels and The Danieli certainly did not meet our expectations of a great hotel. The staff is arrogant, the concierge shares the barest minimum of information and our room looked as old as it was, with chips in middle of the doors and scratched, torn wallpaper. The place needs an all around upgrade. We also had to wait in a long line to check in. When we checked in, we were coming off a cruise ship and there was definitely not enough staff to check everyone in. After checking in, I went to the concierge desk to get maps and information and had to wait a long time all over again, because there was not enough staff there either. After we checked in and our room became ready, a young man took us to our room (in the depths of the hotel--certainly no view, no upgrade, no beauty), and he was very friendly and polite. Since our luggage had not arrived, he told us he would have our bags sent up right away. It took hours. LIterally--hours. We had to ask for them again; I think they forgot about us. My husband and I each had to pay to use the hotel computer to confirm our flights and print our boarding passes. I've never had to pay at any hotel in the world till the Danieli. The high rates we paid for our room didn't earn us the right to print our boarding passes for free? On our last day in Venice, we told the concierge that we wanted to make an appointment to take a free hotel water taxi to Murano. The concierge replied that we shouldn't worry, the taxi leaves every twenty minutes, all day. So we went out to do some touring and returned to take the taxi at 3:00 pm. At that point, the concierge said it was too late and the taxis weren't going to Murano any more. Why didn't he tell us that in the morning? We would have changed our plans. When it was time to leave for the airport, the hotel was prepared to get us a water taxi for 120 euro. Right outside the hotel, if you got your own taxi, it cost 110 euro. And of course, the concierge wouldn't tell you this, but very close to the hotel there is a public transportation boat stop where you can get a boat to the airport for 15 euro! The lobby of The Danieli is very beautiful and worth a look. The rest of the hotel is not. The service is just sad for a hotel of that calibre

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in old mansion. Quirky, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: loiswj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Tauck tour, "Italian Lakes." Because this is in an old mansion, every floor and room is different. We liked our room,which was good sized because there were 3 in my group, but others on the tour said their bathrooms were so small that they couldn't turn around in them. The hotel is right on the ocean walk and has their own water taxi pier. This is a HUGE plus. We saw many tourists pulling heavy suitcases through the Venice streets because their hotel didn't have a pier. The hotel rooftop restaurant provides lovely views. If you are willing to have a little quirkiness, this is a nice place to stay. We like this sort of thing, but its not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: InTheBizMyself
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is quintessential Venice and a must see for all who visit. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a lagoon view room in the oldest most oppulant part of the hotel. The room had a little age on it, but was comfortable. I did worry how much the room below heard us on the creaky wood floors. The sumptuous breakfast on the terrace with a view of the lagoon was PRICELESS...I couldn't wait to start my day. Cocktails in the lobby in the evening felt like I was a visiting dignitary or possibly a hollywood celebrity. There were a few hiccups, mostly a frustrating ending when the concierge mistakenly called us a taxi rather than uderstanding we had arranged transportation to the airport...a heated exchange with an irate Italian concierge and taxi driver is NOT a good way to end what could have been a flawlessly magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: chuffed-california
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. First time in Venice, coming from Paris, and decided on this historical location. Best decision to do so because it is in the best location. Stayed in room 356 in the renovated wing designed by Jacques Garcia. Comfortable bed, clean room, spacious bathroom... what else could you ask for. Spent evenings in the lounge with complimentary internet and talented pianist/singer every night till past midnight. As a solo traveller I felt safe and happy there. The floral arrangements in the lobby were absolutely beautiful and very fragrant. I must add that the staff are very professional and pleasant. I forgot to ask them how exactly my room was scented. I could smell a hint of lavender which as we know is conducive to relaxing sleep. I was hooked! I will definitely practice that at home. Can't say enough about how happy my stay there was. You must have breakfast on the terrace for their spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “Famous for the Right Reasons”
Reviews.Author: hillking3
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is, in my opinion, Venice. Charming, luxurious, maddening, inefficient, breathtaking, difficult to really know, faded, preposterously beautiful, and unique. We weren't thrilled with the line we had to wait on to check in, but were then charmed by the warmth and the care with which the master of the front desk, Giorgio, explained the hotel and accompanied us up to our room to welcome us to the Danieli (of course, this meant that the wait at the check-in line was extended by 10 minutes for those waiting, but this is, after all, Venice). The room we had, which was by no means a standard room but did not face the canal, at first seemed large but a bit less-than-elegant, but it grew on us over the course of a three-night stay as the brocaded drapes and high ceilings and old but efficient bathroom, the views over some rooftops and the typically amusing Venice chimneys, and the magnificent light joined by music that seemed to come from various rooms and locations in the surrounding neighborhood all conjoined to give us that special sense that Venice washes over you if you allow it. The three best things about The Danieli are its perfect location, next to the Doges Palace along the Grand Canal; the magnificent and historically significant lobby; and a dining terrace at the roof that made morning breakfasts watching over the canal and the islands across the way literally unforgettable. In the end, if you love Venice you will love the Danieli. They are both magnificent wrecks, full of character, inefficient in a very charming way, and uniquely satisfying experiences for those open to them. The Danieli isn't cheap, but it's worth it if you want to remember what Venice means to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bring your ca$h”
Reviews.Author: Frank107
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Danieli for a family vacation. Yes its the one from the movie "The Tourist" with Angolina Jolie. The hotel built in the 14th century has a beautiful interior decor (lobby area, and may stair cases). The rooms however are ordinary. Venice is an expensive place, and the Danieli lives up to that expectation, you pay 5* prices at this 5* Hotel. I am not convinced the service is 5* however. An espresso coffee at the hotel bar is 10 Euro's, a Rye and Coke is 25 Euros! this is not a place if you are on a budget. It was nice to visit because of the movie and the notoriety of the hotel, however some more modern or renovated hotels would offer a nicer rooms at more affordable prices. I had booked 3 nights, and after the first day in Venice decided we wanted to stay one more night. When i asked the front desk to extend our stay, they said - sorry we are fully booked - i then used my iPad to look for hotels in the area using Expedia and notice that the hotel we are in has 4 rooms left! i went down to the front desk and explained to the guy that Expedia says that there are 4 rooms left and he just said that they have no visibility into the rooms that these sites reserve. Ok, maybe not, but when i asked the first time, he could of suggested i try the hotel booking sites rather than just tell me that they are booked and go away.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: fussy011
Reviews.Content: Arrive by private water taxi, rooms overlookng the Canal are worth it. Decor amazing. Eat on the Terrace at least once. However we found the staff were better dressed and presented than many customers whats happening to standards these days? I dont want to see other peoples knees and flip flops unless its on the beach. Location is amazing and busy areas are easy to escape from. Good Piano bar some people danced.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: pongo416
Reviews.Content: We had a great room that overlooked the canal. The location was very convenient. Our package included breakfast and they had a variety of foods. The view from the patio was wonderful too. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ubforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Leonorscf
Reviews.Content: I spend part of my honeymoon at Danieli. The room view was breathaking and it sÃ©s ed. Like we were on the 18th century. Imppecable service. The best!

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Treasure”
Reviews.Author: debbie828
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in an ideal spot. Decor reminds you of "Phantom of the Opera". While suitable for this locale, it can get dreary. Front desk tends to be chaotic. Roof top restaurant has a great view. However, the food is slightly above average. For the cost, I expected more. I got the feeling that they were really trying to leverage the recent filming that took place there - "The Tourist".

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like to queue!!”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Danieli for 3 nights prior to a cruise - as a 5* hotel this is a joke and simply living on it's past reputation. Queued for 15 minutes to check in which wasn't a good start...........breakfast was good and the views fantastic, even managed to get an omlette the 1st morning - but other mornings a 9 person / 20 minute queue for the poor guy on his own cooking to order!! Checked in on a friday afternoon and immediately went to the restaurant to try to book a table for dinner on the Terrace on Saturday night - the staff laughed and said that of course they were always full.........no apology or alternative suggestions........very Italian. The room was large though in desperate need of a revamp - the bathroom was a 1970's vision in brown marble with lighting so dim it was difficult to see anything - I was losing the will to live just being in there. In summary the service was almost as bad as the lighting - the management of this hotel should go to the Oriental in Bangkok to see how a real 5* hotel SHOULD be run. Needless to say we will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Its not Perfect, but I Love it Anyway”
Reviews.Author: piccolita
Reviews.Content: The top two things I love love love about the place: the lobby and the terrace... Upon entering, the lobby just impresses you. You feel as if you have just walked into a (historic) fairytale. At least that's how I felt. Well, for me old and historic is charming and romantic. You will definitely have a feeling that you are in a special place. Its just simply beautiful... Then there's the terrace... Oh the terrace gave me goose bumps. (you have to sit outside, of course). I just sat there silently, had breakfast by my lonesome self, had a coffee, admired the view, and had some more coffee.. I did not want to leave. Just looking out into the canal and the sunny blue sky gives you that peaceful and wonderful feeling that life is just good. So, with so much beauty around, nitpicking just ruins the mood. But i do understand that they seemed a bit understaffed for a high profile 5 star property. Checking in and out, (specially since it was July and they were full) required a little more patience than normal. But a little waiting will not kill you. You can sit at the nice lobby and have (an expensive) coffee :P The people at reception and at the restaurant were very nice, i dont know what the others are talking about. Be nice to them and they will reciprocate. The rooms. Well i was lucky enough to have stayed at Danieli twice. The first time I was not impressed at all. My room the first time was a normal smallish European sized room, but in RED and with carpet. I believe it was in the oldest of the 3 wings. I did not like it. It felt heavy... So, if you get this room, you may have issues... But the second time, I stayed in the middle building, in a room which seemed like an upgrade. It had super high ceiling, and floor to ceiling windows, with charming antique furniture. This was way way better, it was old but in a good way. Romantic and charming... So there, all in all, it wasn't perfection, but you'll just know something special when you see it. I so hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “JUST BE CAREFUL!”
Reviews.Author: JBolosh
Reviews.Content: Ask for a front facing room with a balcony...it definitely helps if you're a Starwood Gold Member plus you can get a late check out! We loved our room BUT they're small and full of furniture so it's very hard to move around in them but the balcony helps. And the bath products are great. The biggest thing you need to be aware of is the upcharge for everything. Be sure breakfast is included...the continental breakfast is 40 Euros per person. And they won't give you an iron (Italy is very tough on this) so our bill was 80 Euros for a few slacks and shirts (this is no joke). The restaurant is expensive too and while the view is stunning they cheese it up with this woman who sings bad pop songs...it would be better quiet. The front desk staff and male manager were not friendly at all and when we challenged the outrageous ironing bill the manager was a tyrant. We heard him with other guests too and he was at least consistently abusive to everyone including his staff who clammed up around him (we felt badly they had to work for him). We finally got a partial credit for the ironing because we wanted pressed clothes so we could eat dinner in their restaurant. He seemed to accept that reasoning...not that his rates are out of control. The other bummer is that it's so close to the square that it's just a mob scene all the time. Really for the money try The Bauer, we stayed there after our cruise and loved it. We were at the Danieli before our cruise. We hear people also love the Gritti Palace and there's a hotel right across from Harry's Bar that looked good. Have a drink at the Danieli but don't stay there. And if you just have to then please go in knowing that they're going to try and take you for every last cent you have and not be very nice or helpful if you question them. I guess they don't have to be but it's a shame because the hotel is really lovely and the flowers are gorgeous. JB

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, appalling service”
Reviews.Author: Timfromvictoria_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, but the staff were just so rude & arrogant. Obviously business is a bit too good in summer here - they obviously didn't care. The room was lovely, but very very dark, & no view at all. Breakfast food was really good, & the view from there is stupendous.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful receptionist”
Reviews.Author: BECMATTManchester
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to staying at this hotel for months but on arrival we were very disappointed. The female receptionists were rude and unhelpful, we booked a deluxe room for three and the third bed was a camp bed for a man over 6ft! When I spoke to male receptionist he said thats how it is - I asked to speak to manager but I never heard from him. We payed Â£627 pounds for one night and I had to sleep on an uncomfortable camp bed as my tall son was too tall to fit on it!!! The breakfast was very good though on the terrace overlooking venice - I think you pay for the view NOT for the service. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: YveC
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the location which was perfect but everything else about it was over rated. It is certainly does not justify the rack price that their website quotes and over â‚¬50 for breakfast that was not worth it! Fortunately we took advice from a previous reviewer and booked a deal through hotelsclick.com so didn't feel as ripped off as we could have been! Long queues and reception to check-in and check-out (over 20 minutes) and the staff are so unfriendly and just look down their noses at you! It is a shame as the hotel is beautiful and in a perfect location but the staff need some training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and very romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yiliam
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Danieli, however the waiting to check-in was ridiculous and the service could be a lot better since were paying a bit more then a four Seasons rate.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel that is let down by annoying problems”
Reviews.Author: William1306
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel overlooking the Venice Lagoon and the historic interior make this hotel special. Unfortunately, it is let down somewhat by problems you don't expect at a luxury 5-star hotel. The understaffed Reception produced long queues and made it very difficult to reach by phone which made the queues even longer as the only way to contact Reception was by joining the queue. We had booked and paid for a room with a king-sized bed and were given a room with two single beds. When I complained, they just pushed the two single together which was not as good as a king-sized bed. I didn't know how to log-in to the Internet using the hotel WI-FI network and after another long wait in the Reception queue to get help I discovered they didn't know either and they referred me to the Concierge desk who also didn't know and they contacted the hotel electrician who was finally able to help. Shortly after moving into our room a plumber arrived to work on the WC which must have been causing problems with the previous occupants. We soon discovered the problem ourselves as the WC didn't always flush. I couldn't face a third long wait in the Reception queue and I managed to keep it going myself during our stay. There is much we enjoyed in the hotel such as dining in the roof-top restaurant overlooking the Lagoon and afternoon tea in the ground-floor lounge. So it is a shame that the overall experience was spoiled by the annoying problems.

Reviews.Title: “WoW! Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: Lanphere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Danieli for 4 nights. The location is really unbeatable and the service was BRILLIANT. I have stayed in Venice before at another top establishment, so this was not just a nostalgic memory. The Terrace restaurant is quite simply the most postcard perfect setting possible. The food is also very good. We love our rooms, in the newer part of the hotel. We normally opt for a view, but this time took a non-view room, but we did not need it. The hotel is gorgeous, the position is right in the thick of it and transport could not be easier. I sent a list of restaurants we would like to go to and the brilliant concierge arranged each meal for us. We dined in splendour. It is hard to separate that fact from the hotel experience, I must say. All in, with nice weather as well, we scored at the Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “It was great for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: strategic2020
Reviews.Content: Staying here was like living a dream. The whole place is spectacularly beautiful. It can get a little dicey at check-out time, which will the small staff is hard to move guests through the check out process at the same time. I'd stagger leaving rather than waiting for the check out time. We loved the room which felt very different than most hotels. Very familiar, palatial in its proportions and comfortable. Of course, the last thing you want to do in Venice is stay inside, so I felt torn the whole time with sitting in this spectacular property and soaking in the history of it with the need to get out and see everything. A wonderful place. Great small touches make it a first rate place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cab5
Reviews.Content: Having read several negative reviews regarding the Danieli hotel staff and quality of the rooms, I was a bit apprehensive to stay here. However, I can honestly say that my stay was 100% positive, from my communications with the hotel prior to my arrival , through checkout, I found the staff very professional, responsive to my needs and extremely friendly. The hotel's location is perfect for visiting the sights and accessing transportation - right on the Grand Canal. The room was exceptionally clean, quiet, and perfectly equipped with the amenities necessary for a comfortable stay. Although smaller than hotel rooms in the US, it was still quite functional. I would certainly recommend the Danieli, without reservations, to anyone seeking a luxury experience in Venice. Thank you for making my stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing”
Reviews.Author: SallyEF
Reviews.Content: Best hotel on our 3 city trip around Italy. And Venice should never be missed. Do whatever you can to stay here! 4th floor terrace for breakfast is without a doubt the most beautiful view in the city. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not Even Close”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiz60
Reviews.Content: 2 nights at the Danieli were included on a recent tour to Croatia, and we were initially impressed that we would be staying at this glamorous and renowned hotel. However, we discovered their reputation to be undeserved in terms of value received. Our room was smallish and needed refurbishing in terms of the shabby furniture and drapes. The bathroom was fine, but certainly not spacious, and the windows looked out onto the walls of another building. All this would be OK if the room rate wasn't outrageous. Our breakfast buffet was lovely and the view from the terrace magical, but it would have cost 68 euros if it hadn't been included in our tour. A mixed drink delivered from a surly waiter in the lobby cost 18 euros. The food served at our in-house banquet was unremarkable, and we overheard another couple complain about their dinner entrees from the previous evening.. Our well-traveled opinion: all this hotel has got going for it is location, location, location, right on the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel, an Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: WeeBurnie
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a "special" birthday surprise for my husband and it certainly was a special holiday. On arriving, the reception area had that WOW factor. It is absolutely gorgeous. After checking us in, the same member of staff personally took us to our room and we were not disappointed with this either. The staff were very attentive. We finished off every evening with a cocktail or two in the lounge before retiring to our beautifully decorated and comfortable room where every night the turn down service had been in. We stayed for four nights enjoying breakfast every morning on the 4th floor terrace with priceless views. On the last day we left via the hotel's private "jetty" by water taxi. Yes, it is expensive, not just the hotel, but the whole of Venice, but it is a luxury hotel and it was worth every penny. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service.”
Reviews.Author: jsutman
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Danielli was wonderful, the staff was very helpful with dinner suggestions. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very quiet. The view from the terrace is fabulous, we enjoyed breakfast there each day. Even though it is costly it was worth it as the offerings were impressive. I would recommend this hotel and have to several friends planning trips to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and very, very good”
Reviews.Author: Sussextravellers9
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is a special experience. Arriving by water taxi from the airport direct to the hotel entrance is a treat in itself...and then when you get inside, you start to understand why the hotel has such strong reviews. It has to have one of the most beautiful hotel entrances anywhere in the world. Considering the size of the hotel, we thought the service from all the staff was extremely good, given the pace of activities going on all around them. Our room was very good and reasonably spacious by European standards. We did not have a view, but I'm sure the cost of this extra would have been somewhat beyond our budget. What you have to do is dine on the top floor restaurant overlooking the entrance to the Grand Canal. If you don't want to eat there in the evening, breakfast there in the morning is magical. Get there early so you get a table immediately facing the water...you won't regret sacrificing some extra minutes in bed! My 4 star rating reflects the fact that you certainly pay for this experience, but I'm really glad we took the opportunity . Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: muscovymoll
Reviews.Content: Arrive by private water taxi from airport as anything else wont do. On arriving at the hotels own landing station, you enlight into the most amazing foyer/lounge/reception area. The reception staff are very efficient so registration went smoothly. We chose to upgrade to a lagoon view room when booking this hotel & boy did we make the right decision. Room 226 was amazing, the view of the lagoon & its everyday activities was very interesting. The bed was the best bed we have ever slept in, sheer luxury. We sat in sunshine every morning in the hotels roof top restaurant, watching the lagoon activity whilst enjoying our very substantial & varied breakfast. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, very efficient. We hope to try one of the suites on our next visit. Great location 5 minutes walk to St Marks Square, Doges Palace/Bridge of Sighs, water bus & gondola stations outside the hotel. It truly was a wonderful memory of our special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Great Sevice and beautiful surrroundings”
Reviews.Author: JuanCarlosLOLKATS
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay on a long week-end in Venice. It was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Worst room in a 5 Star hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller258
Reviews.Content: The Danieli Hotel is beautiful. Exceptional styling and wonderful antiques. However, be careful when checking into the hotel as the rooms can range from luxurious to broom closets. The room we had, 306, was tiny and had a view of a wall and ceiling vent. Very disappointing for over 600 euros per night. In addition, we were not afforded the chance to move to a better room.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel I've been to...”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelGirl9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli was absolutely gorgeous. The lobby looked like something out of a movie, the rooms were so comfortable and romantic and the location is perfect. We stayed in the newer rooms, so I don't know what the older rooms are like...I would request the newer side of the hotel. The draperies made the rooms so lush and the marble bathrooms with towel warmers were a great treat after the overnight train we took to Venice. We didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant but we heard it was very expensive...I'm sure very good too. The front desk attendants always rememered your name when you were getting your room key, which was a very nice touch. I would absolutely choose to stay here again on our next Italy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterSR
Reviews.Content: While booking a trip to Italy staying at the historic Danieli was on my "must do" list. The lobby is without parallel as was the bar area, sitting room, and library. From a logistical perspective there is also simply no finer location to stay in Venice. Our room was spacious to put it mildly and I was particularly impressed with the separate dressing area. We had windows facing two alleys and it was nice to take in the sounds in the morning. Some of the areas were tired but what can you expect from a 14th century building? The service could have been better for an establishment which charges such exhorbitant rates but we were more than pleased 99% of the time. Although I'm embarrassed to admit it there was also a self indulgent "movie star feeling" associated with catching one of those beyond beautiful wooden water taxis from the hotel's private landing. I eagerly await my next trip to this amazing city and will stay here again many, many times.

Reviews.Title: “At least one time in your life”
Reviews.Author: Genob
Reviews.Content: A vacation in Venice, with a room in the Danieli overlooking the Lagoon and Grand Canal. Truly spectacular. Venice and the Danieli did not disappoint in any way. Sure, it costs a lot, but sometimes you actually get what you pay for. And this was one of those cases. Our room was a luxurious haven, perched above Riva dei Schiavoni, with a patio with views across the lagoon. I doubt there is a better room in Venice. Dining on the terrace each morning, and once for dinner, were likewise a great experience. Great location.... walk to your left to escape the crowds and stroll along the Venice waterfront. Walk to your right and you are in St. Marks Square in a few steps. And the San Zacarro vaporetto stop is directly in front. Rooms are plush and comfortable. Forget about what its costing you for a few days, and live it up...This is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ASAP100
Reviews.Content: Amazing honeymoon at an amazing hotel. Service was above expectations and the decor was delightful. Just moments from st. Marks square and the best icecream parlour in the world. A reason to be spoilt, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “You can stay somewhere else better for half the price.”
Reviews.Author: chewie55
Reviews.Content: So, we stayed at the Danieli because of its reputation and the room rate was hugely expensive. The rooms were nice, but the service was distinctly average. The hotel bar was extorionately expensive, a beer for 9 Euro, a Gin and Tonic was 18 Euro! I had a glass of Cloudy Bay for 18 Euro (almost as much as a bottle at my local wine shop!) and the glass was tiny, three mouthfuls and it was all gone! It was a beautiful setting and the interior was amazing, but it simply did not represent value for money. For the half the rate, you could have paid for a suite at the very close by Best Western, with more facilities and just as good service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment from minute one”
Reviews.Author: Attessa
Reviews.Content: After staying at the delightful Goring Hotel in London I arrived in Venice. I had asked for full service from the airport to the Hotel. No one was there and the Hotel desk at the airport told me I did not have a reservation with them. They told me my only option was to book a water taxi myself and pay cash. After walking 10 minutes with my luggage I arrived at the water taxi area. The driver informed me that I had far too much luggage for one person. That was none of his business. I finally arrived at the hotel two and and a half half hours after landing. To say that the staff was arrogant and disorganized was an understatement . I was told to wait 15 minutes and my $1200 US /night room would be ready. I sat in the lobby while waiting and enjoyed my $12.00 cup of tea. After 45 minutes my room was finally ready but after waiting almost 2 hours and three phone calls later I went to retrieve my luggage myself. My room was lovely I must say but absolutely no amenities . I had to call housekeeping to have an over starched bathrobe sent up to my room. I phoned reception to get the WiFi password only to wait another 5 minutes while the gentleman tended to other guests. I could overhear his entire, private conversation with the other guest including room numbers, credit card information etc. I can travel and stay anywhere in the world and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The arrogance and rudeness of the staff was beyond belief. Perhaps they should all be reminded that they are paid employees and not paying guests. My visit was cut short and I was off to Verona.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Eva34550
Reviews.Content: A hugely anticipated luxury ending in disappointment. Hotel staff extremely rude and standoffish. You are made to feel like every request was too much trouble and how impertinentnof of you to even ask.it was vaguely falty towerish, as if people were intentionally trying t be rude.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Palmtree2000
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a week stay at the glorious Danieli. This was my third stay here. There cannot be a better location in all of Venice, just a few steps from the Piazzi San Marco. We stayed in a luxury room in their newest building, the Excelsior. The rooms were handsomely decorated but on the small side. The air conditioning was excellent and my room was very quiet. The bed was heavenly, the most comfortable one I have had in a hotel in a long time. The rooftop restaurant has one of the greatest views in the world, but the price for eating breakfast here is very steep.(it wasn't included in my room rate).Staff were friendly and helpful, particularly the concierges. I will definitely stay here again. I have also stayed at the Gritti. If you are looking for a Grand Canal view you may be better off there as it will be quieter than at the Danieli. The street in front of the Danieli is bustling all day.

Reviews.Title: “This is not an hotel - it's an experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Inchconnachan
Reviews.Content: You can always find fault if you look hard enough - so here goes. We booked the Danieli as part of our Ruby Wedding celebrations. The plan was to stay at the Danieli in a junior suite for 3 nights, travel to Lake Garda and stay at the Grand Hotel, Gardone (see seperate report) for three nights and then return to the Danieli for an overnight stay in a "basic" room for one night before returning to Scotland. So this report deals with the two stays at the Danieli. We arrived by water taxi and were treated with great courtesy and efficiency by the staff. Our junior suite room (room 8) was very oppulent and overlooked the Eastern end of the Grand Canal where it opens out into the lagoon. The windows were single glazed and shuttered so did not provide effective sound insulation against the noise of the promenade nor the Vaporeti station. Most Italian hotels when confronted with a noise problem deploy a double window arrangement with different thicknesses of glass. The room was spacious with a separate dressing area. Breakfast was on the roof terrace, and as one previous report mentions this must be the best breakfast venue in the world. We took dinner on one night. A two course meal for two without wine cost 230 euros which I thought a tad expensive. On our return, because it was an overnight stay with an early morning departure we had booked a standard room. This was more modestly decorated and was right next door to the prison of the Doge's Palace. Again the room was spacious with a seperate dressing area and a large bathroom. If anything I preferred it to the junior suite (I have a preference for minimalism whilst my wife prefers oppulence). The public spaces in the Danieli are its greatest asset. Just to sit there after a days sightseeing with a glass of wine amongst all this splendour contemplating the history of the place makes it all worthwhile. Having the Doge's Palace as your next door neighbour (well the prison part anyway) together with the same post-code as St. Mark's Square is also a bit of a plus. We returned to the airport by water taxi with few Euros but rich memories.

Reviews.Title: “The terrace restaurant is worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Torolf2
Reviews.Content: The view from the restaurant on the roof is just marvellous. It's probably the best view in the world - overlooking the Canal Grande. The hotel is situated just around the corner from the San Marco square. The interior of the building is fantastic, and it is decorated with beautiful pieces of art spanning several centuries. If you can afford to stay at the Danieli, just go there. If you think it's too much to pay more than 600 euros for a night, I would recommend that you at lesat treat yourself to a breakfast or lunch at the terrace restaurant. It's also expensive, but it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel! Beware of False Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: Christo199
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a disturbing trend in hotel marketing. Check out its website and you'll see incredible rooms. When you get there, you're in a tiny little closet of a room. Now I'll admit the lobby is spectacular. The hotel is so close to the water that it actually flooded when I was there in December, 2010. They had to move the furniture and put up those planks in the actual lobby. I didn't mind that. It was actually fascinating and they are used to it. No water at all in the rooms themselves. The room service is outrageously overpriced. I mean utter gouging! I can't fault the location of the hotel. I wish the proprietors were willing to show their customers more respect by being truthful about the rooms and not engaging in bait and switch advertising. Not classy!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: I3abyruth
Reviews.Content: We book Hotel Danieli for 2-3 nights and had a horrible time. Dinner on the rooftop was extremely overpriced. Covercharge just for sitting. Room service employee yelled at my husband when he told him that his pasta was not gluten free (He has an allergy and they have overpriced gluten free food at Hotel Danieli), the Room Service Employee insisted that it was and told him not to tell him how to do his job!!! They closed the kitchen without sending him another meal, he missed dinner that night. To make a long story short, they sent us wine and chocolates close to midnight because after consulting the cook, they found out that the pasta indeed was not gluten free!! There isnt any wifi in the rooms, only ethernet cables for laptop use and internet tv for 15 Euros a day, or 6 Euros an hour!... I couldnt use my Ipad. Wifi only in the lobby. I asked the front desk to help me plan my trip to Marcopolo airport, they first recommended i pay 100 Euros for a water taxi, when I refused, they finally told me there was a water bus that left twice every hour for 15 Euros each straight to the airport right outside the hotel! we asked them to recommend other restaurants in the area, and when they did they were just as overpriced, suggestions being biased since it turns out they were affiliated if not part of to the Hotel Danieli. They are a rip off!!! We asked for a large Queen/king bed, we got 2 joined twins to form one. My husband kept falling in the hole between beds! Location is in the smack center of everything so its crowded with a lot of tourists... its a pro and con. Dont get me wrong the hotel is lovely to look at, but they use every opportunity to get a euro out of you. The staff felt very anti-american. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect location and luxurious hotel... a magical stay.”
Reviews.Author: MrsH27
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Danieli by river taxi which was an amazing start. The hotel is beautiful and the location is outstanding as it is on the doorstep of St Marks and overlooking the lagoon.The view from the terrace is breathtaking.The staff were helpful and attentive at all times.The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were amazing. An expensive but wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Wulfruna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on a Citalia package, the price for which seems to be far below the generally advertised prices for this hotel. The building is magnificent and amazing. The staff are all friendly and helpful. Our rooms, in a newer part overlooking a small canal, were roomy, well equipped and very attracttive. Breakfast on the terrace, looking out over the lagoon in the sunshine, is an incredible experience and not to be missed. But we could not afford to experience the restaurant for dinner! The location, of course, is excellent - and, in our rooms, noise free.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but VERY overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Shirley059
Reviews.Content: this old hotel, though beautifully appointed, still lacks the spaciousness found in newer hotels. The superior king room cost 660 euro and we were hardly able to walk around the bed and had a view of the wall next door. Fortunately, our Amex platinum card included the 56 euro (each) breakfast in the Terrazza Danieli. This restaurant boasts a rooftop view of the Grand Canal and again is beautiful in decor. The food was mediocre, small portions and VERY expensive, in addition to the 12 euro (each) cover charge, which was not waived for hotel guests. It was explained that the charge was to cover bread and service. The bread was some of the worst we've had. If the goal is to stay near St. Mark's square I would recommend finding a less expensive alternative off the square and make the 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Request one of the newel updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: HuntSAH
Reviews.Content: Our room compared to other's we were with was very small. We had two full sized beds we had to push together. The bathroom was very old and out dated. Not much room to move around in the bedrooom itself. However, we did have a small balcony that overlooked one of the narrow canals. Breakfast was great, which was the only food we actually had at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: yatsey
Reviews.Content: this is a really nice historic hotel in a perfect location. pulling up at the jetty on a river taxi from the airport feels very cool. nowhere is cheap in venice so tough to talk about value for money. only thing that let the stay down was the slow service at check in as they were understaffed. Bottom line, id probably come back next time as didnt discover anywhere better.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel we have stayed in, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Carmen3041
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Danieli, and all I can say it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is centrally located. You can grab a water taxi right outside the doors, or if you want to relax on a nice gondola ride it's easily available. The restaurant on the 4th floor offers amazing breakfast buffets in the morning, and a dinner you would never forget in the evening. The view from the restaurant overlooks the water, and is very relaxing and beautiful at night. We had a lovely room, with a nice size bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service.”
Reviews.Author: doylemoore
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms for 3 nights. Checked in April 6. Rooms were not ready but front desk provided cocktails and 15 minute later we were shown to our rooms. We were both on award stays and still as Gold got an upgraded. Staff was attentive and professional. The view of the Grand Canal's roof top bar is an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Cynthia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lived for a year in Vicenza a few years ago. Vicenza is only 45 minutes from Venice so we traveled there often and are very familiar with the town. Being so close however, we never stayed in Venice. We decided that for our return visit this spring we'd splurge a little and stay in the Danieli where we used to go for a drink on their rooftop terrace once and a while. While expensive for your average traveler, we enjoyed our three night stay at the Danieli more than any of our recent travels. The service staff were polite, gracious, and accomodating. The hotel itself is magnificent. The rooftop terrace provides a wonderful place to enjoy a drink while gazing over the lagoon. The location could not be better and provides immediate access to Piazza San Marco as well as an easy walk to Rialto or Castello. The consierge informed us of their partnership with their sister hotel, the Excelsior on Lido. The hotel provides a free water taxi shuttle to the Excelsior every 2 hours where you can take advantage of their beach and facilities. We have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location on waterfront and adjacent to Piazza San Marco, easy access in and out. Earnest staff but systems are still somewhat manual so things occasionally fall between the cracks. Terrazza Restaurant is expensive but outstanding views and usually attentive service. Our rooms, in the renovated wing, were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour and just have a cocktail here - do not stay”
Reviews.Author: jackieshoes
Reviews.Content: Despite paying â‚¬500 a night breakfast was not included. No tea/coffee making facilities were available in the room, but nevermind as for only â‚¬12 you can have a single cup of tea in the lobby - what a bargain, 50% more expensive than St marks Square. The service was variable. Despite leaving a big tip in the lobby the waiter was downright rude. The bedroom was tiny and dark, no iron was allowed in the room. The mini bar was not replenished and we had no drinking glasses for water, and no complimentary water. To add insult to injury the concierge recommended a dreadful restaurant that served burnt pizza. To top it off I was overcharged and still have not had a refund depsite continually contacting the hotel. Totally overrated.

Reviews.Title: “it was more than perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Venice25
Reviews.Content: all was a hapy times- no one prefar another hotel other than this hotel (Daniali-Venice) because of many elements: location-sirvices-5 stars-decorations-smiles all over and alots more........................

Reviews.Title: “Oy Vey”
Reviews.Author: joelbess
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a lot more from the Danielli. The rooms are Sub Par. It smelled a bit upon checkin. Perhaps we had a smokerâ€™s room. We were supposed to get a canal view, instead got a wall view. Checkout took 45 minutes, and internet was free downstairs, but cost 20 EU if you order it in your room. (Same internet will work in both places) they failed to mention that to me. The concierge guy was spectacular, thatâ€™s the only reason I stayed. Otherwise, I would have swallowed my losses and left. Wasnâ€™t so impressed with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel & Birthday Experience”
Reviews.Author: paneraitraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Venice. I am an SPG Platinum member. And I never spend the time to write reviews as I am really busy. I'm doing a review for the 1st time because the Danelli was an amazing experience. I had booked my 1st night at the Gritti Palace, and was going to decide where to spend my 2nd night (great thing about the low season). I had originally planned to stay a 2nd night in Gritti Palace as I didn't enjoy the hassle of moving hotels. When I visited the Danelli, my partner and I felt that we liked the ambience, energy of the hotel more. The Gritti Palace was more serious and located in a good and more quiet part of town. But the atmosphere was more sombre and serious, the staff were formal and serious. At the Danelli, the staff felt more approachable, higher energy levels, and the boardwalk was packed with people (i.e. downside is that sea facing rooms with Balcony tend to be a bit noisy in the afternoon till 9pm). Ennoi, at the Front Desk, was amazing. He was kind enough to show me a room with balcony and seaview (thanks for the SPG Platinum upgrade). We loved it and booked the room for our 2nd night in Venice. When we checked in the next day, I was surprised to find a bottle of Prosecco and Cake to celebrate my birthday. I later found out that my partner had spoken to him to arrange it, but he had already done it before she had asked. His care and concern was exemplary among all the thousands of hotel nights that I have spent as a frequent traveller. There were many other examples of his great service that I will not document here. Alessandro at the ground floor lobby bar is another amazing mixologist. He is friendly, knowledgeable, and makes the most amazing drinks. Many people tend to ask for the traditional favourites, but I had asked him to make me some of his favourite cocktails including his own special cocktails. He created traditional as well as special cocktails of his own receipies. I must have had 10-12 cocktails over a 36 hour period with him. it was a really lovely and enjoyable experience to find someone so passionate and knowledgeable about his job. He also gave us ideas on dining spots. He had worked the late shift the day before I had checked out, but he came to say good bye to me at 7:55am the next morning because he knew that my water taxi was coming at 8am. What can I say, is this not amazing personalised service from a hotel with 200+ rooms. Before I arrived in Venice, I had heard that food would be expensive and not great (i.e. for the price of fine dining). The concierge suggested the usual suspects of the top few restaurants in Venice. But I found a little gem of a restaurant where the Venetians tend to go -- great food (especially by Venice standards) at reasonable prices made by a passionate owner/ chef. My Gondola guy had recommended it for good pastas and told me that the Gondaliers go there for meals. Alessandro had also mentioned it had a reputation for great meat dishes. The Assassini, just a minute away from the Opera House, and the restaurant changes their menu daily (e.g. Monday is a study of white meats, another day for stewed meats, and Fridays for a study on seafood). The owner is amazingly friendly, speaks perfect English, and has an Italian only menu (last page with a simple Italian to English/ Russian dictionary for common italian food terms), but the wait staff are friendly and speak English. Kinda like eating at a friend's home with great home cooked style comfort foods -- the owner-chef selects the best of the local produce. And a friendly atmosphere, the owner-chef actually sat at my table, had a glass of wine, and shared local insider's view of Venice. Overall, I had an amazing Birthday in Venice -- strolling, eating, drinking, making friends with 3 amazing local Venetians who helped me to understand a local person's view of Venice and giving me an opportunity to get a glimpse outside the traditional tourist's point of view. And I loved the Danielli Hotel and Assassini Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location... very disappointing experience...”
Reviews.Author: ArpadHevizi
Reviews.Content: Having spend many vacations in Venice in different amazing hotels - including the beautiful Molino in the past - I was really looking forward for our visit of the Danieli this year... Last year when we walked by the hotel we immediately loved its charming design and its location - so decided to try it next time we return. When we arrived last night the lobby and the outside areas were as spectacular as we remembered... ...but that's where the positive experience ended... we were greeted with a cold and hurried check-in process - as it seemed that the staff was more concerned closing the desk for the night than to making a guest feel welcomed. When we tried to call the front desk from the room nobody answered... so I needed to walk down to get answers to simple questions... ...and the room was very disappointing - supposedly an upgraded room with Grand Canal view... but it just seems 'stale' not antique... My inquiry for an upgrade was answered with "our front desk is closed so please discuss it with the staff in the morning...' Considering that this is rated as one of the best hotel in Venice for its service... I expected a very different experience... I hope that the management of the hotel is reading these comments and will use the feedback to re-focus / re-train the staff on 'the meaning of customer service': making the guest feel welcomed... as it is the little things that make a difference - especially in boutique hotel - where you are going for the 'experience'. Personally I will not extend our stay or would recommend this hotel to any of my friends at this point... If you stay here: I hope you will get one of the recently remodeled rooms and time your arrival during the day where the reception desk and the staff attention may be up to a higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: wolfgirl61
Reviews.Content: We changed our reservation at the last minute so we could stay at this beautiful hotel. We were not disappointed. Our room was fabulous and overlooked the grand canal. The decor was elegant and the service was top notch. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay at 5* hotel in Venice. It's pricey, but well worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Liampc67
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and pure luxury, how anybody can mark this hotel down amazes me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RebecaH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and we absolutely loved our stay. The location is fabulous and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They provided us with all the information we needed, and gave extra help when required (I broke an acrylic nail and the concierge immediately made me a reservation at a beauty salon to get it fixed, along with a map of how to get there). It is expensive but one can easily see why. Our room was beautiful and we were upgraded and received a bottle of wine as we were on our honeymoon. We would definitely love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful architecture and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 33avenue Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli is a stone's throw away from Piazza San Marco. There's even a public water boat stop next to it, convenient for those coming from the airport. My room was spacious, bright and had canal view. Though the bathroom could use a bit of updating. More on Venice and hotel pictures at: http://deuxarmoires.wordpress.com/2011/01/02/padua-and-venice-italy/

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: allat81
Reviews.Content: fabulous hotel in the best location in venice. Helpful staff. clean well equipped rooms

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room extortionate restaurant prices”
Reviews.Author: janettat
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four nights at the Danieli. The accommodation in a standard room was very handsome and well-appointed and the house-keeping excellent. However the experience was marred by the outrageous cost of food and drink. In particular the 50 Euro buffet breakfast was a disgrace - nothing out -of-the way by the standards of any large international hotel. Foil wrapped butter pats and tired scrambled eggs are not what you expect in a top class hotel! Ordering from the menu was very slighly more reasonable but still far too dear.We had planned to dine in the hotel at least once but changed our minds when we saw the prices. I should make clear that it was not just the cost - sometimes one has to pay for quality - but here the standards simply do not begin to justify the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marky2804
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in the hotel the first being in 2004 on a conference when I was disappointed by a very old tired room that simply didn't stack up against what I was paying. Rooms have now been refurbished (or a number of them) and the makeover was excellent. The hotel has a great location, is decent value for money, has a nice feel to it and really helpful staff. Would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Redfine the meaning of luxury”
Reviews.Author: JordanFun
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful and luxurious hotel with all meaning of luxury. From the room to every item resides in the room. The bed is great and very comfortable. The room services is superior. Staff is very highly polite, helpful and available. The location is great and I had a wonderful stay there. I have stayed in many luxurious hotels but this one is different.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING & FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: NexUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to the Danieli for drinks many times before as we are regular visitors to Venice. We were enjoying our cocktails in the bar along with the crisps and nibbles. Imagine our horror when we spotted a sucked half eaten olive stone nestling amoungst the crisps. This made me feel sick to the stomach and we could not continue with our drinks. When the waiter came to give us the bill we told him that there was a half eaten olive with our snacks. He shrugged and said sorry under his breath. Five star service? You would be better eating scraps off the street, at least they are free. When you pay 20e for a drink you do not expect this kind of service. I will stick to 5 star hotels in the US, Asia and UK as Venice does not measure up. I understand everyone makes mistakes but we weren't anything but a half hearted apology. No discount, no fresh drinks, nothing. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in central Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Picky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in early October. Beautiful room in the 2nd oldest bit of the hotel. Booked the hotel via the price comparison bit on Tripadvisor, and got an excellent deal from otel.com for a premium de luxe room with breakfast. (cost of breakfast would have been â‚¬55 each a day). All staff very helpful, and no problems checking in or out. Excellent choice of food for breakfast and on a couple of mornings we were able to eat out on the terrace, which has the most stunning views. Didn't eat at the hotel other than breakfast. (You will need deep pockets to drink or dine in the hotel, as everything is very expensive.) Others have commented on noise but we had no problems. Our trip was for a very special occasion and a bottle of prosecco and box of chocolates were in our room on arrival. Best hotel we've stayed at in Venice, and would definitely return againl

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Opulence”
Reviews.Author: DawnSimm
Reviews.Content: What an incredibly beautiful hotel. We were lucky enough to be taken here for a 2 night stay by a company via my partners business. The hotel is stunning at every turn. Superbly located between St Marks Square & The Bridge of Sighs. The front desk staff were always welcoming and charming, the same could not be said I'm afraid of some of the waiting staff. We were served breakfast in the Marco Polo room due to the large group so this may not be true of the staff in the main restaurant. The bar and room service prices were ridiculously expensive but I suppose they can get away with it because they are such a high class hotel. The room was delightful, the bathroom was very dated but had it been updated it would have probably lost the shabby chic appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: antbklyn
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time here. This hotel is so traditionally beautiful. Located steps from San Marco Square. Very Romantic. My wife and i stopped here on our honeymoon and it was great. We would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel in extremely convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Xyzklm
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was very good, all the employees were gracious and helpful. The building itself was fantastic, absolutely gorgeous. The room was nice but not exceptional. The breakfast buffet was very good, and the rooftop restaurant had lovely views of the lagoon. Drinks in the bar were very expensive! Could not beat the location - our water taxi picked us up from the hotel dock and whisked us to the airport. Being so close to St. Mark's square was great as we could easily return to our hotel as our weary feet needed.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: maskell_family
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in this wonderful hotel. As soon as you walk into the hotel we were stunned by the beauty of the building. When we arrived we were attended to immediately by the very polite reception staff. The room was warm and elegant. The bathroom was very clean and well fitted out with robes etc. Thick towels and a shower like a water fall! The beds were extremley comfortable and turn down was a lovely touch. It was our daughter's 18th birthday and they had remembered by putting a birthday cake in the room. :) The views from river view restaurant were absolutely breathe taking. I have never been in a restaurant where there is champagne on offer for a bucks fizz! Breakfast was delicious and masses of choice. My teenagers could eat to their hearts content! The staff were extremely courteous and attentive. The concierge was very helpful and directed us to some lovely local restaurants. The lounge and bar were a realxing place to have a drink after our meal. The pianist was pretty ropey though and I really wish they would sort out the dreadful muzak or not have it at all. A minor detail though. We couldn't fault this hotel. We will have to save for years to go again - Venice is THE most expensive place I have ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very costly”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLemur
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and overall, we enjoyed our time here. Lots of celebrities stay here. Even if you don't see any, you can have a look at the Danieli's guest book and see the autographs of all the glitterati. Do not stay here unless you want comfort, Grand Canal view and convenience (no problem getting your luggage up to your room) AND you don't mind paying a very hefty price. If you are pinching pennies, this is definitely not the place for you. The speedboat from the airport cost about $150 for 4 of us (it's about a Â½ hour trip) and that gives you some indication of the fact that you will be bled dry here. The hotel is right next to Piazza San Marco & the Doge's Palace, and so the location is ideal. It's got a prime location, right on the Grand Canal. Our room looked across a short walkway (where booths/sellers sold masks and trinkets) and there was a steady stream of foot traffic. But the windows are modern, heavy and sealed better than any I've seen anywhere, so with the windows closed it's very, very quiet. I'm a light sleeper, so this feature was key for me. We splurged and got a luxurious Executive Suite with a Grand Canal view, as it was our 20th wedding anniversary. Not cheap. But if you are ok with the splurge, it is worth it for the convenient location. I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor extensively, and it appeared to me that you would only have a brilliant stay here if you book one of the better rooms. I can honestly say our room was fantastic. Large, with a view, a sitting area, gigantic marble bathroom, very comfortable bed. It was great. I don't remember the exact but it was around $2500 a night. I would agree with what another reviewer said: â€œwe weren't unhappy, but we weren't wowed either.â€� We stayed in the â€œnewer hotelâ€� which is next door to the fancy old hotel (with the impressive antique foyer, stained glass, fancy chandeliers). To get to the newer hotel, you walk through a series of stairways and corridors from the old hotel, it's not far, maybe 2 minutes walk from the front desk. The lobby is several centuries old, and very impressive. But, if you want to see the lobby, and you don't want to pay the hefty rates at the Danieli, you can always just come in and have a look, and they won't charge you anything. If you stay here, be aware that LOTS of tourists come here to have that look, so the lobby has a Disneyland-like feel to it. Service here is nothing special. It's a large-ish hotel and the desk staff are businesslike. If you need help they will help you, but you'll just feel like one of a crowd. In fact, there is usually a line to wait in to check in/check out, etc. We asked them to supply the names of some good restaurants. We were directed to a couple of restaurants that were ok, but total rip-offs, cost a fortune, and we didn't have anything particularly memorable. So that was a bust. Would I stay here again? Hmmm... I don't think so. I would check out some of the smaller, funkier hotels, and stay on a quieter side canal. Tip: go to Cafe Florian for breakfast and order the hot chocolate Oh my. It's around $20 (hey, it's Venice, get used to it), but it is the BEST you'll ever had. Like they melted the best bar of Belgian chocolate, and added hot milk. I've tried in vain to make it at home, no dice. It's quite simply the best hot chocolate in the world. But note that they do not open until 10 or 11am, so don't go there too early in the day. Breakfast on the roof, with lovely views over the Grand Canal. Nice but a little pretentious (as is everything in Venice). The good: luxurious, quiet room if you are willing the pay big bucks. Best location on the Grand Canal. Glorious ancient lobby, dripping with opulence. The water taxi brings you right to the back door, so no schlepping luggage around back alleys. Excellent soundproof windows. The bad: antiseptic & overwhelmed hotel staff, massive crowds, the hotel (as well as the town) have a Disneyland-like feel to them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonFamily4
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay in the Hotel Danieli. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute! The hotel is beautifully run with courteous and friendly staff (especially the concierge who were fantastic); the breakfasts were delicious and evening meals superb. Two children - aged eleven and fourteen - were very impressed by the attention to detail and, of course, stunning location. Only down side was that you have to pay for internet connection. Otherwise no complaints and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel in fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: chesters
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice for our wedding anniversary, I emailed the General Manager of The Danieli to tell him of our visit and he came to meet us at check in. He was charming and it was a lovely welcome to the hotel. The hotel is wonderful, if you like character and was just as I'd imagined. It was once a palace and has many original features. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. Our room which was large and bright had a superking bed and overlooked the Grand Canal. A buffet breakfast with extensive choice is served in the restaurant which has fabulous views. I loved the fact we were next to St Mark's Square, the water taxis and shops, restaurants and bars. The Osteria da Baco on Calle de la Rasse 4621 close to the hotel is a quaint little bar/coffee shop where one can watch the world go by and watch some of the local characters. We took the speedboat from the airport which cost 25Euros each, the other passengers paid a lot less by booking in advance. Also it dropped us off at the public transport stop instead of the private entrance of The Danieli Hotel. On our return we took public transport and paid Euros 13pp for the hour long journey. This leaves every half hour. A complimentary water taxi leaves from The Danieli Hotel to Murano every 20mins. We had a tour of the glass factory which was interesting and then wandered around the shops. Many of the churches have recitals/concerts. We went to Vivaldis Quattro Stagioni which cost Euros 25 pp and was money well spent. This was a perfect time of year to visit Venice as it wasn't too busy. We had a wonderful time and enjoyed every moment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classical hotel with the best view”
Reviews.Author: hennessyparadis
Reviews.Content: First impressions We took a water taxi from the railway station to the Danieli. There was something unique travelling by boat to a hotel. This was our first stay in Venice and we did not really know what to expect. Unlike other hotels the water taxi actually drives right next to the hotel entrance in a private canal. I had mixed feelings about the decoration of the hotel and at first I didn't really like it.. The room We were shown to a newly renovated room. The new room was rather small but very "luxury collection" in decor. Alas no canal view so we decided to upgrade. The new room was in another building. The decoration is dated (as you can see from the photos) however the room is very spacious and the view was just fantastic. What I don't understand is why house-keeping keep closing the curtains / volets every time? :) The view Spectacular view of the Gran Canal. The breakfast Breakfast was not included and at 52â‚¬ / person we opted out. Overall The Danieli is a 13-14th Century building. Yes, it feels a bit peculiar in places with the squealing staircases and slow lift - but it's a proper classical building not a custom-built 21st Century hotel, right? Location is excellent next to the San Marco square and the view is one of the best in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in cleaner more pleasent hotels in Venice for one-quarter the cost.”
Reviews.Author: cretezone
Reviews.Content: When I saw that the Hotel Danieli was included in my tour, I was ecstatic.I had stayed in Venice several times before in lovely small hotels at a reasonable, rate even with my single supplement added. When I was escorted to my room, I was very disappointed. The carpet was stained and extremely dirty around the edges of the room. The furniture was chipped,and the walls were scuffed. There was no dresser. The room itself was dark and cell-like. I expressed my disappointment to the receptionist who escorted me and was told that there were no other rooms! After several calls, my room was changed. It was much better, but not worth the price. At breakfast,I had to ask several times for coffee which was finally served,lukewarm. The waiters were not up to par for a five star hotel.The food was mediocre. When our group first arrived by water taxi, there was no one from the hotel to remove our bags from the boat. I personally unloaded several bags unto the dock before I realized that this was insane! I took my own luggage and hauled it to the Danieli. Sorry to say that this was one of the "low lights" of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Venice.....”
Reviews.Author: charlotte55
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful experience at the Danieli and recommend it highly. We chose to arrive by private boat and entered into the lobby from the water. The lobby is very impressive and elegant. We arrived at 10:00am and our room was ready. I did email the concierge before the trip to have them meet us personally and set up dinners and tours. They were wonderful. Very attentive and prompt. This hotel gets my best rating as it made my trip in Venice so special and romantic. The hotel is very "old world" and I love that feel, heck....you're in Vencie. Will recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory - and needs managemnt attention”
Reviews.Author: DCJay
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we did not stay at the Danieli but instead stopped for a cocktail. The lobby area is definitely "Old World Venice", but that's where it stops. The waiter was busy chatting with the bartender and was not only ignoring the existing guests, and new guests arriving were simply waiting with no service. I finally got up and asked if it was self service and finally got some attention. The men's room had water all over the floor, there were no paper towels and graffiti was evident. It might be a good idea for the General Manager or at least the assistant manager go into these restrooms and inspect them - this is by no means, five star quality

Reviews.Title: “perfect Venice experience!”
Reviews.Author: denastokes
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd trip to Venice was even more magical by staying at Hotel Danieli. Our room was elegant with just the right amount of upgrades and modern features. The staff was both warm and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in a spectacular city!”
Reviews.Author: TitanV
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. We had a suite on the third floor facing the lagoon. The view and the experience were amazing. The suite was impeccable. The bathroom was just magnificent...all marble, separate room for bidet, loo and shower. I am redesigning my bathroom at home to match this one! You are so close to St. Mark's square and all of the touristy stuff, but after dark (and all of the cruise ship passengers) you have it all to yourself! The location is wonderful. Our huge suite was amazing. Quiet, luxurious with wonderful views. the TV in the living room did not work, but there was another in the bedroom that worked fine. We did not even bother to complain since there was no time for TV anyway! Get ready for hordes of tourists..........more than I ever imagined, and it was October!!!

Reviews.Title: “A dream in the city of dreams”
Reviews.Author: Akiwasta
Reviews.Content: I must say that it is the most charming hotel I have ever seen, it is like living in history and elegance. Everything is perfect: rooms, restaurants, common areas and location. It is worth to have the Danieli experience even if it is for a few days. Beware that when you'll be there you won't feel like visiting Venice but you will be happy staying inside. No worries, all the most special sites in the city are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ekzooks
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Danieli was marvelous. Accomodations were wonderful and the location put us in the heart of Venice. The concierge was extremely helpful with suggestions, directions and reservations, even the maids were superfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Just OK for Price”
Reviews.Author: BrianRI
Reviews.Content: I may be spoiled from other luxury hotels in France and Italy, but my wife and I found the Danieli just OK for the price. This was our third luxury hotel of our stay in Italy. We weren't unhappy, but we weren't really wow'd either. It was extremely busy and the staff harried. The location is fabulous, and the common areas could be beautiful, if restored. Definitely in need of deferred maintance. Also, I consider myself to be an engaged and informed traveler. However, the concierge staff, to me the flag bearers of any good hotel, were officious, harried and disinterested in intelligent discourse. All I wanted was a nice, unhurried 5 minute discussion about my research on restaurants and was greated with "nice choices, here's a card on somewhere else to consider. Not good treatement for 550 Euros a night. And I'm happy to tip well for my 5 mintues. For a bit more, I'd go with the Cipriani and take their launch back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the Sun Terrace”
Reviews.Author: ros1949
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just had the most amazing stay at this wonderful hotel. For us the highlight must be breakfast on the Sun Terrace - what a view and the food was pretty good too!!! (We were very fortunate in that for the entirety of our stay we had wall-to-wall sunshine). As we were a group of six retired ladies with one of our party having slight mobility problems, I contacted the Hotel before we left requesting three twin rooms with at least one of the rooms having a walk-in shower. These requests were dealt with immediately and with great curtesey and the three rooms we were allocated were all next to each other and were absolutely beautiful. They were very spacious with lovely decor and the beds themsevles were extremely comfortable with pristine bedding. The bathrooms were also very spacious and clean. The room I shared also had a dressing area which my friend and I found very useful. All the staff we encountered were very professional and friendly. In fact we cannot fault this Hotel. If anyone reading this review gets the opportunity to stay at the Danieli, do not hesitate. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for. Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilNichols
Reviews.Content: 1 minute walk to St. Mark's square, right on the lagoon equals a great location for this world famous hotel. Beautiful room with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unattentive service lets it down”
Reviews.Author: Foodita
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice with my husband on a business trip and was very much looking forward to staying at the Danieli. We had a fabulous time in Venice which is more beautiful and fascinating than I ever imagined.
