On the plus side at the Danieli ............................ -The terrace has to be mentioned first, possibly the finest view in the whole of Venice and having breakfast on a sunny morning and watching the 'theatre show 'that is Venice happening below is sublime. Breakfast was delicious, it is efficiently run with pleasant service. -It is very centrally located, right by St Marks Square and the Doges Palace. There are Vaporetti stops right outside the hotel and it is easy to go any where you want. On your first morning take either the no. 1 (slow and stops at every stop) or no. 2 and travel down the Grand Canal to take in the sights and get your bearings. -Our room was spacious and well planned and the bathroom was immaculate. We had a side and roof top view of the Doges Palace (unfortunately under cover at the moment!). Our was in the newer section of the hotel, I understand that some of the side view rooms in the oldest part of the hotel are very dark. -Bed was exceptional! -Soundproofing in the hotel is excellent The negatives................................ -f you don't like crowds it may not be the hotel for you. When you step out of the hotel doors it is like stepping into Oxford Street on a Saturday, this is due to its close proximity to St Mark's Square and the palace - everyone in Venice wants to visit! -Everything is extra even the TV! -Some staff, and particularly the concierge are not polite and attentive. Some ignore you whilst they talk among themselves at the desk, do not acknowledge you when they take your keys and seem to find it hard to look you in the eye. -Check in and check out can be a long process. -It can be impossible to get hold of guest services on the telephone. I have never experienced such a thing at a hotel before. When you finally do they say they will ring you back and don't. We wasted so much time trying to get codes for wireless network every day and tracing our missing complimentary water. -At 450 euros per night I did not feel the hotel was value for money and unfortunately this is mainly because of our experience with concierge and guest services. To conclude, I would not stay in the Danieli again and the main reason for this is the poor standard of service. Many of the staff downstairs seem weary of tourists and I think they need to take more of an interest in the individuals they are dealing with. It is also worth considering that whilst in Venice for a long weekend you tend to pack your days (well we did!), there is so much to see and we hardly spent any time in the room. Couple of tips, Think twice on the Gondelas, and shop around! If you want a water taxi from the airport consider booking it a couple of days before you go and check the weather before hand! Many people we spoke to had arrived in the rain (we were lucky). Believe me, you see very little if it is pouring and may as well save the money and get the water bus link (check they stop near your hotel)! If it is sunny it is a wonderful way to arrive! I booked ours direct through www.venicelink.com and I think it was reasonably priced compared to what others had paid. Also if your suitcase is heavy get a trolley from the airport! 1 Euro deposit - it is a 7 minute walk from the airport to the water taxis (seems longer) and that is tough on shoulders when you are dragging an over weight suitcase. The Vaporetti are a wonderful mode of transport and great way to see Venice - buy passes and stay on them for as long as you like!

Reviews.Title: “Indulge yourself just once”
Reviews.Author: Mariner59
Reviews.Content: Taking a water taxi from the airport to the Danieli (Euro100 and very easy) is one of life's great experiences, being ferried directly to the landing of the hotel and met by the Concierge. The staff are exceptional, and respond well to amateur attempts at Italian language. I found they could not do enough for me, and responded immediately to any requests. The hotel has centuries of style and class emanating from every inch of the building, with a spectacular foyer that is worth visiting even if you are not a guest. The location makes the splurge worthwhile, and one must stay overnight in Venice when all the crowds have returned to their cruise ships. A short walk to St Marks Square and all the major attractions. Alleyways around the hotel selling everything you need - food, coffee, masks, glass, clothing ... Eating breakfast on the 5th floor terrace watching Venice come to life is a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has the best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: leyswick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Daneili Hotel for 2 nights following a cruise. We arrived at 9.30,am, and were told that our room was ready and available. We were shown up to a huge luxurious room, with a huge marble bathroom, and a little dressing room. The decore was old fashioned luxury, with tapestry covered walls, and matching drapes, and a beautiful Murano glass chandelier. The original hotel has spread out and taken over the ajoininghotel building where our room was, but couldn't fault it. Our friends were unlucky, their room wasn't ready till 3.30 in the afternoon, but they wrere given a bottle of champagne to compensate. Their room was in the main hotel, but room and bathroom wrere not as big or as nice as ours.The breakfast served on the terrace (in good weather ) was very good, lots of choice. I was a bit surprised to be charged 5 Euros for 15 minutes use of the computer in the lounge to check in on line.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Room Charge Not informed in Advance”
Reviews.Author: emyl0909
Reviews.Content: The hotel room rates are expensive but the maintenance and service standard is not up to the level of the price. At the check out time, I was told that my previous payment made on the web had been undercharged by around Euro 40. I was willing to pay extra but they should have informed me in advance during my check in time instead of during the checking out.

Reviews.Title: “the best location in venice”
Reviews.Author: michael_zrh
Reviews.Content: simply, the best location of all the venice hotels. however, once it comes to cleanliness and service, there's a serious problem. we booked two lagoon view rooms / size of rooms in modern building ok, decor Danieli like (a bit too plushy) and a great view. however, the panty's and bra we found on the window (which was obviously left by some guests before us) did not pay tribute to the accuracy of the housekeeping staff ... also, we asked for wash clothes and vanity / tooth brush glasses. we only got the missing bottle opener ... stay here for the history and the ambiance rather than the service ..

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyhh
Reviews.Content: Venice is very expensive, but if you go down some of the side streets, you can find some less expensive, restaurants. and places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “where was the luxury?”
Reviews.Author: jesspete
Reviews.Content: Our stay was suppose to be 3 nights but we only stayed 1 night. The service was so cold-it seemed like we were bothering them for anything. I don't think they like Americans! The room was dinghy and old-the bed felt like I was sleeping on hay. i could not move in the shower. The only luxury about the hotel is the beautiful lobby-big deal you are not sleeping in the lobby. I would find something cheaper where they treat you better and the rooms can't be any worse!

Reviews.Title: “Reinvented Luxury”
Reviews.Author: marylou924
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice and had reservations at another hotel. (Rialto) My family and friend walked into the Rialto and immediately knew that the accommodations were less than what the brochure explained. Although on the surface, the hotel appeared clean it was dirty, especially the gray, stained mattress. A one night stay was enough, and that's how we came to the Danieli. Just pulling up to the entrance in the motor taxi needed no other words to describe the cleanliness, service and excellent quality of the hotel. It just takes the entrance of an establishment to create the tone and climate one will encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to blow your wallet and make it your only visit”
Reviews.Author: silverray
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights before and after a cruise out of Venice. First the good: gorgeous setting and palazzo, comfy king size bed, free slippers, beautiful restaurant with gourmet food, nice concierge who says buongiorno. Now the bad: check in and check out was a nightmare both times, wait an hour in line, the reception desk are slow, surly and make a big show of escorting you to your room while 20 others wait in line. Can't the bellhops do this with your luggage? Reception staff stare at computer screens for an eternity and seem to be arguing forever in french, spanish, etc at the person checking in over prices...I had made my reservation online and I thought it would be a snap, but be prepared to stand there for 1-1.5 hours, no joke. The women at the desk are faster and friendlier, the men are a nightmare. Mr. Balbi F. (I memorized the name tag) doesn't smile, he bares his teeth, he's lazy and won't use a calculator to determine the difference between the preauthorization and what you actually spent; then preauthorizes 1100 euros on your credit card which then at checkout they "authorize" plus a second swipe for any remaining difference. Who created this painful system?? On the other hand, I witnessed an ugly American demanding to know what she spent in dollars. Lady, you're in Italy, get out your calculator and do your basic math. So the staff are getting the biggest a**hole tourists and they are totally burned out, in their defense. In general, I wouldn't go back to Venice, least of all in summer; a crowded sweaty decaying city, much less stay here. Be warned about the A/C. Anemic corner units. You will sweat a lot. The bathrooms have no windows and no ventilation, if you shower your room will steam up for hours. ANd the plumbing is funky-hot water comes out of both taps at the sink, you have to wait a few mins for the cold water to come out. I was in 2 different rooms on different floors. I didn't bother reporting because when you call any dept on the phone it rings 25 times so I just gave up. Only room service was attentive to deliver a bucket of ice so I could cool down at night. It was uncomfortably hot and they didn't do a thing about it--too bad dumb turista! Don't bother with a room with a view of the grand canal, the noise will be awful outside of your window. The back rooms are quiet and dark, perfect for sleeping and resting from the tornado of tourists outside your door. My husband called Riva degli Schiavoni "Bourbon Street" because it's so crowded and insane.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristobellSkegness
Reviews.Content: My gorgeous partner and I stayed at the fantastic Danieli Hotel for my 40th birthday in June 2010. The hotel is amazing, like a palace! Everything about our stay was wonderful. The reception staff were very friendly and exceeded out expectations and showed us personally to our room! We stayed in room 64, we had booked a delux double through Citalila, the room was massive, beatifully done and had the most enourmous bed ive ever seen! The Terraza retaurant on the rooftop was amazing and had the best views in Venice! The breakfasts were fantastic as was everything during our stay!!! The location is great being 2 doors up from the Doge's palace and St Marks Square! I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Venice as it was an experience I will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in imperfect city”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonersrtw
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Danieli is a beautiful property on the edge of San Marco Square in Venice. The lobby check in area is a bit cramped and bell service a bit slow (we waited at the water taxi area which is very tight for several minutes for a porter) but overall a perfect property. Front desk service is strong, rooms are immaculate (keeping in mind we stayed in the new tower which I think is a must) and the roof top restaurant *while a massive ripoff* is somethign you must experience. This is a luxury hotel in every sense of the word

Reviews.Title: “Buy a $20 martini,enjoy lobby,save $450 per night”
Reviews.Author: gmaz64
Reviews.Content: Terrible value.One hour wait checking in at "5-star" hotel-pretty lobby,though.Loud rooms,indifferent attitude,ridiculous pricing for quality offered.Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Royalty”
Reviews.Author: auburn8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Danieli began the 19th century as the Royal Danieli Hotel and today it is certainly fit for royalty. This hotel began in the 14th century as Palazzo Dandolo and has been wonderfully preserved and restored. We stayed at the Danieli the last week of June and could not have had a more wonderful experience. Arriving from Marco Polo airport via water taxi we were escorted through their canal side entrance into the most wonderful and ornate lobby I have ever seen. The check-in process was quick and professional with a great multi-lingual staff. We were escorted to our rooms by one of the front desk professionals and our luggage arrived promptly. The rooms were decently sized for Venice and were absolutely gorgeous. The walls were fabric covered, drapes thick and plush, furniture authentic feeling antiques, beds large and comfortable, and the bathroom was marble clad and was beautiful. We tripped a breaker with one of our American electronic devices and engineering was at the room within 5 minutes to get us back running. The turndown service was very nice with some incredible chocolates left on the pillow. The rooms were very well sound proofed as we were above a small street that had parades of World Cup revelers after each goal scored and we never heard them except when we opened the windows. The location on St. Mark's Basin next door to the Bridge of Sighs and around the corner from St. Mark's Square is the absolutely ideal spot for a home base in Venice. There were a couple of negatives that need to be reported. The air conditioning in one of our rooms never could get the room completely cool. As we didn't report this to management I can't complain too much about this. The elevators are very small and very slow. The breakfast buffet at the rooftop restaurant was 100% unchanged for the three days we were there. A superior restaurant with the outstanding chef they have could probably be a little creative and give patrons a little variety (Other than that, the Terrazza is a don't miss experience in Venice, especially at night....Oh, the view!!!!!). Finally, I was most disappointed with the concierge. Other than helping us with a Murano Glass factory tour, they were useless. They would not help with tour reservations, they were little help with restaurant recommendations, and they gave incorrect information to us on at least two occasions. The positives far outway the few negatives. Our stay at the Danieli was a wonderful start to our vacation and it was the ideal base for our first visit to the incredible city of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: BERFB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from two nights at The Danieli in Venice and I have very mixed reviews about our experience. The check in was a disaster. They kept us waiting in a line forever and when they finally got to us, our room wasn't ready. After an hour and a half in Venice, our room still wasn't ready. They finally offered us a drink in the lobby, which is quite beautiful. We were very dissapointed with our room. It was tired and very small. we complained at the front desk and were basically told to take it our leave it. The real highlight of the hotel is the bar on the top floor...it is possibly the best view of venice and the service was excellent. The location of the hotel is also great. Overall this hotel needs a consitent level of service and the rooms need renovating.

Reviews.Title: “A dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom0521
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before boarding a cruise from Venice and loved the hotel. It is an incredibly beautiful building and the lobby is breathtaking. We had a standard room with a view of the lagoon. The service was wonderful and helpful. The room was much larger than we expected and based on previous experience with European hotels. The building is in excellent condition given it's age - it is centuries old. Our standard room included a vestibule, a large dressing room with closet, full length mirror and shelving, a marble -clad bathroom, larger than most bedrooms in my home (and complete with not just a multitude of terry toweling, but also linen towels), and a bedroom that held a kingsize bed, as well as a full sized rollaway bed brought in for my daughter. All rooms, except the bathroom, had fabric covered walls. The public rooms were stunning - the Doge certainly knew how to live. We couldn't get enough of the atmosphere in both the public rooms and in our hotel room. It was a dream hotel, that did not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dgryan1
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel is located directly on the Grand Canal and next to St. Mark's Square - the location doesn't get any better than that in Venice. Our room was in the main section of the hotel and was spacious and well appointed with every thing you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The king size bed was very comfortable with nice linens and soft pillows. And we started every morning with breakfast in the roof top garden restaurant with fantastic views of the canal and excellent food. This historic hotel is actually 3 connected buildings. The lobby features a dramatic two-story staircase and gorgeous Murano glass chandeliers in the lounge. Despite being an old city, Venice is magical and our stay at this hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: LisaChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at the wonderful location of this hotel, the beautiful lobby and the rooftop dining. What wasn't amazing for the money we paid to stay here, was the service. There was a one day strike in Italy, and I believe the hotel should have apologized to us for the total lack of service we had for the day. No one answered the phones, check in was delayed and we had to go to the bar ourselves to get some ice. Not a real hardship, but we were paying over $2500.00 for two rooms for two nights. The service was better the next day, but not what it should have been. An apology would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Amazing Views of the Lagoon!”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at this hotel was wonderful. The location of the hotel couldn't be better; it is a stone's throw from St Mark's Square and is right by the lagoon! The hotel lobby is beautiful and we had a surprisingly large room with a view over the lagoon. The room decor was old world charm and was very tasteful. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The front desk staff was very friendly. We had both breakfast and dinner at the terrace restaurant. The view is amazing, which made the experience great but service was rather slow. At breakfast, sparrows kept landing on the tables - rather off putting! If you're looking for a romantic hotel right by St Mark's Square, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time with incomparable Venetian charm”
Reviews.Author: llyall
Reviews.Content: You would never discover this hotel by the nondescript front of the building (actually, it's three buildings joined together). Once you enter the hotel, take a step back to a time that enjoyed period Venetian architecture and Old World service. This is a luxury hotel, so be aware of the cost. Even if you can afford a short stay, this is a hotel that memories are made of. Don't overlook the restaurant balcony for a spectacular view of the Venice waterfront adjacent to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby Beautiful---The rest disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelandgo
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7---including grandchildren stayed in 3 rooms in June 2010. Upon arriving, the front desk people were very nice & friendly. The lobby was gorgeous and very historic. We stayed in the main building because we wanted the "old world" atmosphere of the rooms but -------I expected old world charm with a little ambience and updating to the rooms. What a disappointment to say the least. The rooms were not cheap nor were they the lower class rooms. Each room was big but very musty smelling and it needed a good updating in drapes, bedspreads, rugs and painting. The bathroom had a pedestal sink with absoutley nowhere to put your toiletries. It was very disappointing out of all the rooms that we stayed in France and Italy. I didn't expect "new" but at least an uplifting of the rooms for the price we paid. Also, the concierge staff was this side of civil! Not friendly at all to us nor to alot of the guests that were staying there. It was not a pleasant experience on our whole 2 week trip to Paris and Italy and we had stayed in some of the best hotels in the world catagory. I would not go back to this hotel---try somewhere else and just go see the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritesh147
Reviews.Content: nice to stay in venice lovely hotel , graet ambience

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TopTips3
Reviews.Content: Having visited the Danieli previously to view the breathtaking staircase and lobby we saved to stay at the Hotel Danieli to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Having read some of the previous reviews (post booking) we were prepared to be disappointed in our expectations. However, from the moment we arrived until the moment we left the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The hotel had arranged a lagoon view room in the beautiful former Dandolo Palazzo part of the hotel . Within minutes of arriving we were treated to a bottle of Champagne and an amazing fruit basket as a gift from the hotel. The breakfast and views from the terrace restaurant were to die for and it was difficult to tear ourselves away in the mornings to explore Venice. We experienced a magical and romantic stay at the Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Venice”
Reviews.Author: Boo-Leigh
Reviews.Content: Loved this beautiful historic hotel. Venice is one of our favourite places and the Danieli is somewhere we always hoped to stay one day. It did not disappoint - started the day with an extensive breakfast (including sparkling wine) on the breathtaking terrace. Luckily we obtained a very good deal with citalia which included breakfast. We stayed in a standard room in the older building next to the main one which was very roomy with a large marble bathroom and the most comfortable bed ever. All staff were very friendly and helpful - would definitely like to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting experience in a beautiful Venetian location”
Reviews.Author: TTMdots
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is beautiful, the terrace is gorgeous and it is hard to believe the beauty when the weather is nice! As we were celebrating our anniversary they offered us a free bottle of champange, which was a nice touch. Do not expect views from most rooms. Our room had creaky floors and a bit of dust on the headboard. The bathroom was old but clean. The breakfast was not included in the rate and it is very expensive 45 euros per person. The terrace is amazing though and this is what you pay I suppose... It would be nice if the hotel was to offer more information about the building, which is historic and beautiful, instead we found out more information from friends and locals in Venice. One of the best restaurants with reasonable prices is just a few steps from the hotel. It is called Wildner and we highly recommend it. Some Murano glass factories offers free taxi rides from the hotel to Murano.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning!!!”
Reviews.Author: probinson09
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel on the lagoon. We had lagoon view rooms, breakfast was excellent, travelled with young children and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The best location - but service lets this gorgeous 13th century palace down”
Reviews.Author: Coolkoala
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lagoon view room in the wonderful old palazzo and the room was beautifully decorated, with antique furniture, an extremely comfortable bed, Murano chandelier and huge opening windows with of course, the view over the Giudecca which is completely stunning. To lean out of the window and watch the scene below could waste hours! The bathroom is well appointed. The location is absolutely stunning and the interior of the palace most interesting and ornate. The breakfast was very good and to sit on the roof terrace looking at that view is one of the most memorable experiences. The service from the waiting/bar staff was superb and perhaps the rest of the staff in the hotel should try to emulate them. I agree with the other reviewer who said they acted as though it was our privilege to stay here. Whilst I agree it IS a privilege to stay here, at the prices charged some of the other staff should be a little bit more helpful and accomodating. They act as though it is a problem to deal with the people and wish we would all go away. It is very expensive but then you don't get to stay in a 13th century palace every day. Just a small change to attitudes would go a long way. I also agree with the reviewer who said the loos in the lobby were a disgrace. Appalling for a hotel of this category, no loo roll, filthy, needing a complete renovation. We had a great time but it seems to me they are relying heavily on the antiquity of the place and not dealing with the service quite so well.

Reviews.Title: “Lifestyles of the rich and famous”
Reviews.Author: oceanroad4
Reviews.Content: We arrived via private launch to the waterside entrance to the Danieli we didn't have to touch our luggage everything was taken care of without asking. We then checked in although it was very busy at the time we were there, the staff were apologetic and very pleasant. Our room was beautiful and we loved the toiletries in the bathroom. We overlooked the side canal and in the afternoons we could hear the gondaliers singing. The restaurant on the terrace was just gorgeous and we had breakfast there which was a stunning buffet. The Hotel is located right next to the Doge's Palace and is very central to St Mark's. I would highly recommend that you budget in a stay at the Danieli if only for a night to experience the luxury of this fine Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXQUISITE”
Reviews.Author: Jools100
Reviews.Content: Firslty a private water taxi from the airport to the Danieli jetty is a must. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was divine. Bed was so comfortable, a huge bathroom with 2 wash basins, plenty of cabinet space for ones things, a professional hairdryer, plenty of toiletries etc. Towels changed twice a day, bed turn down service complete with chocolates! Plenty of hangers and drawer space too, all as you would expect but don't always get in some 'luxury' hotels. Makes The Hilton and Grosvenor in London look like youth hostels. Yes the restaurant is not cheap, our food was divine. Jaw dropping views from the restaurant terrace, what a way to start the day! Staff very helpful and polite. Location couldn't be better. The Danieli oozes character with a few corners knocked off, what else do you expect from a 14th century palace? If you want a pristine condition hotel then go to plastic Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel in very busy location”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is impressive, as are the hallways as you are in a 600 year old castle. The room not so much, although we were upgraded and they say it was rennovated . The room itself was a decent size as was the bathroom, but it lacked the feeling of luxury you would expect from a hotel in this price range. The staff were on the whole quite accomodating, but didn't go out of their way for you. I got the feeling that they felt it was a privilege to be staying there. As far as location, you couldn't get more central, which is both good and bad. We were there on a weekend, and every time we went out of the hotel there were literally thousands of people from the cruise ships docked there for the day. It was a bit of a zoo, and next time I would opt for a location a bit more off the beaten path. Good tip for breakfast, if 55 euros per person is a bit steep for you, there is a hotel to the left called the Londra that had a wonderful buffet for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Let down”
Reviews.Author: thepasserby
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and myself and my wife were staying in Milan and booked to travel through to Venice for lunch at the Danielli, having been led to believe that it was superb. In the first instance, there is a difference between faded elegance, and desperately in need of renovation, and the Danielli ticked the latter. The toilets are a disgrace and a public health hazard. We all ordered a pre lunch Bellini which was nothinhlike a Bellini,. It was cheap proschecu with weak peach juice. Having booked to dine on the terrace we duly took our places and perused the menu. after a lengthy wait the food arrived and one of the party found a long hair in his starter. The waiter removed the offending plate and joked that since he was bald it could not have been his! A salad was ordered to repace the offending dish and almost ten minutes later when the rest of us had finished our starters still no salad had appeared. We complained and were given the most absurd reason for the delay, namely that as other customers had ordered the same salad we would have to wait until the kitchen had seen to these customers before he could be seen to!! There was no apology, no attempt to make good, nothing. Any respectable eatery, never mind a hotel of such pretentions, would have seen the offended customer as a priority, but not the Danielli. The rest of the meal was edible but of no great merit. As we left, there had still be no apology for their poor and really quite amatuerish service. In short, the food is grossly overpriced, the service poor and the hotel in general is living on past glory. Certainly not worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Allamur
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli offers the best service what you can imaging. Location and the staff are exellent. We had a wonderful time and a great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not a luxury collection service”
Reviews.Author: 102410c
Reviews.Content: The check in was really strange. I gave them all they needed and one man accompany us to the room without saying one word ( i didn t wanted to take breakfast there but even if i did i never knew where it was and the some with the other services they offered) Then two bellboys brought our 3 lugagges and without a word disapeared. The hotel is very nice (we didn t have a nice view but well, you are two steps away from a venetian postcad, the location the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: love_2_travel666
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. If you like old world charm and antique furniture and fittings then pick this hotel. The room was surprisingly large, plenty of storage and the bathroom again was very large in comparison to modern hotels. We had booked a Deluxe room, we were offered on arrival a room at the front of the hotel for an extra charge, to which we declined, and pleased we did as the room we had was on the small canal side and very peaceful, I can only imagine that although we would have had excellent views of the grand canal, it would have been noisy as it was very busy at the waterfront. I know some people have said they were disappointed with the furniture and fittings etc, but bearing in mind the age of the building and the history that goes with it what did they expect? It is in an excellent location, we looked at the Cipriani before we booked and glad we chose the Danieli for location it couldnâ€™t be beat. If you stay at the Cipriani you need to rely on water taxis to get you over to the main island. Right outside the hotel are the gondolas, and the public transport Vaporetto water bus stops. The concierges are excellent, very welcoming always a good morning and a good evening, if you smile and speak to them they speak back!! The staff at breakfast have to put up with some very rude customers, which we regularly observed, but always dealt with them with a smile, we have no complaints there, we were always met with a pleasant good morning and shown to our table. Breakfast is expensive if you are not booked on a B & B basis and have to add it to your bill, so I would recommend booking in advance. The view is worth it though, we were lucky in that we had bright sunny mornings to enjoy breakfast on the terrace. We were on an American breakfast plan, this meant we had a full choice from the buffet. Fresh tea and coffee brought to the table by waiters, then help yourself to the juice, water, champagneâ€¦â€¦and as much as you can eat, from fruit and cereals to a full cooked breakfast. We ate heartily before venturing out as you need a lot of stamina to get around Venice. We never saw the maid, but she was like a secret fairy. Each time we left our room, we would return to find clean towels and beds made, on one occasion we must have had 3 sets of towels in one day, and on an evening the bed was turned down and chocolates left. They could do with getting the air conditioning improved, even the receptionist who showed us to our room complained it was too hot and flung open the windows and shutters to let the air in. It was very warm on an evening, we closed the shutters for privacy but left the windows open but there was very little air coming in. We were on the second floor in the original building, overlooking the side canal, and over the rooftops. Each afternoon, when we went back to our room for a rest, we could hear the gondoliers serenading their guests, amazingly it was always Japanese tourists, maybe they are the only ones who can afford it? The hotel has its own boat dock which was excellent, we had pre-booked a shared water taxi through a website â€˜Viatorâ€™ it was the most reasonable on costs. They took us right up to the dock and picked us up from the dock 4 days later, right on schedule. We used the hotel internet it was â‚¬5 for 15 minutes, which is average for most places, it gave us ample time to check in for our return flight home, it is also attached to a printer so we could print off our boarding cards saving time at the airport. The internet room is a very dark library room, but very calm and peaceful next to reception. I canâ€™t comment on the cafÃ© bar area, mainly as we wanted to experience Venice we ate and drank outside. We found some very quaint and cheap restaurants not too far from the hotel, if you are prepared to venture down dark alleys it is amazing what you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Full of old fashion charm”
Reviews.Author: Brizard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our two young children. The Danieli lived up to our expectations, beautiful interior. Rooms were a little small but made up for the fact we were in the old part of the hotel. Staff were very professional and friendly. Venice is a wow destination and we enjoyed our stay. We were let down by the local restaurants around St Marks Square who were only interested in giving poor service, over charging us and terrible( not in the Danieli!) food! Come on tourist board, smarten up these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJBrit
Reviews.Content: This was a top hotel, they did everything to please, the food, service was great, clean hotel room. Only down side is the elevators don't connect so anyone with walking problems this isn't the hotel for you. Breakfast was great outdoors overlooking the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, but quite simply not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AideenY
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Danieli in Venice; the hotel is undeniably stunning although our rooms on the 2nd floor in the main palace overlooked a small side street that tended to be noisy early in the morning and late at night. Our standard rooms were spacious and lovely although the bathrooms were small, cramped and rather run-down - not at all consistent with the opulence of the hotel in general. Service was extremely substandard overall - we found the public bathrooms without toilet paper; maids did not remove empty glasses and cups from our room when doing the turn-down service; and a bedside lamp with a nonworking bulb which I removed in order to demonstrate that it needed to be replaced, remained untouched. Not what you would expect from a 5* hotel, and certainly not consistent with the prices. Our rate was room only and the buffet breakfast cost a staggering 50 euros per person; the continental breakfast which consisted of a glass of juice, a hot drink and a very ordinary basket of pastries cost 32 euros per person. With 4 of us, this represented a significant additional cost. With a glass of wine costing 15 euros each, a couple of drinks each in the lobby in the evening was also highway robbery (that's if anyone even bothered to come near us to to see if we wanted anything). On the other hand, we found the concierges to be extremely helpful - they made several restaurant recommendations, all of which were excellent and exactly in the price range we had specified. If you are interested in visiting Murano, I would urge you to take the public bus there rather than the (ostensibly) free Danieli launch. This delivered us to a showroom where we were welcomed and shown some glassblowers at work. We were then escorted around a huge showroom full of stunning pieces and subjected to a very "hard-sell". When we enquired as to whether there were other glass workshops on the island we could visit we were told that there was no point, and that we might as well go back to Venice. We later learned from friends who had travelled out on the public vaporetto that there were numerous glass showrooms; they had wandered around the island and even visited a little church there. Finally, another consideration may be that, while the location of the Danieli appears enviable - just steps from the Doges' Palace and St Marks' Square - at peak times the scene just outside the front door resembles Oxford St at rush hour. In the future, I would definitely opt for a quieter location. Overall, we had a wonderful time, but if you have plenty of money to spend, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with a steep price”
Reviews.Author: leramd30
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the administration was very interested in my opinion. Do not order room service especially at night(not good) The restorant in the hotel very expencive but great quality of food. Matresses are worse then in Motel 6 total mismatch with the rest of hotel plus appliances are outdated.

Reviews.Title: “A place to remember but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Alockyer
Reviews.Content: Booked the Danieli because of its history and luxurious image. Whilst the hotel certainly does embody all that Venice is about, its massively over priced. Granted the Euro means that travelling in Europe is costly at the moment, but the Danieli makes it so you cannot even afford a drink at the end of the day. With a small cup of hot chocolate priced at Â£8, sadly its not possible to spend any time in the luxurious surroundings of the hotel. We had to spend our time between exploring and going out for dinner, in the bedroom. As there were no drink making facilities the only thing I could afford to do was relax in the luxrious bath. Overall the hotel is well worth visiting and a real pleasure to stay at. Even the cheapest rooms are big enough and stylish with a very comfortable bed. Don't be fooled when they try and get you to upgrade for double the money - not worth it as rooms are not much bigger. Hotel restaurant was disppointing for the money - really dated and the food was not 5 star - especially with main courses at Â£50! Average meal for two will be at least Â£200 and I've had better meals for a fraction of the price. In fact did not rate the cuisine in Venice at all. Also note they insist on men wearing a jacket and trousers and yet most men in there were in jeans. To sum up, beautifully grand hotel but its not perfect and rather dated in every way. Also smell of cat wee fills the first floor - not ideal! Location is perfect though and if its good enough for Elizabeth Taylor, its good enough for me

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: woodsLondon
Reviews.Content: Having excitedly made a reservation to celebrate our wedding anniversary and my Birthday, we were extremely disappointed from the moment we arrived at the Danieli for our 3 night stay. When we checked in my husband enquired if there would be any chance of an upgrade, we were told that it was possible at a charge of â‚¬240 extra per night. Our room was in the new building at the side with no view and extremely small. We then had lunch at the 'amazing' La Terrazza restaurant, the staff were unwelcoming, the table linen and staff were scruffy and certainly not 5* quality. More importantly the food was very disappointing, we would certainly not recommend the Danieli to any of our friends and we will never return to Danieli or any other hotel in their chain.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tripsnjunk
Reviews.Content: They call it the most famous hotel in the world, and I have nothing but raves. It was only by travelling during the dead of winter and with an amazing Starwood Points deal that we booked this hotel. We got one of the rooms on with a balcony- in the renovated part. The view was amazing- of the grand canal and Saint Mark's square- literally like staying in the middle of a post card. Venice itself is kind of a parody of itself, but this hotel, by itself, made our Venice stay a memorable one. It's located right on St. Marks square- wouldn't want to see the crowds during the "high" season for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise in Venice- Hotel Danieli”
Reviews.Author: rwingate
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Danieli in Venice. I must admit that most reviews I read about the property were mixed but I was surprised- We had a great stay. We had a room in the most recently renovated wing of the hotel. We had a room facing the lagoon with a balcony. The room itself was small but with the balcony it was quite nice. It was clean. The bathroom was terrific too! updated and very plush. I would stay here again. The staff was a little uneven and hard to predict. But overall I was surprised- very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venetian”
Reviews.Author: blackster
Reviews.Content: I had mixed expectations of what the Danielli would be like, but thought "why not" and was glad I chose it. The public rooms are really quite beautiful as was our room in the old part of the hotel. The furniture and decor were good antiques as opposed to the usual "5 star" reproduction tat most hotels think its OK to put in their rooms. The service was excellent, friendly, helpful and professional but the main benefit of this hotel is the rooftop restaurant, the view is amazing, eating breakfast there in the morning watching the equivalent of a venetian autobahn is truly breathtaking and something I would recommend to anyone. We had one evening meal there and watching the sun go down during our meal was quite spectacular. The evening meal was the only slight disappointment as although excellent was michelin star prices without being quite that level.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Palace Luxury in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: CathyBNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Danieli four times, from 2005 to 2008, as Venice is a favorite stop for us in Italy. The hotel is in a prime location a stone's throw from the Doge's Palace and San Marco. The staff has always been welcoming, and there is nothing quite like the experience of arriving at the front door of your hotel on a mahogany boat! The lobby is a testament to the genius of Murano with stunning hand-blown chandeliers, and I enjoyed walking the stairs to each level where portraits and furniture adorn the space and leave you with the impression of palace life. Rooms are elegant in the old building, and slightly larger in the "newer" annex. We enjoyed the view from the top floor rooms of this building (only available from the top floor), where although small terraces abound in this wing, the lower floors face the prisons of Doge's palace. From here you can listen to the hourly toll of the bells of San Marco and be transported into another time. The views from the restaurant are amazing, and although exhorbitant, I highly recommend indulding in at least one buffet breakfast. I could almost envision the Doge's Bucintoro while sipping my coffee, and the photos we captured from here are some of our most memorable!

Reviews.Title: “stay at the cirpiani instead”
Reviews.Author: MarVaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a museum; stunning architecturally and of tremedous historic value, but lacking the levels of comfort and luxury that its price tag implies. We stayed there for a long weekend and were dissapointed with our room and bathroom wich seemed to have the same decoration it probably had in the 50s with all the wear and tear to go with it. It is unquestionable that the staff do their best to provide the best possible experience but the "hardware" simply isn't there. If you are considering the Danieli then you are clearly willing to pay a high price for your stay so my suggestion is : Visit the Danieli for dinner to marvel and the public rooms - but stay at the Cipriani for real comfort and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is alot nicer when it isn't raining.”
Reviews.Author: practical
Reviews.Content: The Danieli was built as the Gothic Palazzo Danolol and has been the leading hotel in Venice since 1820.Many of the walls are off kilter. The stairs in the wing of the Daneili are so crooked the carpet on the stairs is deceivingly like a barber pole. This hotel (Danieli) is an ancient, (well, will you go for old?) villa, with winding staircases, indoor bridges between buildings, and elevators built for no more than 3 small persons. It has a proper lobby, with piano, intricate woodwork, and an inviting living room feeling. But beware, there is a caution on the drinks menu there is to be â€œno dancingâ€œ. My hotel room was gorgeous, w/ brocade fabric on the walls matching the bedspread and drapes, marble bathrooms and windows that actually open. It was on the side of the building, and it overlooked a small canal and a terrace with greenery. Breakfast was on the top floor looking out over the Grand Canal, The package I had included breakfast (and 3 nights for the price of 2). The rack rate for breakfast was 52 euros. Internet connections were 27 euros. OUCH. When I went down to the lobby to review my bill and to arrange a transfer on my last morning one of the elevators from the restaurant to the lobby was out of order. The reason for this I learned was that certain areas of the lobby were flooded, including the hall in front of the elevator. Because of this situation I was told I could stay in my room until I could get a taxi (water) after high tide around 3 PM. During this mini flood most of the staff wore high water rubber boots and were quite casual about the high tide. There was even a fellow who used a squeege on the marble floor to try to keep back the tide. Venice is a lot nicer when it isnâ€™t raining. But the food is just as good, the landscape can't be matched and everyone is experiencing the same conditions. La Dolce Vita.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotels”
Reviews.Author: HHIsland
Reviews.Content: Remarkable and luxurious, Hotel Danieli is made up of three beautiful Venetian palazzi dating back to the 14th, 19th, and 20th Centuries, featuring hand-made Murano glass chandeliers, precious rugs, hand-carved marble columns, and many original antique pieces. 20th century Palazzo Danieli Excelsior was refurbished in 2008, the redesign of its interiors entrusted to renowned design architect Jacques Garcia. Hotel Danieli is located in one of the most prestigious positions in Venice, just a few steps from Saint Markâ€™s square, looking out over the lagoon and its myriad of islands. The hotel's setting so close to Piazza San Marco conveniently locates it next to shopping, museums, outdoor cafÃ©s, and the most interesting attractions Venice has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel itself is an attraction”
Reviews.Author: bon800
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building which is a piece of history (14th century palace). The interior is amazing and worth a visit even if you're not staying there. The lobby area is great. The location is fantastic (just a stones throw from Piazza San Marco). The rooms are decorated in antique venetian style and the shuttered windows open onto an amazing view of venice's busy sea port - quite an experience. A bit noisy outside but the location is worth the noise in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Our romantic stay at Danieli, Venice”
Reviews.Author: SusanG4
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect. Staff were attentive, friendly & polite, food and service in restaurant second to none,wonderful view whilst enjoying breakfast. The Danieli has so much charm and character,our room was tastefully decorated and loved the fact they even provided slippers with hotel logo. Definately worth saving up for,made our first trip to Venice truely memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but be prepared for the crowds”
Reviews.Author: jw713
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Danieli for 3 nights in September '09. Here's a brief summary of our stay: - As we somewhere expected, there was a lot of people. We however didn't expect the amount that there was and didn't expect it to be pretty much all day & night. - Hotel does NOT have an iron for you to use in your room. If you want to have your clothes ironed it will be very pricey. - Room had a great view of the water. With the window closed we hardly heard any of the noise from outside. - Room was very small (a little smaller than expected) and bathroom was even smaller....even though everything was so small we made it work. - In room internet was only wired but was pretty reasonably priced. If I were to stay in Venice again I don't think I'd stay at the Danieli. It was a nice hotel but we enjoyed getting away for the day to avoid all the crowds. Most of the restaurants near the hotel are expensive since it's so close to St. Mark's square. The Danieli's restaurant is extremely expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAQ_SHJ
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the Danielis for around a week for me the hotel was a BIT overrated if you are used to modern hotels with the arge bathrooms big plasma screens in the room i dnt think its ur hotel the hotel is perfect because you cant find any other hotel with a better location , if you been to venice you will know why you need the location , traveling in venice is not that easy and the hotel is in the centre so no need to use the boats to travel if you were in that part of the city i think the location made it up for the other things .

Reviews.Title: “We were unable to cancel our reservation 8 weeks in advance!”
Reviews.Author: HerewegoagainUsa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and then needed to cancel. They would not let me...If I canceled I had to pay 1004Euro anyway. This has been a nightmare. What a colossal rip-off.!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel bur fabulous terrasse”
Reviews.Author: BorisOG
Reviews.Content: Well, there are fore sure certains hotels around the world that everybody want to visit one day... and to me the Danieli is part of those mythics hotels in which I wanted to stay once. If the rooms (deluxe) are okay with a small terrasse, it's not that clean; expecially the bathrooms. To my the worst experience was at the reception upon arrival. This lady said my client's room was ready but not mine (which is quite normal for me that usually my room is not ready)... She asked me to wait "for a while" and gave my clients their key. We had a rendez-vous 30 minutes later so of course you want to refresh a little bit. After 10 minutes I asked her again for the room and she looked very surprised and said "minimum two hours"! Of course I did not accept at all and she had to find a solution by giving me another room. It's not acceptable in a 5 * hotels. You're not expecting people to say "wait for a while" with no further explanations! Now, despite this terrible service upon arrival it has to be said that the location of the hotel is just perfect. I can highly recommend to eat at the terrasse on the top floor; the view is just amazing; and the quality of the food and service are very good. The american breakfast also is good and they have a great choice of dishes. Plus, there is an extraordinary maitre d'hÃ´tel in this restaurant, you really feel comfortable with this multi-language gentleman! So... it's okay to stay at the Danieli but don't expect too much; the myth of the place is quite bigger than reality.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very disappointing experience.”
Reviews.Author: mojo2
Reviews.Content: I wish we had stayed at a different hotel. The day after we checked in, we found out that the showers were not draining. We stayed in a suite so there were 2 showers. I took a shower in ankle deep water so I advised my husband to use the second shower and he experienced the same. We were moved to a different room after we complained. The morning of check out, we found out we did not have hot water. I did not expect those types of problems from 5 star hotels when I am paying around $1200 a night. When I ordered a rollaway bed for my child it took them 30 minutes to bring it to the room. When I inquired about train tickets to a concierge, he told me to go to the next building and buy them myself. I also lost a pair of pants at the hotel. When I called the hotel, I was told that nothing turned out. Overall, it was not a good experience especially for the value of the money.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful breakfast, hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: wwtrav
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for one week at the hotel, we were in the newer section, the air conditioner does not work, it was very hot, even though the temperature was turned down to the lowest level. The door key sticks, we were locked out and the hotel had to replace a plate for us to get in. The lobby is nice, the breakfast terrace is fantastic with a beautiful view of Venice, the buffet and the service was good. Overall, I'm not sure the hotel is worth the money, the decor of the room was average.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cocoaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Danieli in mid July. I picked it mainly for the location and that was really the only benefit. We had a room in the remodeled building of the hotel with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. That was the highlight! It was worth the extra cost to be able to sit outside and watch Venice go by and then join in whenever we wanted. The service was stuffy and tired. The internet didn't work and we had to reconnect several times. I now notice I was charged for those reconnects! I am in the restaurant business and decided to take the concierge's recommendation for one of our meals. I asked him for a really great restaurant with great food away from tourists. We paid 450 Euro for a mediocre meal with a bottle of wine and every language of the world being spoken in the dining room. I felt taken advantage of by both the hotel and the restaurant! The Danieli is beautiful and with a perfect location but the service needs renovation as badly as the remaining buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gourmetwashington
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for the Danieli. However, everything from check-in through our stay was disappointing. We had to wait almost 30 minutes to check-in while the inefficient clerks at the front desk checked in what seemed like an entire cruise line. We were paying almost $700 per night for a room. We were given what must have been the worst room in the hotel. It was on the 2nd floor, above the kitchen service entrance, and next to a service area for room service carts. There was no air conditioning. At night, between the loud staff, smoking, laughing and what seemed like screaming, directly below our window and the loud staff right outside our door, there was no chance of sleeping. The room was hot and smelled musty. The staff were not friendly. Rather, they treated us with an air of contempt. This hotel needs to beef up its friendliness and beware - the rooms on the website are NOT what the rooms actually look like when you stay.

Reviews.Title: “We adored the Danieli!”
Reviews.Author: EDJtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Danieli made our beautiful trip to Venice even more delightful. It was a one-of-a-kind hotel: charming, elegant and completely unlike anywhere we've stayed before. To top it all off, the location was perfect, just a two-minute walk from Piazza San Marco and Doge's Palace. We enjoyed so many things about our room: the starched linen sheets, the gorgeous Murano glass chandelier, the entirely marble bath, beautiful parquet wood floors, and the cleanliness. This hotel used to be the palace of Doge Dondalo and it shows in the hotel lobby and stunning marble staircases. We attended a dinner in the Marco Polo room in the adjoining building, which is also part of the Danieli, and we loved the scent of leather and fine wood in that section of the hotel. The hotel's rooftop terrace restaurant is its crowning jewel. We looked forward to lingering over breakfast there each morning, enjoying the view of the St. Mark's Basin and other islands, as well as the cool breeze. The staff was charming and attentive. It was a delight to encounter the concierge staff each time we dropped off and picked up our tasseled room key. I read a few critical reviews of the Danieli before we traveled, and I suppose that if you're expecting a brand new metropolitan Hyatt, you will find things to snipe about. But this is VENICE, an ancient city, and the Danieli is a former palace that is several hundred years old. I was actually amazed at how beautifully restored it was, and I couldn't focus on a small crack in the marble or a slight chip on the built-in wardrobe when there was so much overt charm and uniqueness around me. We stayed in the old(?) part of the hotel....the part where the lobby and reception desk are located. I spoke with someone who had a room in the "other" part of the hotel and it sounded like their room didn't have quite as much "personality" as ours, although she commented that it was perfectly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service - Good breakfast and Terrace view: Definitely the more expensive is not always the best...”
Reviews.Author: pergo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before going on a cruise. The check in was slow and the receptionist was not very friendly. The service is really really really bad, definitely not what you will expect when paying THAT price for a hotel room. Concierge was rude and not very amicable. The bed was soooo soft that you just sink in it! we end up with a horrible back pain. Good breakfast and the view on the terrace is very nice. The check out was sooo bad: we asked for a porter to help with the luggage and he never showed up, we had to bring the bags ourselves, and the guy when we finally met him was expecting a tip!! i told the lady in the front desk about the bad service, and she only said: we are not enough to do everything!!!! On our return from the cruise, we stayed in the Sofitel, and what a difference: 1/3 of the price and a magnificent service...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view in a historic hotel with exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: djwells
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. They really go over the top with the service. Wife an I took a nice Gondola ride and asked the bar tender if he could get me a bottle of wine. Two minutes later he shows up with a bottle of wine, in ice, with cups and a jar of nice nuts to enjoy our ride. Now that's class. one building is over 600 years old with the second one called the "new building" since it was built 300 years ago. The hotel will also arrange for a nice trip to Murano to see the glass blowing factories.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mattyguy
Reviews.Content: Its the best hotel, ideally located and well worth it

Reviews.Title: “romantic historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lildee17
Reviews.Content: The Danieli was perfectly romantic for my first wedding anniversary. My husband and I stayed three nights and loved the location (right on the Grand canal near st. Marks). Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room overlooking the grand canal which was lovely and truly reflected the area. The lobby is very impressive and upscale. The location was great and had easy access to the Airport Vaporetto (stopped literally in front of the hotel to the left). My only issue with the Danieli was the staff, I found them to be quite snobby especially the waiter in the lobby bar. Upon arrival we were told our room was not ready and to have a seat in the bar while we waited and so we only ordered drinks & a few snacks since it was an off hour and we wanted to hold out until we got into our room, showered and went out to eat. The waiter at the bar treated us like we were some poor degenerates and was down right rude that we were only ordering light fare (salads, cheeses & paninis) and went as far as sighing while we were ordering. I've travelled to many places around the world and stayed at many types of properties and no matter how upscale this hotel is - a rude sighing waiter is just not acceptable anywhere especially at the Danieli with the prices that guests are paying for their rooms. I absolutely loved the hotel itself and the front desk staff but the bar & conceirge desk were just plain rude, next time - I'll probably stay at the Westin or the Gritti Palace down the canal. We travelled to Murano one day and thought it was worth the ride out - the outer islands are true gems and must less touristy. Food in Venice was disappointing compared to the rest of Italy - but no surprise there, Venice is not known for it's cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foiegraslover
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and is so convenient to the sites of Venice. Id would stay here again in a minute. The staff were very helpful and always willing to help. The lobby is jawdropping and the hallways to the rooms are very unique. The room I stayed in was very large but seemed a bit outdated. No duvet?!? Wasn't the best room I have stayed in but it was far from the worst. I would like to try a different room next time. Id stay here again in a minute. Food and Beverage is too expensive. So many better choices outside the hotel and much much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Venice? Thought it was heaven!”
Reviews.Author: SRQtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk through the door into the reception area, you know you are in a very special hotel. The lobby will take your breath away! The staff at reception are professional and helpful. We were shown two choices before we made our decision. The location is perfect, just over the Bridge of Sighs, and we could walk everywhere. The hotel is at a water bus stop, so easy to haul luggage without a walk. We chose the newly decorated room in the Excelsior part of the hotel. No view, but the room was beautiful The bed was the best we've had during our month holiday throughout Europe. The marble bath was decadent. Loved the rain shower and heated towel bars. Also the white marble vanity with tri-fold mirror and lit make-up mirrow was wonderful. Lush robes and bath products were appreciated. The concierge desk was excellent. Alessio greeted us our first morning and supplied us with a map noted with all the attractions in Venice. Included in our rate was a wonderful American breakfast buffet. When the weather permits, tables are set on the rooftop terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. Sparrows come to the edge of the tables waiting for their "treats". Beautiful inner lobbies with huge orchids on the tables. We never took an elevator, except up for breakfast, so we could walk through the corridors and appreciate the furnishings and decor. If we ever return to Venice, there is no other hotel we would consider. Yes, it is expensive, but our stay here is the highlight of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the most romantic city”
Reviews.Author: natbr0
Reviews.Content: This was beautifully overstated and yet subtle. Our room was big overlooking the lagoon. We watched the street sellers plying their trade and the endless cat and mouse game between the african designer bag sellers and the police. Room service was efficient and not too surly. Hotel was peaceful excepet the beautiful reception where people seemed to endlessly stream in and out probably to admire the opulent decor. A perfect romantic hotel for couples. Although restaurant service was not very friendly and of course the hotel is expensive, much like Venice itself I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Top view is something to remember”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights, overall impression is very good, breakfast is served on the rooftop from where the view of San Marco lion and entire lagoon is something to remember for a lifetime. Few minutes walk to all important landmarks in Venice, the interior is excellent. I would try a different hotel when I visit Venice again, but I have no reservations in recommending this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld006
Reviews.Content: Greay experience at this hotel! As soon as we checked in the front desk took us to 3 different rooms and gave us our choice of the one we preferred. They were all a bit different but all had their own touch to them. Great start. The breakfast buffet was incredible. Wow! Let me warn you. This place is not the typical high end hotel. You have to remember that you are in Venice and that the hotel is old and historic. You cannot expect the Ritz Carlton somewhere! It's the historic feel with the touch of elegance that makes this place awesome! I hear that they have recently expaned the hotel and remodeled it. I can't wait to go back and see the new Danieli Exelsior

Reviews.Title: “Not a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Belinka
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Daniele for the second time. First was 5 years ago. At that time service was also not brilliant, but this time it was below all standards. We ordered a pick up from the airport, nobody met us, though the pick up was confirmed. When we finally arrived to the hotel the receptionist could not find our booking for 15 min. In the morning we spent 30 min to get a dental kit, that has been delivered only after second phone call . When we went for breakfast around 10 am there was a line of 12-15 people and it would have taken 30-40 min to get a table to have breakfast. So we tried to have breakfast in the bar. If you want to have a cup of coffee in the bar of hotel Danieli, you have to look for barman all around and then wait-wait-wait while he will bring you a cup of cold coffee, if to take into account that barman doesn't speak neither English nor French, the morning coffee is not the very pleasant experience. I do not think we will ever come back. Towels are old and worned, amenities are cheap, pillows are so hard as if they are made of rubber (where is the famous Starwood "pillow menu"?)

Reviews.Title: “First impressions did not impress me”
Reviews.Author: Onelifeliveit
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to stop by at the famous Danieli for a cocktail. It was always my dream to honeymoon here so I decided to try it out beforehand. The location is nice but very chaotic outside with canal traffic and tourists. Once inside, you are transformed into a whole different world. The decor is typical Venetian with gold, chandeliers, heavy drapes and tassles everywhere. Truly Breathtaking. But from there, everything went downhill. I imagined a member of staff rushing over to our aide but unfortunately we were left standing in the middle of the reception area. How strange, there were staff on the reception desk doing nothing and more standing around and not an ounce of customer care. I couldn't imagine going into The Ritz in London or Paris and expect such service. In the end, my friend and I decided to stroll around and see if we could find the bar. Once we found it, the service was unremarkable and completely unimpressive. The bar area also seemed a bit dark and dismal. I'm glad I tried out this place but I'm not impressed and would hate for these people to ruin my honeymoon. I'll try somewhere where I can expect decent customer service for expensive hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel -- very expensive all-around”
Reviews.Author: travLer2009
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is stunning and uniquely Venetian. The hotel sits on the mouth of the Grand Canal (not ON the Grand Canal) very close to St. Mark's square, so the tourist traffic is heavy. Inside of the hotel, you almost feel like you're in another world. We stayed in one of the older sections of the building and the room was extremely comfortable and well-appointed. The service was unbeatable. The food and beverage is extremely high-priced -- even by Venice standards -- but If you're staying here, you can probably afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Life is sweet in a doge's palace”
Reviews.Author: HappyGio69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Danieli for 3 unforgettable days: we got an upgrade through Amex to a suite (magnificent) and ended up paying a rather low (for Venician standards) â‚¬260 a night for 2 people with breakfast (on the stunning rooftop restaurant): worth every penny. The staff were just wonderful and helpful, the suite was perfect and the hotel is a true Doge's residence dating back to the Renaissance. The opulence is everywhere and it's conveniently located next to Piazza San Marco overlooking the Canal Grande. Make sure you ask for a room in the old part, as the newer building next door is not as charming. 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: swalwell7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Daniele for our honeymoon and we were very disappointed with the service. On arrival our room was not ready (which was fine as we were early) so we went and sat in the lounge bar to have a drink while we waited. We waited 10 minutes and no one came to serve us so we left to another bar down the road. when we did get into the room I emptied my pocket of British coins and left them on the dresser. When we came back after our first day I noticed approx Â£4 coins had gone missing. The next day we left 3 euro coins to see if our suspicions were right. When we got back 2 of the euro had gone missing. That same night we ordered ice for our champagne.... we are still waiting for it.! The hotel itself is very nice but if you are visiting lock away your money and do not expect good service. Venice is very nice though and we will definately go back but we will stay at hotel Bauer next time!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and snobbish!!”
Reviews.Author: SJMcLeod
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Danieli in Venice is truly beautiful but the service and concierge was terrible. When one first walks in to the Hotel Danieli you cannot help but be impressed bt how beautiful the hotel lobby is...it is truly stunning. But that is where our good impressions stopped. We called the hotel housekeeping for an iron and were told that the hotel did not supply irons but would do all pressings. But that person did not know how much it would be...and would send someone up with a price list. The pricelist never arrived and after 4 calls we decided to go out a bit rumpled. The Concierge was not helpful nor approachable with regards to queries about restaurants and or any other night life suggestions. Nor did they ever once say "bonjourno"! or "gratious". The hotel is beauiful but the experience was not. We ended up leaving a night early and going over to the Bauer Hotel - 3 blocks away - and were thrilled!! Right on the water as well and the staff were delightful! friendly and helpful! We will go back to Venice again as we loved it! But we will never go back to the Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: PMNEF
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of people on the site do not like the hotel. I think the problem is expectations. It's an old hotel with old decoration. The rooms have old decoration. However, I liked it very much. It almost takes you back in time and that is something I looked for when I went to italy. Rooms were a bit small, however, very clean and nicely decorated. The concierge was very helpful. I would stay here again if I went to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Amateur Hour”
Reviews.Author: LdnToTe
Reviews.Content: Why Hotel Danieli has such a brand name is beyond me. I spent last weekend there with my family and it was simply a huge disappointment from start to finish. No one greeted us when we entered the foyer although plenty of staff were standing around. They looked bored to death. Check-in took forever as the reception staff didn't seem to know what they were doing. Albeit spacey, the room was dusty, dark and noisy. The room service coffee pots were covered in what must have been a month worth of dust. The choice on the breakfast buffet was limited and the bread was not fresh. The fruit salad was good, though. Saturday night we wanted to have supper at the top floor restaurant. There wasn't one guest in the restaurant and only 2 tables had "Reserved" signs on them. Still the Maitre'd told us that we had to wait for 10 minutes so that she could check if we could have a table. We left. Sunday morning was a beautiful day and we wanted to have breakfast on the famous Hotel Danieli roof terrace outside the breakfast room. No chance. After we had sat down at a table a gentleman came to our table and introduced himself brusquely as "I am the General Manager and you're not allowed to eat on the terrace today". When we asked why, he just repeated his opening statement. We later found out that some of the staff were on strike. Having had first hand experience with the top guy, it's not hard to understand why. The staff that weren't on strike all came across as being totally demotivated. All in all, I think one should be allowed to expect much more from a Euro 1,000 per night establishment. Steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: guptavikash
Reviews.Content: Hotel is certainly in best location . Resturant seems to be very good , but we had very less option being strict Indian vegetarian . Service of hotel was ok not very great . Check in took us more than 30 mins , since staff was more interested to change shifts rather than attending guests . Except Conceirge and few staffs in resturant we faced lot of problem in language as English was not very common among staff . I feel there could be better options near by .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LillyDC
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in the rooms and service at the Danieli. We also stayed there several years ago and have been to Venice a number of times. We were disappointed to see how the rooms had deteriorated. Everything was very shabby. The service was very average - the staff were not friendly and even though we were the only people checking in and it took approx 25 minutes just to give us our key. However, the foyer is spectacular and the location is very central (also noisy). For the cost, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken1000
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about staying here because some of the other reviews had previously referred to snobby staff. We also needed to have 'proper' air conditioning, in many italian hotels they seem to refer to this when it's really only an internal fan with no cooling element. We stayed during a period of stupefying heat that even had the Venetians laying low, and I can confirm the aircon worked, and the staff were, without exception, extremely polite and helpful. We'd made some special requests when we booked and they met all of them, and also gave us a room with a fantastic view of the lagoon. Our suite was in the 'empire' style they refer to, you'll see pictures on their website, the walls are hung with silk rather than wallpapered, proper chandeliers in the rooms (of course) and the bathroom was huge and fitted out in black and white marble. The lobby and main rooms are really beyond description, they are absolutely beautiful. However, nobody pays a lot of money to stay in a hotel like this to be talked down to by the staff, and I'd have to say every single member of staff we spoke to from reception to cleaning staff, were exceptionally pleasant and helpful and the service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Back again our fav”
Reviews.Author: craigyd
Reviews.Content: Hi just got back again after 3 days at the danieli was not disappointed this is one of my all time favs had private transfer for airport book through hotel. the hotel has had some improvements since last year. the terrace restaurant which has the best views of the city has had a big make over. very nice food was good at night try booking b&b as its 50 euros for breakfast otherwise.â€¦ our room was a little tired after a word with the manager we were upgraded to the new part which is very nice more plush and what you would expect. my advice is ask for this part all marble bathrooms flat screens ect Another tip dont go on a gondola in day to hot and to many try at night around 1030 from other side of realto bridge see pic you will have venice to your self and great at mos Drinks around 10 euros coke and 19 euros g&t cocktail. go to the lido for free ask at desk as the hotel over there the western ex is very nice you can use there pool and beach if you want. any questions please ask Craig

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: vidaurreta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the hotel Danieli on July 9th and the experience was perfect from the moment we arrived till we left. We stayed at beautiful room 76 in the older building and it was perfect, great size and beautiful decoration! The staff was gracious and kind and helpful all the way. The hotel is stunning, I felt (and was treated) like Joan Collins! Congratulations to the Management for maintaining such a top notch hotel throughout the years. We are already planning to return (very soon I hope!). Grazie Danieli!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ljgs
Reviews.Content: Loved the Daneli. Stayed for 3 nights in June. We had two rooms which had just been renovated. Very comfortable, elegant with gorgeous marble bathrooms. Our room had a balcony overlooking the lagoon and grand canal. The balcony had a table and chairs. After a busy day of sightseeing it was a great place to relax. The staff were very attentive. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Venice”
