Now, the location is both positive, and you guessed it, negative. Right on the lagoon, easy access for the water taxis, the vaparetto stops...and throngs of pedestrians. It can get loud, early. When you leave the front door it's like rushing into a madding crowd of humanity. The old, very old, pallazo, is the place to stay. Yes, it's sort of dingy and musty....it is THAT old. The atrium/lobby/entrance is breathtaking. The pictures one sees is pretty much what you get. Amazing. The lobby's Bar Dandolo is magnificent, but a Mai Tai (my specialty, will cost you way too much). Oui, the Danieli is an expensive habit. Splurge, some, enjoy the decor, a lot. I thought service was fantastic. Speak a little Italian, it'll help. Room service is divine, try the club sandwich and tell me it's not the best in the world. It is, I eat them across them globe. The restaurant, ah yes. If the weather is nice, splurge on the terrace view. You shalln't find a more attractive vista in Venice. The food and the sevice? Not up to Luxury Collection standards. Venice has many fine restaurants, Al Covo for one, so get out and enjoy them. Overall, for sheer beauty and history the Danieli is hard to beat. It is expensive and it is "Venice". I mean to say, a bit quirky, a little rough in spots. It is not pristine, it shouldn't be, either. Stay in the palace "Dandolo" or the Casa Nuova wing. It's an old Venetian castle...luxurious, but frayed here and there. I'd go back in a second, unless the Gritti was available.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: GChia
Reviews.Content: It must be a joke that this hotel claims to be in the 5 star category. The opulent decor is well past its glory days and the place looks sad and faded. It's like an old courtesan who might have have once been beautiful but has stubbornly refused to relinquish her now garish clothes and retire gracefuly. The hotel is gloomy and smells musty and is in sore need of a good team of cleaning ladies. My friends and I ate lunch on the 4th floor terrace fully expecting to pay top prices for the extraordinary view. What we did not expect was the totally unpalatable food and the surly almost reluctant service. We knew that we would not be getting a spectacular meal in this tourist trap but with the prices they charge, polite table service and passably decent food surely is not too much to ask. 28 Euro for oil-laden pasta vongole and 40 Euro for sturgeon that was over-cooked and stuffed with a herbed moussoline which had all the taste and texture of a damn sponge. I have been to truck stops that serve better food! Outrageous - why do people rave about this place?? Why?Skip the Danieli and head for Club Cip where they know how to cook food and actually understand the concept of service. G Chia, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Awful place”
Reviews.Author: SunitaSnell
Reviews.Content: Apart from the great location, the hotel is terriby stuffy. The decor is worn and dated and ostentatious in a tacky sense. I do not understand how it can be labelled a 5 star hotel. The staff are rude and unhelpful and the restaurant, while it does have a great view, serves shockingly awful food deapite the prices they have the audacity to charge. Don't waste your money staying or eating at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: kaylagirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a dream trip to Italy with Tauck Tours. I've waited my whole life to see Venice and it was a 60th birthday gift. The Danieli is part of the History of Venice and yes, very expensive but it was part of the reason we chose to do a tour having never been to Europe let alone Venice. It's location, service and rooms were impeccable but i don't know if we could have afforded it if we were not part of Tauck... If you can....do it. Venice is magical and the Danieli is part of the magic! (Rooftop dining is wonderful but check to make sure they are serving outside. Inside is nice but very expensive and nothing special to look at.)

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: TheKatt
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE! from the rude staff in the entire hotel, who will not EVEN look at you unless you luggage is woth $$$$$, to the small over priced rooms. A hamburger is $48 euro! The staff have major attitude problems, and considering they are the employees who WORK there and not the guests who pay to stay there, it is totally unacceptable! Rooms are small, stale and completly outdated. Location is fabulous, IF you can get a room overlooking the canal. Beware, they are laying a new patio/walk way in front of the hotel, so be prepared to be woken at 7 AM by jackhammers! check with them directly to see if the construction is finished before booking ( not that I would book to stay there) There are many other hotels in Venice that would be happy to have you stay at their properties and would treat you as a paying customer should be treated. This hotel needs a major attitude adjustment!

Reviews.Title: “Danieli - Perfect location to experience the beauty of the city.”
Reviews.Author: mike reed
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is wonderfully situated on the waterfront just a 100 or so yards from San Marco and 50 from the bridge of sighs. There are stunning views across the lagoon and along the Grand Canal. It is without doubt a very romantic place. Although our room 285 (on fourth floor) was not located in the old building we still had a side view of the lagoon and San Giorgio. The room was clean, simply laid out and pleasant. The dÃ©cor had a touch of 17th century, which was befitting especially the fabric wallpaper. The beds were large and comfortable. The bathroom was also large, in many way too large considering the bath itself was just "normal" size, toiletries and robes supplied. There was also a dressing room that was useful. Room service was good and whenever we left the hotel the room was tidied and linen changed. The front office manager "Salvatore" was very helpful and obliging, as were the many concierges. The city:- Venice is not as big as you may initially imagine and it's not difficult to walk fully across it. There is always something to look at and visualise how Venice has grown up and how many famous luminaries have gone through the experience that you are now in. Initially though it takes a little while to get your bearings as you are more likely to concentrate on the architecture before you, rather than remembering how to get from a to b in the many bustling small lanes around the main sites. The main sites are pretty well sign posted though, and really its not a case of getting lost its just a case of finding a different way! Once you are a hundred or so yards away from any main tourist spot Venice quickly becomes even more slowly paced. Advise for comfort though you buy a map Euros2.5 at one of the many vaparettos stops. Venice is a place for mooching, chilling and enjoying the company you are in while being dazzled in a way that no other city on the planet can compare with. Tips :- The vaparettos are easy to hop on and off and without doubt are an excellent way to travel around the islands and up and down the Grand Canal. Plus shouldn't condone this but we were never challenged for a ticket at all, even though we'd each bought a 72 hour ticket at Euros25 each. If you donâ€™t have a ticket then I'm advised that they'll just charge you an extra Euro for that particular journey, individual journeys are euros5. As you leave the Danieli there are always guys offering you the chance of your own free motor launch to take you to Murano to see the glass factory. Take this opportunity, it is free and the launch takes you up the Grand Canal before travelling across at speed to Murano. There you will see glass being blown into wonderful shapes then you will be escorted around the many rooms of stylised glass. Itâ€™s a soft sell not pushy at all. If you donâ€™t want to buy then it's no problem. Then all you have to do is catch the vapaoretto back. Itâ€™s a good trip and allows you to see a bit more of the islands. There are many coffee and patisserie shops, just pop in one you like the look of and try some bruchetta or chocolate pastries which are excellent and wonâ€™t break the bank. Whereas eating and drinking at the restaurants situated on the Grand Canal can get a bit pricey. Go into some of the churches they are very ornate. If you donâ€™t like modern "art" give the Guggenheim gallery a miss. Who needs pretension when you are in Venice? Danieli value for money - Staying at the Danieli gives you a feeling of grandeur even though you may not be in the "old" part of the hotel. Regarding value for money well thatâ€™s up to individual to decide. For those that are not high rollers and are on a reasonable budget they possibly would think that it's overpriced especially drinks and food. You donâ€™t have to eat and drink there though, however the roof top restaurant is spectacular. All i can say is we enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Decor for Venezia”
Reviews.Author: oolah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Danieli for 3 nights. The location is perfect, just steps away from the Bridge of Sighs and around the corner from San Marco. It's an old style palazzo with all the gilding and excess that a Venetian hotel ought to have. Our room was in the 19th Century wing, with a view of a tiny canal where gondelieri passed each evening, some of them singing. It was a small room, but well designed, and with all the conveniences we needed, along with a lot of luxury detailing like a bathrobe and posh slippers. The concierge service was excellent. They were able to book us restaurant reservations, a special tour at the palazzo ducale, and train tickets for our destination. The only complaint was the rooftop restaurant. We knew it would be pricey, since it had a spectacular view of Venice, but they charged us 60 Euros for 2 cups of cappuccino and 4 croissants, which is utterly ridiculous. We wouldn't have eaten there had I known the price.

Reviews.Title: “Danieli Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plymouthtraveller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend arranged a surprise holiday for my 40th birthday in May to the Danieli Hotel. When you first enter the hotel, the decor just takes your breath away, it certainly left me speechless. We had a wonderful room, the sheer luxury of fabric on the walls and a spotlessly clean bathroom. The hotel even arranged champagne and chocolates to be brought to our room for my birthday. The level of customer service we experienced was faultless, nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. If you take the time to engage in a little conversation with the staff, (we tried a few Italian phrases,) you will find out about the history of the hotel and of the famous faces that have stayed there over the years. Many a morning we chatted to the friendly breakfast waiters as they prepared the tables. The view from the terrace where you eat is truly spectacular, looking out over the bay. We dined in the restaurant twice for dinner and the meals were delicious. We had both tried a pasta dish on our first visit and on my second i couldn't decide what to choose, so they brought me a plate with a bit of both. Also there were so many delicious desserts to choose, the waiter made a plate of a selection of them for me, it showed the personal touch and the attention to detail that is commonly missing at some of the larger hotels. It made me feel like I was somebody special and they really cared about our stay and how we enjoyed it. This was true in all of our dealings with all of the staff. The concierge was the man in the know and was always prepared to take the time to go through local maps and giving directions to places of interest. He helped with a visit to the casino for us, as well as telling us about the Danieli's sister hotel on the island of Lido. The hotel run a free watertaxi service between the hotels and I would recommend this as a great way to see the bay. Overall our experience at the Danieli was superb, we both can't wait to return. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: BBR31
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Danielli. I found the lobby to be beautiful, the rooms were large and the bathrooms some of the nicest in all of Italy. The lobby bar was our favorite after dinner hangout. The breakfast Terrace alone was worth our room rate at this hotel. The views are incredible. There were only two negatives about the hotel for us...the service was a bit stuffy. The staff was extremely attentive, but a bit arrogant. Also, we had bedbugs. We woke up to welts on our legs and actually saw with our own eyes a bedbug on our nightstand. Overall, we adored Venice and had a wonderful time at the Danielli.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional decor and top service.”
Reviews.Author: French_American
Reviews.Content: Memorable stay. Greeting at the reception on arrival was the quickest I' ve ever seen even though there were other people being helped by the reception staff. The decor and architecture in the lobby, stairs and hallways were extraordinary and quite interesting. Our room was very comfortable but smaller than what we were expecting however I must say that we received a promotional price much lower than the normal one during Carnaval. The bathroom disappointed me and I even recommended to Starwood that they change the marble tiles in the shower as they were showing some unattractive holes that didn't look natural. Also, I told them there should be some Murano glass in every room (chandelier for example) since we are in Venise and this is one of the Top hotels there. Breakfast was excellent, service very attentive, but they should upgrade their coffee considering the taste and the price we pay. I would strongly recommend the Danieli and I will certainly return in hopes of finding an even finer hotel with improvements in such a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Danieli”
Reviews.Author: luvmyitalia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 19th anniverssary at the Danieli in August. We used our Starwood points as we are members. Upon arriving, the reception clerk anticipated our request and literally had notes on our special occassion. I asked if we could possibly have a room with a view and I was told "wait till you see." We were escorted to our room 354 overlooking the Lagoon. Our room had a balcony where we enjoyed and savored Venice to it's fullest. Champagne, candies and flowers followed shortly. Upon arriving at Marco Polo Airport, our luggage was missing from Gatwick. This did not affect our moods as the Danieli was accomodating with personal necessities (i.e. toothbrush, toothpaste & shaving accessories.) And once our luggage was delivered the next day, the Danieli brought it up to our room immediately. The building we were in was the newer annex (300 yrs old). The room was spacious, well decorated and the bathroom was well equipped with modern ammenities such as separate toilet and bidet. The staff cleaned it twice daily as standard on 5 star hotels. Upon returning from our night out, we would find chocolates on our bed as part of our turn down service. We probably were annoying as patrons because we were constanly asking the concierge and receptionists for information, yet they gracefully took care of our needs as well as the many patrons at the time. The Danieli offered free water taxi shuttle to Lido Beach where we found the Westin and Hotel des Bains and also to Murano Island. The location was superb. It was in the heart of San Marco Square. And the best part, our points paid for our entire stay. We enjoyed the Danieli so much, we ended up extending our stay. The receptionist went as far as making the necessary phone call to make the arrangements for us. This is not our first time staying at a 5 star hotel, whether it be the Ritz Carlton, Westin Excelsior in Florence, Westin Paris or Hotel Arts in Barcelona, so we know the difference between good service and comfortable rooms. We would definitely recommend a return trip to the Hotel Danieli in Venice but keep in mind, for the age of the hotel and the location of where it's at, you may not experience some of the modern ammenities as expected in a newer hotel , but that's what makes it so charming. The Danieli is a piece of history.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that, not sure I would do it again tho.”
Reviews.Author: izzybizzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were taking a few days together for my birthday treat. I had dreamed of staying there after seeing the hotel in a film. Our room 202 was a side room with balcony and not much view. The decor was satisfactory if not a little worn, but that for me was part of the charm. The comfort of the bed and pillows for me were sadly unsatisfactory. The majority of the staff were very good and helpful but a couple of their concierge staff were rather the opposite. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a wonderful way to start the day altho the food was rather average by todays standards. We dined one evening up there and everything except the food was superb. I was extremely disappointed, and the price made it all the more distasteful. Nevertheless overall i'm glad i've sampled the Danieli hospitality altho I do think we'll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, great location, but so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: LKBeaverhausen
Reviews.Content: The Danieli is a lovely hotel, but it is not a modern hotel. We found the best parts of the hotel to be the gorgous lobby and the unbeatable location. All the water ferries stop right in front of the hotel and it is always easy to find your way back by following signs to San Marco. The rooms, however, are more historic than luxurious. The Starwood label may be misleading in that regard. Our lagoon view room was large, spacious and clean but definitely a bit worn (particularly the carpets), a bit outdated (particularly the bathrooms), and a bit uncomfortable. As the website indicates, the bed is simply two twins pushed together, so you have an uncomfortable lump in the middle, and the mattresses are standard fare - not the ultra comfortable mattresses that are fairly common now at luxury hotels. Additionally, we were there during a heat wave, and the poor air conditioner just could not keep up. All this being said, Venice itself is very much a living museum, and I am not sure that there are any more comfortable hotels with the same stellar location. If I were to go back, however, I would do more research on boutique hotels and other options instead of simply relying on the Starwood name. You can, after all, visit the hotel and have a lovely meal on the terrace without being a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Dumb to Stay in Danieli”
Reviews.Author: Value
Reviews.Content: Although well located with an impressive lobby, the place is clearly living on a reputation it no longer deserves. The prices are ridiculous and can in no way justify either the mediocre service, or the more mediocre rooms. Our room on the Grand Canal had a huge (I mean huge) water stain running down the wallpaper, a poorly working air conditioner, a chandilier with 4 of its 7 lights burned out, and a bed that clearly has not been replaced since the Danieli was built. There simply is no reason on earth to spend the sums demanded of this Hotel for a product that is not worth the price under any measure. If you think charm is broken furniture, lumpy beds, stained walls, poorly lighted rooms and poorly ventilated bathrooms with outdated amenities, not to mention a snooty staff, you'll enjoy the Danieli. If not, you would be well advised to go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Danieli ruined our trip to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a few miserable nights at the Danieli while stopping through Venice. The hotel was horrible! The complaints could go on forever, needless to say this was by far the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at! The staff was rude and unaccommodating, especially at Terrace restaurant which was extremely over priced to begin with. We were stuck in a smoking room when we requested a nonsmoking room. The receptionist claimed that it was a nonsmoking room, but there were two ashtrays in it, it stunk of smoke, and had two burns on the carpet along with numerous other stains. The room stunk, and the plumbing was horrible, our tub would back up, YUCK! The hotel is very poorly managed and disorderly. I can't believe this is a Starwood luxury hotel? The only nice thing I can say about it is the location is good, and the lobby is beautiful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, and hope that it is taken off the list of Starwood hotels! We were in room 115, steer clear of it if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Sheri76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Danieli at the end of May for our honeymoon. We wanted to book "the best" since it was a time for celebration, and we were not disappointed. The location is fantastic, right next to St. Mark Sq. Or room was enormous, nicely furnished, and clean. Cotton robes were supplied, but a bit stiff. We were worried about staying here after reading the mixed reviews, but the staff was very helpful. When we realized that the adapter that we brought did not fit their outlet we rang the conceirge and they immediately brought us a complementary adapter. We absolutely fell in love with the terrace...there is no better way to start the day off than to indulge in the scrumptious spread of food while drinking mimosas and coffee out on the terrace. The waitstaff were very accomodating and friendly as well. One thing that was a nuisance was the construction that was going on in front of the hotel. The drilling started at 7:30 in the morning which seems ridiculous to do given that you know people are staying there for a vacation and probably do not want to get woken up at the crack of dawn! Also, the prices are astronomical. We sat at in the lobby one night, ordered a piece of pie, a beer, and a glass of dessert wine and it came to 50 euro. There is absolutely no need for the prices they charge...but what are you going to do? We found everything was more expensive in Venice compared to Rome and Florence. If you would like a keepsake to remember your trip by I would suggest looking at the oil paintings by Giamberti in front of the hotel. They are amazing...and the price is right (100 euro for a 23 X 18 painting)!

Reviews.Title: “Rude, lazy, and unkempt...don't let it ruin Venice for you”
Reviews.Author: jamesbreeds
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a very disappointing trip to the Danielli. The staff were very rude. the porters were very lazy. The rooms are poorly maintained, with knocks and chips on all walls and surfaces. The hotel corridors are dirty and dark. When these faults were pointed out to the management, we were told all busy hotels are like that, and that our standards were too high. When we had taken photographs of the offending mistakes, we were threated by the manager. The photographs and a report of the incident have been sent to Westin headoffice. This seemed to infuriate the hotel manager further, who seemed more concerned with his own job than with our expensive and ruined trip. The city has such beauty and charm - stay at a hotel where you feel welcome and comfortable. I highly recommend the Palazzo Abadessa (see other reviews)

Reviews.Title: “Venice Hotels are different, Danieli is even more different”
Reviews.Author: joker59
Reviews.Content: As you can see the hotel reviews in Venice are quite different to other places. How this comes? Yep, Venice is a different place with a different charme and attidude. If you would see Tom Cruise walking around there it wouldn't bother you that much than in any other place. Venice is a star itself, Cassanova is alive - at every corner if you wish. However, we stayed our 4th time there in the Danieli. It was the best stay so far. OK starting with the negative side - Danieli's restaurant...if your stomache is on a tomato soup for entree, just be prepared to spend EUR 25.00 (USD 30.00) for a normal serve. That's insane, istn't it? Otherwise everything else is "normal" Venice" price, i.e. EUR 50+ for a nice steak, etc. On the other hand you can dine out in places for just normal prices (Italian range, not fast food nyc) and very, very good. Coming back to Danieli, the rooms are very nice, we had one facing the Canale Grande. Of course they are not contemporary, but what can you expect from a hotel room being located in a 400+ year old hotel?? My goodness, that's living history and not mcdonald's/microsoft/disney world standard. My ultimate recommendation....go to Venice in late November, stay at Danieli facing the Canale Grande, walk around all day in the cold weather, explore, watch, just take it in. I say NO Hollywood movie ever can give you that feeling of experiencing history and adventure, presence and future in one moment.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JoyInTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Danieli through Starwood for a single room "Taste of Luxury" three night special which included the breakfast. When I checked in, they asked if I wanted an upgrade at no additional cost. The room was in the palace and faced the small canal. This seems to be a major gondola canal, most of the tours ended below my window with the singer belting out the end of his song. I considered this a positive. The room wasn't anything special, but the service was great and the breakfast staff were very friendly. A couple of the waiters went out of their way to ensure this single traveller felt comfortable. And make sure you walk the stairs at least once up from the fabulous lobby. The first three floors have wonderful grand hallways, you almost feel like you're staying at the Doge's Palace. I also booked a watertaxi from the hotel for my return trip, only 36 euro and they pick you up from their landing.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent but...”
Reviews.Author: ww98
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night on business. For a 5 star "luxury collection" rating it was a dissapointment. Certainly the hall, the roof terrace and the location are magnificent but the rooms are old and overheated (cold not turn it off). The breakfast a dissapointment for the price and the service condescending. For those prices and that history I'd expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at the Danieli and loved every minute of it. The history, the charm, the romance, we fell in love all over again. Service was top rated and every one was extremely helpful. We toured the city and each night coming back to the hotel seemed like we were coming home. Our room faced the bay which added to the romance. We did not get a chance to use the pool facilities. Over all the experience was fantastic for us both in hotel accommodation, and service. Our only "getting used to" came when we reserved a king / queen bed, and they had put 2 beds together. I guess Europeans dont have king / queen mattress. We are going back and will stay at the Danieli again!!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated by 21st century standards and price!!”
Reviews.Author: cappucina
Reviews.Content: I wanted to see for myself how true TripAdvisor patrons mean about Danieli Hotel...it seemed like there's a mixture of love-hate reviews from those who have stayed there. Being in advertising and the marketing industry myself, I've always considered "5-star" ratings of anything (especially hotels) as that--a marketing tactic. I suggest that others should do the same. Also, another reason I appreciate this independent website. By American standards, it only takes one bug for the Illinois Department of Public Health to shut down a restaurant, this hotel management should think twice in regards to their customer service in a global market. With Venice representing as the crown jewel of Italy, its carat and color is devaluing real fast if establishments such as Danieli Hotel continue to live in the past. Their denial that they are in the "service" business, or lack of, for 21st century generation will eventually catch up in ways they will regret. More and more, patrons will expect their Yen, Euros, Dollars, etc. to equal with higher quality service and not with the arrogance of its staff. Yet this hotel's glitz and glamour are very dated. One can't live on beauty alone! I say, some of this hotel's famous past patrons are dead, the hotel should focus on how to keep the living to want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Livng Museum”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: The Danieli always receives mixed reviews. We were very apprehensive about reserving this hotel for our stay during August, 2005. We paid $1,500 USD for a suite and were really concerned having read such mixed reviews regarding this hotel. We are Starwood Preferred Guest platinum members. Upon check-in we were amazed to have been upgraded to the finest suite in the property, the Suite del Doge, which has a rack rate in excess of EURO 5,000 per night. With a bottle of champagne, huge fruit bowl and personal welcome from the GM awaiting us upon check-in. Very warm and cordial greeting and very much unexpected. The Suite del Doge is simply amazing. Like living in a museum. Stunning, beautiful and a once in a lifetime experience. Silk tapestried walls, fireplace, huge living room with mosaic inlaid floors, beamed ceiling. The historical touches were amazing. Was it perfect? No. This is a very old historical property and yes, it is in dire need of a serious renovation. The flaws and slightly gritty feel of the suite are part of the experience. The Danieli is a gem of a hotel meant for those who appreciate experiencing the unique opportunity of staying in a very historical property. Room service was deplorable. The food was mediocre at best and the prices were astronomical. Late at night they wouldn't even answer the phone in the room service department. The breakfast buffet upstairs on the terrace dining room is not to be missed. An incredible view of Venice and the Grand Canal. Great food and good service. The lobby bar is wonderful. Great drinks, good service and incredible people watching. The Danieli is a magical experience for those who appreciate history and grandeur. It is not for guests who expect great value for money spent nor is it for guests demanding Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons type of Service. I would recommend booking ONLY in the original historical section. The annex wings looked horrible. The original Danieli historical building houses the only rooms worth booking. For those demanding better service and a great historical atmosphere (yet renovated) Il Palazzo at the Bauer is fantastic. But it lacks the panache and historical zing of the beloved Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Open Your Eyes to the Danieli”
Reviews.Author: rayman2005
Reviews.Content: Any-one who looks at the pictures on the Danieli website can see how magnificent this hotel really is. For those who've complained, you have to understand this very beautiful hotel has hundreds of years of culture that's part of the Venetian way, hence the occasional carpet that is a treasure rather than "worn out." (Also, if you try learning just a little Italian, of course the Italian staff will respond to you better.) If you want the very best Venice has to offer, the secret is to get a suite at the Danieli, rather than the cheaper rooms some people have complained about. What is an extra 200 Euros when you will be dazzled by such beauty in the Danieli's suites that you'll never forget it? It's worth going to Venice just to see the stunning staircase in the Danieli - go to the website and see for yourself. The Danieli is the graceful beauty of a charming city.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Hotel Danieli”
Reviews.Author: AngelaLewis
Reviews.Content: Dont worry about other people's experiences just go and enjoy your own experience. By the way, if a hotel room is not acceptable then ask for another room as one of the other trip advisor reviewers did and get a very lasting experience. These people are here to serve us ... not us to serve them!! This is my view please read below. We have just returned from Venice Carnevale and after a year of worrying having read some of the reviews about this hotel we wondered what we were letting ourselves in for! For us, the experience was wonderful. I tried my hardest to find fault with the room, service, etc., but could only come up with praise. It was perfect. White fluffy towels changed daily. Crisp white bed linen changed daily. Clean. Staff were very helpful and not brusque as has been mentioned in other views. Welcome gift of chocolates and wine I can only imagine that some rooms must vary but hence so does the price! We paid around â‚¬400 per night including breakfast which was excellent. We did not have a "room with a view" but did have a balcony overlooking the street in the newer section of the hotel. It is in the BEST location next to St Marks Square. We toured some of the other 5* hotels and they did not seem as good as ours. We even asked to look in some rooms of other hotels and where available this was granted. Not a patch on what we had. So all I can say was for our experience it was perfect. May be we struck lucky with our room, I don't know, but I can sing 100% praise about the hotel, service, breakfast, comfortability. In fact, everything! I might just add that we are well travelled people and have stayed in a lot of 5* properties and this property will definitely be etched in our minds as a memorable one! OK the price of the food and drink is extortionate and we did not partake in any refreshment. At â‚¬21 per drink I think not!! if that is a criticism then that is the only one I can make. Thank you for taking the time to read this report and I hope it has been of help. .

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster rooms but awe-inspriing suites”
Reviews.Author: kirker
Reviews.Content: I'll start by stating that I've either stayed in or checked out the rooms at every five-star hotel in Venice. Curiously, the Danieli has the best *and* the worst of the bunch. I'm guessing that most of the TripAdvisor reviewers who've given the Danieli poor reviews stayed in the so-called "deluxe" rooms in the newer wings of the hotel (most of which don't face the lagoon). That's how I started my stay there as well, and I was frankly shocked at both the poor, worn-looking condition and lack of "white-glove" cleanliness of my room, not to mention its general lack of luxury compared with the posh pictures in the Danieli's marketing materials. It was cramped, dank and altogether tired. You can find vastly superior accommodations for the same price at every other hotel in the Danieli's price range, so I would strongly recommend staying elsewhere if your budget limits you to rooms under â‚¬400/night. There was a strong stench in the room as well, and I eventually figured out that the minibar fridge was broken and something inside had spoiled. I immediately went down and asked to speak to the manager and insisted (nicely) that I couldn't sleep there that night. At first he said the hotel was fully booked, but then he finally relented -- after some hesitation, for reasons that will make themselves clear in a second -- and said that although they indeed didn't have any rooms available for the two consecutive nights of my stay, they had one accommodation free that evening ... specifically the second-largest suite in the original palazzo part of the hotel. I agreed to stay there one night and relocate the following one. What followed was one of THE most memorable hotel experiences of my life. Words honestly fail me in describing the beauty of the palazzo suite, which consumed a good 1500 sq ft over several rooms. Intricate inlaid mosaic tile floors; jaw-droppingly ornate antique furniture and Murano glass chandeliers; delicate damask silk bedspread with matching damask-covered walls; beautiful mahogany doors and bed hardware; and what has to be one of the most stunning lagoon views in the city. I almost cried when I had to relocate the next day, but happy that I was able to stay even if only for one night in a room that normally cost seven times the â‚¬300 rate I was paying. While I'm certain that they don't regularly upgrade people dissatisfied with their standard rooms to their second-nicest suite (I gather only the Royal Suite tops it), I was happy they did so in my case! So, I guess my summation would be as follows: if you can afford â‚¬700 and up for a room or suite in the palazzo part of the hotel, go for it. Your experience will be a wholly memorable one. The junior suites aren't as large as the one I was in, but the decor is just as sumptuous. If your budget restricts you to the hotel's newer, 20th-century-built wings, or if you consider the idea of a â‚¬20 cocktail an affront to your sensibilities, you'll be much better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Sanced
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Danieli during the Carnaval 2006. Although it is a Palace, we found it too expensive for what you finally get for your money. OK Daniel has a historic background... but does it justify the price? The size of the room was fine but the bathroom wasn't what we should expect from a "luxury collection hotel". You almost had to shower in 30 cm of water because it wasn't flowing out as it should be. Toilets were also defect. In the morning only cold water was available. If we have to stay in Venice again, we would definitely try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A most romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: Neuforce
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli was up to our expectations - and Venice too! Perfect service in an aoutstanding frame. Go and experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Danielli”
Reviews.Author: Elaine Bull
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the Danielli for his Christmas present 28 - 31 Dec 2006. The hotel is beautiful and welcoming. Our room was clean and nicely presented and fully stocked with everything we needed. The concierge was very helpful and so were all the other staff. The mini bar was a bit expensive but aren't they all in the hotels. I was worried by what I had read on trip adviser before going to the hotel but need not have been. I certainly will be going back and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Danieli is a special place!”
Reviews.Author: critterchick
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Danieli this week! We are Starwood Gold members, and had booked the hotel on points. Upon arrival, we were informed that we had been upgraded to a junior suite. No view of the lagoon, but a full bedroom/living room setup with two bathrooms. What a treat! Service was impeccable, from a warm greeting at reception to mostly very helpful concierges. We were referred to one restaurant that was overpriced (even for Venice), but the food was very good. The bed was firmer than we're used to, but we slept like logs. Towels were fluffy (and warm thanks to the towel heater), the room was made up promptly every morning, other than one morose cocktail waitress everybody was quite friendly. Drinks in the lounge were pricey, but a glass of wine was 7 euro and my port was 10E, so we were fine with that. We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Danieli”
Reviews.Author: Hopewelltraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Danieli in August during a ten-day trip to Italy with our three children (11, 16, 19) and found the hotel to be over-priced and the staff indifferent at best. The accommodations were spacious, but the furnishings were old and the beds were not comfortable. We had just stayed at the Westin in Florence, which was fabulous - and we expected to get the "heavenly beds" at the Danieli, since they are part of the same chain. Big disappointment! As an aside, our kids thought the hotel's lobby and staircases looked like a cross between Disney World's Tower of Terror and the Haunted Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay ther”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for two nights in August. We had just arrived from the Savoy in Florence (excellent hotel) and were horrified at the shabby state of our room. The room was dark with a musky smell, the bathroom amenities medicore at best and the hotel personel arrogant and rude. For the price you can do much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Danieli”
Reviews.Author: j-i-m-05
Reviews.Content: Like others, we were really looking forward to our stay at the Danieli. Neighbors recommended it and reported it to be wonderful. For our visit, it was not. Upon our arrival we were shown to our room, only to discover upon opening the door that the bed was not made and, at 4 in the afternoon, the room had not been cleaned after the prior guests' departure. Alternative rooms were offered, but of lesser quality, dark and oddly shaped rooms. Our first dinner on the famous terrace was marred by the rudeness of a waiter who rolled his eyes and made an audible "tsk" at my spouse's simple request that he explain the desserts arrayed on the cart. Other staff, such as the bellmen, were mechanical and, as one other reviewer reported, pompous. We observed cob webs on a chandelier on the main stair in the famous lobby, and also on the light fixtures in the famous lounge where tea (and those expensive drinks others have decribed) is served. The Danieli did not live up to our expectations. The manager should be replaced with a manager who can actually manage a staff and instill in them a sense of respect and care for guests. Our experience at this hotel was quite different that at other hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away.....stay FAR away!”
Reviews.Author: Annie1128
Reviews.Content: What we thought would be the romantic Grand Finale of a 2 week whirlwind tour of Italy and Greece celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary turned out to be a Grand Disaster! Upon arriving in Venice via way of the Grand Canal, one can easily be enamored with its architectural and historical beauty. We were in awe just being in â€œVeniceâ€�. Seeing for the first time what weâ€™ve only seen in movies and postcard pictures. That feeling completely evaporated the moment we checked into the Hotel Danieli. We booked this hotel as the Grand Finale of our trip, choosing to spend that extra money for 2 special nights, one being our 1st wedding anniversary. At 600USD a night, I expected a lot more than what we were offered. First, one would expect that a hotel member of the Starwood Luxury Collection would have to adhere to some simple standards. One being a clean room, void of dirt, dust, cracked mirrors in the bathroom and bedroom, cracked glass on the room desk, filthy curtains, and mold on the shower curtain and in the shower. Apparently not. Once I complained about the condition of room, we were offered the option of relocating to another room the following day because all other rooms were already booked. As we were only staying 2 days and were sick of schlepping and repacking our luggage, this seemed ridiculous to do for one night. So we opted to stay in our crappy room since we couldnâ€™t be moved any sooner than the following day. The hotel manager (the nicest person we actually encountered at this hotel) then offered to give us Â½ off our stay which we accepted. Then we decided to cool down with some drinks in the lobby. At 16 Euro for a Bellini and 21 Euro for a Gin and Tonic, I wanted to choke. I mean I know Venice is expensive, but come on. The wait staff were borderline rude and mechanical, like Venetian robots. I have to say that Venice is the most inhospitable and cold place I have ever visited. After choking down our 40 Euro drinks we proceeded to the Concierge to make dinner arrangements for our anniversary that evening. Only to be treated like 3rd class citizens because we were unaware that this special Feast of the Redeemer was going on and dinner arrangements at any restaurant with canal views were at 400-500 Euros per person. <<GULP>> There goes that idea. We ended up at a mediocre and overpriced restaurant in one of the many piazzas settling for an experience that fell way below what we had hoped for on our anniversary in what claims to be one of the most romantic cities on the planet. Upon our much anticipated departure from Venice the Danieli quoted us 3 different prices for a water taxi to the airport only to get to the airport and have the boat captain tell us another price. At this point we just wanted to get home and were tired of haggling and being treated like dirt, so we paid our last 100 Euros to the city we would like to leave far behind in our memories. Granted we went during a terribly crowded time of year and probably the most crowded weekend of the summer, but I would still never go back. I compare Venice with a beautiful womanâ€¦a woman with much exterior beauty, but lacking heart and soul (quite smelly too). Once you crack the shell, there is little appeal. So I guess the Hotel Danieli can be seen as a complement to the city really. I wouldnâ€™t waste my time or money. There is much more to Italy than this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: EuropehereIcome
Reviews.Content: Hotel Danieli is the best hotel we have stayed in, and we have stayed in many 5 star hotels. Do not listen to the other posts! We used the hotels private water taxi from the airport for 50e. We arrived and our room was not ready, so we were treated to the famous Bellini's and appertizers in the beautiful bar! 15 min later we were taken to our room, on the second floor right in fronmt of the building with a waterfront view! The room was beautiful. The only negative, was the bathroom had a musty smell, but that is to be expected from an old hotel. We did not particularliy like Venice, so this hotel made up for it!! The next morning we went to have a cappucino in the terrace restaurant and when I asked for the check, he told me we pay next time! Rarely have I ever received anything complimentary! I do believe we received such good service because we booked the hotel with American Express Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “A truly horrible hotel....a travesty really”
Reviews.Author: Johnb8
Reviews.Content: They must be joking!! This is AT BEST a 3 star hotel......and a badly managed one at that. With all due apologies to those who wrote good reviews of this dump.....I can only wonder if you may have been caught up in the undeniable romance of Venice.....and been blinded to the astoundingly bad service and room quality of this vastly overated and overpriced snake pit. First......the rooms. Their excuse for ANY complaint about the run down condition of the place was "it's a very old, historic hotel". Right. So this means you can't shampoo the carpets in the rooms? I was afraid to walk barefoot in our room. The carpets were filthy......the paint was dirty as hell in many places.....it really looked as though NOTHING had been done to the room for 10 years. And the fact that it's a historic hotel prevents them from putting in decent beds? I've still got a back ache from the cheap, saggy mattress in our room. And the fact that it's an old, historic hotel means they can't give you decent sheets? You get the cheapest, scratchiest sheets you can imagine. I'm not joking.....it was like being in prison....the sheets were almost like sandpaper....I don't remember EVER feeling sheets that were so scratchy. To think that this hotel is owned by the same chain that owns the Westin hotels...which have the best bedding in the business...in beyond the imagination. Ok...suffice it to say that the rooms are a disaster (at over $500US per night, I should add). How about the service? Again....words can't do justice..... Let's start with the phones.....on THREE occassions I tried to call downstairs to get some info...all three times I tried the hotel operator, the front desk, and finally the concierge. NO ANSWER. I was totally ignored. My wife tried while I was in the shower and had no luck with the hotel operator or the front desk....but finally (on her fourth try) got an answer from the concierge. Even at a Motel 6 you will get an answer when you dial the operator. It seems that they just can't be bothered to pick up the phone. The hallways are full of VERY worn out carpets...and really look like some cheap old flop house...not a 5 a 4 a 3 or even a 2 star hotel. Amazing really. While down in the lobby bar...which is indeed very pretty....as one would expect from a building that 500 years ago was a palace....I was having a Gin and Tonic. This cost me $25.00. This is not a misprint, I said twenty five dollars for a Gin and Tonic. Perhaps I could live with this if not for the haughty and even distainful service offered by the "waiters". It's like they have a pre-rehearsed drill....you ask them a question....like...."what sort of nibbles can we order"...and they talk to you quickly...moving away from you all the time as though they have someting MUCH more important to do (and this while we were virtually the only people in the joint). I had to get up to go to the bathroom, and not wanting to go all the way up to our room I went to the public bathroom on the ground floor. Big mistake. Dirty.....and I don't just mean a little dirty.....I mean old, stained paint on the doors that nobody had bothered to clean in a VERY long time. No paper towels in the container to dry my hands. My wife had to go a little while later and reported not only the above complaints about the Ladies room, but also no toilet paper!!. She stopped at the front desk to complain on the way back to the table and was told "We can't check all the time, a lot of people use it". Jesus. It really sounds like I have some sort of grudge against this place, but the truth is we were VERY hopeful that it would be good and tried valiantly to find something good about the place. But the simple fact is that it is the DEFINITION of tourist trap. I've stayed in 5 star hotels in over 30 countries and this is not just the worst of all of them...but the worst by 500 miles. I can't even think of which one would be next up the ladder......the Danieli is so far "ahead" in the race for rock bottom. We went up with two friends to try dinner on the famous Terrace restaurant on the roof. We actually *were* treated quite well there....friendly and attentive waiters and hosts. The food, however, was only so-so. Not bad, by any means....but at $45-$50 for an entree, you expect a much higher standard of cooking. No artistry in the presentation.....little if no skill exhibited in the sauce department....just standard...."throw the lamb chop on the grill and slap it on the plate" fare. Overall, I can say without ANY doubt that this is the single worst hotel experience I've ever had......and I've had a few real doozies, believe me. If you stay in this pest hole you will only have yourself to blame. Venice is a tourist trap in general...with a LOT of very bad food and service...all at very high prices.......but the Danieli is the leader of the pack when it comes to *completely* focusing on how much money they can get out of you while doing the absolute *least* amount of work possible. Venice is beautiful, but I'm beginning to think it's not worth the bother. I've been three times now, and I doubt I'll go back. If you do go, I'd either get a very cheap 2 star hotel (it won't be any worse than the Gritti Palace or Danili, and at least you'll only be paying $100 a night, so you won't be terminally offended...or perhaps, if you insist on spending more for a "luxury" hotel...you could stay at the Monaco & Grand Canal...which actually is pretty good (within the greater context of the Venice hotel market.....don't think for a second that you'll like it as much as a *real* grand hotel.....like the Ritz in London, the Shangri-La in Bangkok, the InterContinental in Hong Kong, etc). So what did I find nice to say about the Danieli? Well.....it *is* in a very handy location...this can't be denied.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the banks of the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located at the S. Zaccaria water taxi stop making it easy to reach from the train station. The interior is beautiful, but a little tired - like many of the older Ritz Carlton's in the States. General Manager was terrific - was available to welcome us upon arrival. Fabulous VIP amenities. Lounge is very expensive - 20 Euro for a mixed drink is a little excessive. Guest room bathroom was wonderful - entirely done in marble with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip of a Lifetime Hotel in Venice - treated us like royalty.”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: After booking I was a little worried about the negative reviews on TripAdvisor about Danieli's poor service, small rooms, high prices, lumpy beds and pillows, etc. From my vantage point all were unfounded, except the pricey thingy. It seems strange that the review on the Danieli are all over the map. My only complaint was the only English TV was CNN and BBC, and sometimes an english movie on Skyservice. I had booked a mini suite and it was in the 'new' building (350 years old) and it was exquisite, on floor A and faced the water, boats, and all. Close the windows, no noise - open them and the whole world seems to be out there having loads of fun. We were using Starwood points for this stay, so don't really know what it would cost - but we were certainly treated as paying customers by everyone. Check in was easy and fast - we were tired from the train ride from Florence - and there was a bottle of free champagne waiting, along with a specialty box of chocolates. While there a special services rep came in to fill a large bowl with Lindt chocolates that try as I would wouldn't empty by the time we left. The turn down service left even more chocolates - a totally different kind. Quite different from the Westin Excelsior in Florence where we got nothing 'extra' even with turn-down. We were in the Danieli palace and treated like the king and queen from the moment we arrived. Rumour has it the Danieli is being purchased by Marriott. Dinner in the hotel dining room was a bit of a shocker for 212 euros for two...the main culprits being booze: rum & coke 21 euros, manhattan 16 euros; water 8 euros; cover charge 16 euros (for 2). The dinner was a mixed fish platter for two (98 euros) which was outstanding (I'm not a fish eater either) and had scampi, sole, monkfish, seabass and fresh salad. The service was great and we were told that if we wanted to tip anything additional to please do it with cash...all restaurants seem to do that in Italy. I'd go back to Danieli and have the same meal again - only with just wine (37 euros). This hotel has location, location, location. Every main sight is nearby and you can walk to the Rialto quite easily. There is something special about Venice in spite of the fact everyone tries to rip you off. The water taxi should have been 45 euros, but ended up at 80 for the 'Grand Canal route' from the train station. The water taxi to the airport was 90 euros plus another 25 euros for porters to help us with heavy bags and drive to the airport from there (about a 10 min drive). I bought a DVD of Venice in a shop only to find when getting home it was a counterfeit copy made on somebodies computer, but it worked. There is a Venice day life and a night life - don't miss either, especially at St. Mark's area. Safe and fun...and a great king bed (2 singles joined) with great pillows, we slept like babies. Don't miss it, but be good friends with your bank manager.

Reviews.Title: “Venice was Danieli for us.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! very expensive though, however if money is not object then it is a must stay. I will never forget the breakfast on the terrace...how much did it cost- who cares!!! (like I said if you have the money to throw away-throw it) The views from breakfast were the most spectacular I have ever seen. I will remember forever. Was it comfortable, not sure if 2 twins stuck together as a king was so great, was the staff warm and fuzzy...no, did I over pay because I was possibly an American...most definatly, would I stay again...yes.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JJW63
Reviews.Content: I had checked this hotel out on this website prior to staying. It is a matter of buyer beware. I can not account for others but my experience was wonderful. I was a little alarmed on arrival to find the lobby full of luggage and the front desk beseiged with people waiting to check in (a large group had just arrived and another was leaving). The front desk manager greeted me and took me away from this chaos to my room. Take the new wing much quiter and in a way nicer (less idiosyncratic) than the old. All staff were wonderful. I had a lagoon view room and walked in to see a beautiful room with a terrace and the most amazing view. Left immediately to explore and noted that the huge chaos of just 20 minutes ago had dissipated. When I returned the Hotel had left a gift of wine and fruit in my room. Whilst it is a bit on the expensive side it is fully justified when you consider its location and those views. I think those that complain on here about the prices dont normally stay at Hotels like this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Danieli really isn't a bad hotel, but it is overpriced. The Danieli is a very historic hotel and as a guest it is nice to be able to look around this hotel at your lesiure. The building is very old, charming the atrium is lovely, and it has a lovely writing room. The restaurant on the top floor has a beautiful view, and that alone makes it worth having a breakfast up there. On the down side, many of the hotel staff seem very moody, as if to bring this room service order to your room has really put them out. I got this message continually from staff. At the 50 Euro breakfast service was non-existant. I eventually made eye contact with a waiter, who then rushed off in the opposite direction when it was obvious that I might ask him for something, such as another coffee. The "hot" food at the breakfast was also lukewarm/cool. My room was nice, comfortable. The bathroom was in dire need of refurbishment. Everytime you walk into the hotel, if you are dressed casually (as you tend to be in summer), the staff stop you until you explain that you are a guest. But the hotel is very central, and very close to St Marks Brasillica, and of couse, Harry's Bar! The Danieli is not a bad hotel, but very expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Too Tired For My Taste”
Reviews.Author: rome1
Reviews.Content: magnificent building and lobby, but to say our room-- in the original building-- was tired would be too kind. while it had nice antiques, it was very run down. bed was lumpy and bathroom was not clean and repairs were home made. we paid upwards of $800 US and at that price I expected more, even understanding hotels in venice can be tied. staff was not particularly friendly or helpful. concierge sent us on a trip to a glass factory at murano, which the hotel shills for, but which we wanted to do anyway. Fine, OK-- but they made a really hard sales pitch a la a time share sales pitch and you basically felt trapped unless you buy something...not really what you expect from a 5 star hotel that you are paying nearly a grand for a night. we will stay somewhere else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at the Danieli for some time - last one on my tick list of the Cipriani, Bauer Palazzo, Gritti Palace and Monoco & Grand. Stayed here between Christmas and New Year 2004. It is true the lobby is spectacular and the lounge is also very charming in a 'faded grandeur deopping to bits kind of way'. We had to wait an age at reception whilst the miserable clerk fumbled his way around the new computer system. Our room was at least in the original palazzo though it was a bit tatty - the bathroom reminding me of a home-made addition. Staff were cordial, breakfast was satisfactory but certainly not worth 62 Euros each and the restaurant is vastly overpriced for the ambeance and the quality of the food. Much better to eat at the Londra Palace just a few Palazzi along - where the food was exceptionally well priced and of much better quality. I agree with previous reviewers that the Bauer is better value for money - however I will return to an old favourite (the Kette) when I am next in Venice. Beware the concierge offering a free private water taxi to Murano - once there you are subjected to a tour of the glass factory (which was interesting for about 5 minutes) - then the hard sell of buy some glass - if you ate not interested, they palm you off with a free vaporetto ticket for the public transport back. You need to kick up all hell to get a free water taxi - fortunately for us, some poor-willed sour spent over $4000 on a mirror - well there must be one born every day!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: jillywade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Danieli for 3 night during our honeymoon in Sept. 00. The hotel staff was very nice. The room was beautiful and had a balcony overlooking the grand canal. Everything was perfect and we also had a celeb sighting in the lobby lounge, Mick Jagger!! It was the perfect end to a wonderful honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Venice and we had always wanted to try the Danieli, even though we had stayed in the past at the Bauer-Gruenwald, which we loved. We know from past experience never to expect a hotel room to be ready early in the morning, so since we arrived at 8:00 AM we were not surprised to find out that our room was not ready. The staff invited us to wait in the lobby, but since we only had a day and a half to spend in Venice, our favorite city, we left and returned at noon, when we were told our room would be ready. We did return at noon, only to be told to come back again in a half and hour. To make a long story short, we continued to return every half an hour until 5:00 when we felt the need to get aggressive with the person at the front desk, who not only did not apologize for requiring us to continue to return every half an hour for six hours, but only said they did not have enough help to clean the rooms. Since we were in Venice in October, and had made our reservations 10 month prior to our trip, I think it is unbelieveable that a five star hotel would not be aware of how many rooms would be need for those days and have enough employees there to ready the rooms. When we finally got our room (in the old section, which we requested), we were very disappointed in the quality of the room. It was small and dark, and cost $675 American. We were more than prepared to pay that price to stay at a hotel with the reputation of the Danieli, but we feel it was too much money to spend in this instance since the hotel clearly did not live up to its reputation. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels in the past, and this was the worst room we have ever stayed in in a hotel of that caliber. We did not request another room primarily because the staff was so unaccomodating to begin with. In the future, when we visit Venice will gladly return to the Bauer, which is a wonderful hotel, and does live up to its reputation. Although the lobby of the Danieli is lovely, I would advise anyone considering this hotel to reethink their choice or not have expectations that are too high.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Danieli
HotelInfo.Address: Castello, 4196 | Riva degli Schiavoni, 30122 Venice, Italy
